loans.name: Raghda

texts.en:
Raghda A., a 39-year-old married woman, wanted to help her husband in supporting the family, so they decided to open a Mini-Market. “Hamada Mini-Market” is the name of their store. It has been serving a wide area for two years now. Customers have came up to Raghda’s husband (since he is the one working at the store) and asked him to add more variety to their products. In order to satisfy their customers, Raghda applied for this loan to buy more products for their store and to improve the decoration of the shop.

Raghda is a conservative person who didn't want her photo published on the internet. So, her husband appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy more products for their Mini-Market and to improve the decoration of the shop.

loans.name: Aisyah

texts.en:
Aisyah is a 43 year old lady and married toYusran, a crops seller. They are living in Oeba Village and have been blessed with 4 children, namely:
-	Jefry, 19 years old who is studying in University
-	Ricky, 18 years old and graduated from Senior High School
-	Amir, 5 years old
-	Akbar, 1 year old
Aisyah has a kitchen equipments business. She initiated this business using her own capital to support her husband in generating money for their family. She has been running the business for 4 years. The business is operated in Oeba Market. She rents a small area for her business which costs her IDR 300,000 per year. 

Aisyah needs to add more equipment at her business to meet the demand of her customers. To do so, Aisyah doesn’t have enough capital so she is requesting a loan of IDR 4,500,000 from TLM. She plans to spend the loan on kitchen equipments such as the water pot, rice cooker steamer, frying pan with different sizes, and also plastic and glass plates. She hopes that TLM will assist her with the loan.

loans.use: To purchase kitchen equipment to sell such as the water pot, rice cooker steamer, frying pan with different sizes, and also plastic and glass plates.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase clothes to grow her business and meet the demand by her customers.

loans.name: Charity

texts.en: Charity S. 45 years old.  She is currently in the business of selling vegetables.  She will use the loan to stock more vegetables.  Charity is married to a farmer and they have six children in school.  Her future goal is to open a big shop.

loans.use: stock more vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna F. is from Sta. Rosa, Gamu, Ilagan, Isabela. She is 50 years old. Lorna is married and has 3 adult-aged children. To make a living, Lorna owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting a variety of vegetables for sale. Lorna has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Lorna joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lorna has successfully repaid a previous loan of 13,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. Lorna is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. This loan will be the 8th loan taken out by Lorna from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise.

loans.name: Tuyatsetseg

texts.en: Mrs.Tuyatsetseg is 32 years old, lives with her husband and three children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. All three kids goes to secondary school. Tuyatsetseg’s family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Tuyatsetseg is hair dresser and she has been working for a beauty salon since 2006 and she is the only bread winner in the family. Her husband is currently unemployed. He sometimes does a laborer job on a construction site on a casual basis. Tuyatsetseg is planning to buy a family car and she wants her husband to run a taxi business, because a taxi business is quite profitable at the moment in Ulaanbaatar city. Her savings is 2,500,000 MNT which is around 2000 USDs at the moment. To buy a car she needs an extra 1200 USDs which she is asking to borrow from us. The money will be used to buy a car and to use it for a taxi business, giving chance to her husband to earn some extra income for the family.

loans.use: To buy a car and to use it for her taxi business, giving the chance for her and husband to earn some extra income for their family.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria is currently in a business of selling fish. She is 20 years old, married, with two children and one of them goes to school. Victoria borrowed a loan to stock more fish to sell. She hopes to expand her business in the future with extra profits.

loans.use: stock more fish to sell.

loans.name: 6 Đông Hải Group

texts.en:
"Phượng N. Thị (5) is a 51 year-old female living in the town of Thanh Hoá.  Phượng is the group leader of a 3-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is 6 Đông Hải (16-02-6 Đông Hải).


Phượng is married and has two adult-aged children.  To making a living, Phượng owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising cattle for sale.  Phượng has been engaged in this business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3,000,000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2004, Phượng joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Phượng has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,248,000 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future.  She is now requesting a new loan of 5,787,900 VND which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future.  The loan will be the 9th loan taken out by the borrower from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Phượng  plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  N. Thị Vẹn (44) is a 54 year-old female who is requesting a 5,787,900 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.


2.  B. Thị Thấu (17) is a 60 year-old female who is requesting a 5,787,900 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.


About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Phượng  N. Thị (5) là 51 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Thanh Hoá.  Phượng  là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 3 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 6 Đông Hải (16-02-6 Đông Hải).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ chăn nuôi gia súc để bán.  Phượng  thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 10 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Phượng  kiếm được khoảng 3,000,000 VND.  Vào 2004, Phượng  đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Phượng  đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 4,248,000 VND từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua gia súc còn nhỏ để nuôi & bán sau này.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 5,787,900 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 9th khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  N. Thị Vẹn (44) là 54 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5,787,900 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


2.  B. Thị Thấu (17) là 60 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5,787,900 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: Tumalu

texts.en: Tumalu B. 23 years old, and is currently in a business of selling at a Food Market.  She will use the loan for stock more Food . She is married to a business man and they have two children, but only one goes to school.  Her future goal to build a house.

loans.use: Stock more Food.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace B. is thirty eight years old, and married. Her husband runs a tailor shop and they have four children aged between twelve years old and three years old whom they hope to give good education at the university level.  Her business is located at a residential area known as Mukuru Kwa Njenga and she is served by the Kitengela branch. She sells kales, cabbages, tomatoes, onions and others to the local people a business she has engaged in for the last twelve years. She says that this business is profitable and the only major challenge she has is financial constraints. However, she works very hard to keep her business doing well. She is using her loan of Kes 20,000 to buy more fruits and vegetables to grow her business. She describes herself as an ambitious and humble lady.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables to grow her business.

loans.name: Cicilia

texts.en: Cicilia is currently in a business of selling green vegetables. She is 40 years old, married, with five children, all of whom go to school. Cicilia borrowed a loan to stock more green vegetables to sell. She hopes to build a concrete house in the future with the extra profits from her business.

loans.use: stock more green vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Josie

texts.en:
Josie P. is from Sta. Rosa, Gamu, Ilagan, Isabela. She is 36 years old. Josie is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Josie owns and operates a business venture in the transportation sector providing motorcycle services. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from operating tricycle transport services. Josie has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Josie joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Josie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to repair existing vehicle for better service. Josie is requesting a new loan of 20000 PHP which will be used to purchase tires and other accessories. This loan will be the 7th loan taken out by Josie from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase tires and other accessories

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary O., 30 years old, is currently in a business of selling maize.  She will use the loan to stock more maize.  Mary is married to a farmer and they have four children, two of them are in school.  Her future goal is to buy a domestic animal.

loans.use: stock more maize for sale.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce is currently in a business of selling maize grain. She is 40 years old, married, with five children, all of whom go to school. Joyce borrowed a loan to stock more maize grain to sell. She hopes to expand in the future with extra profits from her business.

loans.use: stock more maize grain to sell.

loans.name: Maimuna

texts.en: Maimuna  is forty seven years old. She is single and has one daughter aged twenty one years old. Her business is located in South C and it is well known as Mariam's Boutique. Maimuna is served by the Kitengela branch. She sells clothes to the local people, a business she has engaged in for the last six years. She has managed to give employment to one person who helps her to run the business. She says that this business is profitable and the only major challenge she has is financial constraints. However, she works very hard to keep her business doing well. She is using her loan of Kes 60,000 to buy more clothes to grow her business and meet the demands of her customers. In the future, she hopes to be a wholesaler. She sees herself owning a residential house and rental units that will be bring in income. She describes herself as hardworking, honest, and punctual.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to grow her business and meet the demands of her customers

loans.name: Taghreed

texts.en:
Taghreed G. is the mother of three children, and her husband works at a governmental institution during the day. Taghreed is well-known for her delicious sweets among her friends and neighbors; that’s what gave her the motivation to start her business 10 years ago.

Taghreed felt the need of having a small business to be able to help her husband with their monthly income, so they bought all the equipment that she needs to be able to make her sweets and sell them. During these 10 years she has been able to have a wide customer base by only word of mouth.

Now Taghreed has applied for this loan to buy a van to use for distribution, so she can reach more areas to sell her sweets.

loans.use: To buy a van to use for distribution.

loans.name: Savriniso

texts.ru: Раджабова Савринисо проживает в районе Яван. Ей 47 лет. Она разведена, имеет двоих детей. Образование у нее среднее. Она занимается торговлей на рынке. Арендует торговую точку, где продает ткани. Этим видом деятельности она занимается 20 лет. Кредит берет для приобретения новых видов тканей.
texts.en: Sarviniso R. lives in the Yavan region. She is 47 years old. She is divorced and has two children. She has secondary education. She sells on the market where she rents out a vendor space where she sells fabrics. Sarviniso has been in this business for twenty years. She is taking out the loan to buy new kinds of fabrics.

loans.use: to buy new kinds of fabrics

loans.name: Batkhuu

texts.en:
Batkhuu is 42-year-old widow who lives with her son and daughter, ages 23 and 24, in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. They live in a small house in the outer ger (traditional Mongolian tent) district. Batkhuu’s son is a web designer and her daughter works as a teacher at a local public school. Batkhuu supports her family by operating a retail clothing stall at Narantuul, the largest outdoor market in Mongolia. 

When she first began her business in 2003, Batkhuu had 800,000 MNT in working capital. Today, her business has grown and she has about 2,000,000 MNT in working capital. Batkhuu sells jeans and trousers. She says “I want to grow my business with this loan and I would like to be able to buy my own apartment in future.” Batkhuu is requesting a loan of 1,000,000 MNT to increase the variety of jeans and trousers she sells.

loans.use: to purchase jeans and trousers to sell

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary K. is 30 years old and is currently in the business of selling vegetables. She will use the loan to stock more vegetables. Mary is married to a farmer and they have three children, only one of whom is not in school. Her future goal is to pay for her children school fees.

loans.use: to stock more vegetables.

loans.name: Julia

texts.en: Julia is currently in a business of selling fish. She is 35 years old and married with 5 children, three of whom go to school. Julia borrowed a loan to stock more fish to sell. She hopes to expand in future with extra profits from her business.

loans.use: to stock more fish to sell.

loans.name: Yolanda's Group

texts.en:
Yolanda A. is from the village of Carikkikan, Ilagan, Isabela. She is 50 years old. Yolanda is the group leader of a four member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Yolanda is married and has seven adult-aged children. To make a living, she plants and harvests a variety of vegetables to sell. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately $47 a month for these activities.

In 2008, Yolanda joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 13,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. 

Yolanda is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Susan J. is currently in a business of selling maize grain. She is 39 years old, a widow, with 5 children and only 1 of them goes to school. Susan borrowed a loan to stock more maize grain to sell. She hopes to expand in the future with extra profits from her business.

loans.use: Stock more maize grain to sell.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en: Monica A. is a 26 year old widow with one child who is not in school. Monica is currently in the business of selling tea and rice. She wants to use her loan to stock more tea and rice. Monica's future goal is to have an animal sales business.

loans.use: stock tea and rice.

loans.name: Yopi

texts.en:
Yopi is a 52-year-old tractor driver. He and his family live in Babau Village, about 15 km from the city of Kupang. He is married to Feby, a 48-year-old woman and they have been blessed with 4 children namely: 
1.\tDesta, 20 years old, working in rice mills 
2.\tDesti, 17 years old, who is in the 3rd year of vocational school
3.\tDoni, 14 years old, in the 3rd year of junior high school
4.\tDani, 9 years old in the 3rd grade of elementary school 
Yopi has been working as a tractor driver for 2 years. At that time he bought a tractor with his own money. Incidentally Yopi’s house is situated close to the area of rice fields, which is why Yopi bought a tractor in order to look for a better income.
However, the tractor cannot be used every day because farmers who commonly use his tractor service are seasonal farmers. Within one year the farmers could only grow rice two times, so there are many days where Yopi is not able to use his tractor. This situation makes Yopi unable rely on the income from his tractor.
Yopi realizes that in his village there is only a rice milling machine, so that many farmers need to stand in a line to grind the rice. Yopi plans take this opportunity as a new effort to increase his income.
Yopi is requesting a loan amounting to IDR 10,000,000 from TLM. He is sure that buying the rice milling machine will greatly help farmers in his village so they do not have to queue for too long and spend money for transport as he plans to set the location for the rice milling machine near to their rice fields.

loans.use: To purchase a rice milling machine for rent

loans.name: Phen

texts.en: Phen S., 39, resides in Takeo province, Cambodia, an area known for Pre-angkorean temples. S. sells used clothes, earning an income of about USD 15 per day. Each month, the family has to spend USD 30 on food and USD 30 on the other necessary expenses. Sophay is requesting a loan of USD 1200 to purchase more clothes to resell. This will be her third loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy flour, oil, yeast, etc.

loans.name: Loice

texts.en: Loice is currently in the business of selling maize grain. She is 40 years old, married, and has 7 children. All of her children go to school. Loice borrowed a loan to stock more maize grain to sell. She hopes to expand her business in the future, with extra profits from her business.

loans.use: To stock more maize grain to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase maize and beans for resale.

loans.name: Chea

texts.en: Chea P., 48, is married and resides in Takeo province, Cambodia, an area known for Pre-angkorean temples. P. is a weaver, earning an income of about USD 2 each per day. Her husband is a farmer, earning an income of USD 1 per day. Each month, the family has to spend USD 45 on food and USD 45 on the other necessary expenses. P. is requesting a loan of USD 1200 to purchase more raw silk to expand her weaving business. This will be her third loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy more raw silk to produce silk products to resell.

loans.name: Marium

texts.en: Marium is 48 years old. She has a general store in which she sells a variety of items and some foodstuffs. Her shop offers different kinds of flour, juices, cooking oil and rice. She has been running this shop with her husband for four years. This business has helped them to meet their needs. Marium is requesting a loan to buy more flour, cooking oil and rice.

loans.use: to buy flour, cooking oil and rice.

loans.name: Grace Wanjiru

texts.en:
Grace is 47 years old and is the single mother of one child. She has practised farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last four years. She was introduced to Kiva partner, KADET, by her friend and this will be her first loan. She plans to use the loan to buy seeds and fertilizer.
In the future, Grace hopes to become a leading farmer in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Srun

texts.en:
Srun S., age 32, is a local farmer. She lives in the province of Kompong Cham, which is the best territory for farming. She is a married woman who is devoted to her four children; three of them are attending school and depend on her care while the other one is married. 

Srun S. owns a big farm that she inherited from her grandmother. She grows various crops on it. She also plants a peanut crop on her land, and she will harvest it within the next two months when the plants mature. 

Srun S. can get the income from selling her mature produce to better meet her family’s needs. Her husband also helps her to grow crops. Currently, Srun S. would like to borrow some funds from Kiva for purchasing peanut seeds and fertilizer for growing a new crop.

loans.use: to purchase peanut seed and fertilizer for growing a new crop.

loans.name: Cheang

texts.en: Cheang R., 49, is married and resides in Takeo province, Cambodia, an area known for its pre-Angkorean temples. R. is a farmer and sells groceries, earning an income of about $3 USD per day. Her husband is a construction worker, earning an income of $3 USD per day. Each month, the family has to spend $11 USD on food and $30 USD on other necessary expenses. R. is requesting a loan of $500 USD to purchase a motorbike for her childR. to commute to work. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for her children to commute to work.

loans.name: Leya

texts.en: Leya is currently in the business of selling maize grain. She is 28 years old, married, and has three children, only one of whom goes to school. Leya has taken a loan to stock more maize grain to sell.  In the future, she hopes to build a concrete house with the extra profits from her business.

loans.use: to stock more maize grain to sell.

loans.name: Kyaitamba Tweyambe Group

texts.en:
Rauben is a 40-year-old married man with six children. He lives in his own house in Fort Portal, Uganda. He is charged with the responsibility of taking care of his family and his desire is to educate his children up to university level.
Rauben has been a shopkeeper for ten years and with the income generated he has been able to pay school fees for his children and also provide basics for the family. He faces the challenge of bad debtors but his dream is to own a wholesale shop. Rauben needs a loan to buy maize flour, sugar and salt for resale.

loans.use: to buy maize flour, sugar and salt for resale.

loans.name: Simon Muigai

texts.en:
Simon is 24 years old and has worked in the transport industry in Naivasha town for the last two years. He also practises farming on his small farm on the outskirts of the town.
Simon was introduced to Kiva partner, KADET, by his friend and this will be his second loan. He paid his previous loan of 75,600 KES well and in good time. He plans to use this loan to buy seeds and fertilizer for his farm. In the future, Simon hopes to grow both his transport and farming businesses.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer for his farm.

loans.name: C4708 Twisungane Group

texts.en:
Evariste is 29 years old and is married. Evariste is the leader of a group called "Twisungane," consisting of 11 men. In the photo, Evariste is the second person on the right side.

Evariste has a motorcycle transport business that is open daily from 6 a.m. until 8 p.m. His business is well-known, which is an advantage for him. 
 
Evariste and his group has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to buy more material for his own motorcycle transport. With this profits, Evariste and his group will build their own house and to save money for their family.

loans.use: To buy more material for his own motorcycle transport.

loans.name: Heng

texts.en: Heng V., 36, is married and resides in Takeo province, Cambodia, an area known for its pre-Angkorean temples. V. is a farmer, earning an income of about $3 USD per day. Her husband is a construction worker, earning an income of $3 USD per day. Each month, the family has to spend $11 USD on food and $30 USD on other necessary expenses. V. is requesting a loan of $1,000 USD to purchase a motorbike for her husband to commute to work. This will be her second loan from CREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for her husband to commute to work.

loans.name: Cheng

texts.en: Cheng S., 44, is married and resides in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for Pre-angkorean temples. Cheng sells fruits and raises cows at home, earning an income of about USD 3 per day, while her husband is a construction worker who earns an income of USD 3 per day. Each month, the family has to spend USD 50 on food and USD 30 on the other necessary expenses. Cheng is now requesting a loan of USD 800 to purchase more fruits to expand her business. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy more fruits to expand her business

loans.name: Edward Turanta

texts.en:
Edward Turanta L. is 32 years old. He is married to Naitunkera who has a small business selling jewels. They have three children. Edward has been farming for the past five years, making a monthly income of 10,000 KES.
Edward was introduced to Kiva partner, KADET by an already registered customer. He has been a good client who repays his loans well. This is his third loan, with which he plans to buy farm inputs and some animals (for fattening, to be sold at a profit) and hire machinery for preparing the land. Wheat has proved to be doing well in his area due to good climatic conditions. With the profits Edward hopes to make from this loan, he plans to reinvest in the farm and plant more acres of wheat. His future dream is that he will be able to buy a bigger piece of land where he can plant more wheat for commercial purposes, buy his own farm machinery and educate his children. He is a hardworking man who is focused on his set goals.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs and some animals, plus hire machinery for preparing the land.

loans.name: Amonullo

texts.ru: Бобоев Амонулло проживает в районе Хамадони. Возраст, 20 лет. Холост. Образование-среднее. Уже три года как он занимается торговлей. Он в основном продает телефоны и запасные части телефона. Кредит просит для приобретения сим-карт, зарядных устройств, панели телефонов, батареек, запасных частей телефона и для аренды нового помещения.
texts.en: Amonullo B. lives in Hamadoni. He is 20 years old and single. He has a high school education.  He has been working in trade for three years. He primarily sells phones and phone spare parts. He is asking for a loan to buy SIM cards, chargers, cell phone covers, batteries, phone spare parts, and to rent new premises.

loans.use: to buy SIM cards, chargers, cell phone covers, batteries, phone spare parts, and to rent new premises.

loans.name: Isai

texts.en:
Isai is a 38 year-old man who has lived in the village of Pasir Panjang for almost 20 years. His everyday work is to sell fish. He is married to Feby and blessed with 5 children, namely:
1.\t Indri, 14 years old, who is in the 3rd grade of Junior high school
2.\tCindri, 11 years old ,who is in the 1st grade of Junior high school
3.\tAndri, 8 years old, in the 1st grade of Elementary school
4.\tIndra, 6 years old, not at school yet 
5.\tLucky, 2 years old, not at school yet 

Isai has been a fish monger for almost 15 years. He had worked as a motorcycle taxi driver, but because of the little income, he decided to sell fish. He also has a small kiosk located by the edge of the street, about 1 km from his house. Sometimes he has to sleep in his kiosk, accompanied by his wife and his youngest son while his other children stay at home. 

The income from selling fish is not much. The average of his daily income is about IDR 50,000. This income is not sufficient for Isai to meet the needs of his family, as he still needs to pay the school fees of his children. Therefore, Isai has tried to find other ways to increase his income by selling grilled fish. In order to do so, Isai needs capital assistance to buy the equipment to grill fish. In addition, he will also need to buy a variety of fish to grill. Isai is requesting a loan of IDR 4,500,000 from TLM. He hopes the application will be approved so he can improve his business.

loans.use: to purchase the equipment to grill fish, and a variety of fish to grill

loans.name: Nan

texts.en: Nan S. is a 38 year-old rice cultivator who lives in Kompong Cham province. For many years now, she and her husband always help each other to grow their rice crop on their land. They get a profit from their planting-rice crop of approximately 3.5USD each day. They use this for food expenses and other miscellaneous. Nan S. has difficulties meeting her traveling needs because she always pays a lot of money to taxi drivers when she and her family want to go anywhere. Therefore, she hopes to reduce the amount she spends on transportation by using her loan to purchase a motorbike. Nan S. has three children, who still study in public school.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike.

loans.name: Jean Paul

texts.en: Jean Paul is 40 years old and is not married. He sells food items, such as sorghum and beans. He has done this business for 5 years. This business has enabled him to support his mother, with whom he lives.  It has helped him meet their needs and increase his capital.  Jean Paul is requesting a loan to buy more food items and hence to make more profits.  In the photo are several sacks with different food items.

loans.use: to buy food items for sale.

loans.name: Nil

texts.en: Nil S., 36, is married and resides in Takeo province, Cambodia, an area known for Pre-angkorean temples. S. and his wife sell food, earning an income of about USD 3 each per day. Each month, the family has to spend USD 11 on food and USD 30 on the other necessary expenses. S. is requesting a loan of USD 1200 to purchase a new motorbike for the family use. This will be his first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy a new motorbike for the family use

loans.name: Bun

texts.en: Bun S., 32, is married and resides in Takeo province, Cambodia, an area known for Pre-angkorean temples. S. is employed at the garment factory, earning an income of about USD 3 per day. Each month, the family has to spend USD 50 on food and USD 30 on the other necessary expenses. S. is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase rice stock to resell. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy rice stock for sale

loans.name: Dinah

texts.en:
Dinah is 35 years old and married to Kennedy Tuwei, a farmer.  They are blessed with three children, 16, 12, and 9 years old. Dina owns a posho mill in Ndurio trading centre in Kapsabet town, and has been in the business for a period of eight years.  She earns a monthly income of KES.14,800.  

She has taken out three loans from KADET LTD, and has successfuly repaid them.  She hopes to use the loan to purchase dry maize.  The profits will be used to purchase another posho mill.

She hopes to own a supermarket in Kobujoi trading centre.

loans.use: to purchase dry maize

loans.name: Sem

texts.en: Sem V., 28, is married and resides in Takeo province, Cambodia, an area known for Pre-angkorean temples. V. is a worker in Thailand, earning an income of about USD 5 per day. His wife is employed at the garment factory, earning an income of USD 3 per day. Each month, the family has to spend USD 11 on food and USD 30 on the other necessary expenses. V. is requesting a loan of USD 700 to purchase a new motorbike for the family use. This will be his second loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy a new motorbike for the family use

loans.name: Rael

texts.en:
Rael is a single woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For over two years, she has operated a wine and spirits business, selling to her neighbors and town dwellers. Rael faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of opening more businesses in the future. 

With the Kshs 20,000, she wants to purchase cases of wines, and add more chairs and tables for her customers. Rael decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase cases of wines, and add more chairs and tables for her customers.

loans.name: Angela

texts.en:
Angela is a mother of four children who are between the ages of 11 and 3 years old. Three are her biological children while she adopted the 4th one. 

She works with her husband and they sell different kinds of foodstuffs which include green bananas, from which she makes a juice called "Umutobe" and sorghum from which she makes another drink named "Ubushera."

She has been in this business for eight years and this business has helped her feed her family and pay school fees for her family. 

Angela is requesting a loan to buy more bananas and sorghum in order to make large quantities of the juices and make more profits. With the profits she hopes to make savings.

loans.use: To buy sorghum and green bananas

loans.name: Mwanasha

texts.en:
Mwanasha is a married woman with three children, two of whom attend school while one has graduated from school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For over ten years, she has operated a vegetable stall business, selling as retail to her neighbours and passersby. Mwanasha faces a major challenge of perishable products in her business. She dreams of becoming a green vegetable supplier and owning a grocery shop in the future.

With the Kshs 10,000 she is requesting she wants to renovate her stall, purchase cabbages, green vegetables and potatoes. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To renovate her stall and purchase cabbages, green vegetables and potatoes.

loans.name: Keziah

texts.en:
Keziah W. M. is forty-one years old, married, and they have four children aged between twenty-nine years old and ten years old. Her business is located at an area in Nairobi called Waithaka. 

Her business is well known by the name Soko-Satelite. She sells shoes to the local people a business she has engaged in for the last six years. She has managed to provide employment to two people. She says that this business is profitable and the only major challenge she has is financial constraints. However, she works very hard to keep her business doing well. 

She is using her loan of Kes 20,000 to buy more shoes to grow her business and meet the demand by her customers. In future, she hopes to grow her business to wholesale. She describes herself as a visionary lady.

loans.use: to buy more shoes to grow her business.

loans.name: Rukia

texts.en:
Rukia is a single mother of five, two of whom attend school while three have graduated from school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

She has operated a restaurant business for over ten years; her potential customers are neighbours and town dwellers. Rukia faces a major challenge of perishable products in her business. She dreams of expanding her business and establishing a hotel in the future. 

With the Kshs 20,000 she is requesting she wants to purchase bundles of maize flour and wheat flour and renovate her restaurant. She decided to join Yehu to access funds to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of maize flour and wheat flour and renovate her little restaurant.

loans.name: John Mutue

texts.en:
John Mutue O. is 27 years old. He is married and blessed with two children. He is a mixed farmer and he has been doing this for the last nine years. His farm is in a productive area which has proved to be good for mixed farming.

He repaid his previous loan without delay. This will be his fourth  loan from KADET LTD  which he is planning to use to buy potatoes for planting, fertilizers, and buy some sheep for fattening. He hopes to use the profit from this loan to acquire more land for farming to increase his potato production and educate his children.


His hope and dream is to become a large-scale farmer and buy a bigger piece of land for farming. He is a scrupulous man who can do more if supported financially.

loans.use: to buy potatoes for planting, fertilizers, and sheep for fattening

loans.name: Khayriniso

texts.ru: Каримова Хайринисо проживает в районе Хамадони. Возраст, 37 лет. Замужем, имеет 4 детей. Муж работает в районной больнице главным бухгалтером. Сама Хайринисо имеет высшее образование, фармацевт. Она занимается продажей медикаментов. В этой области она четыре года. Кредит берет для покупки медикаментов.
texts.en: Khayriniso K. lives in Hamadoni. She is 37 years old, married, and has four children. Her husband works in the regional hospital as the chief accountant. Khayriniso has a degree as a pharmacist. She works selling medicines. She has been doing this work for four years. She is taking out a loan to buy medicines.

loans.use: to buy medicines for resale

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is currently in business selling maize. She is 40 years old, married, with seven children and all of them go to school. Rose borrowed a loan to stock more maize to sell. She hopes to expand in the future with extra profits from her business.

loans.use: to stock more maize kernels to sell.

loans.name: Pen

texts.en:
There are many Cambodians who make a living as rice cultivators; one of them is Mrs. Pen Y. who has been working in this sector since 2003. She and her husband grow rice on their own farmland that they inherited from their grandparents. They always use this land to grow different kinds of crops such as rice, peanuts, and sesame seeds. From this business they can generate an income of around US$ 3 per day. 

This humble couple has seven children, two of whom are employed as garment workers. This rice-growing season, the family hasn't planted any crops on their farmland yet because of lacking funds. To solve this situation, Pen Y. would like to apply for a loan as capital to buy peanuts and sesame seeds for planting. 

Note that Pen Y. and her husband appear in the picture.

loans.use: to buy peanuts and sesame seeds for planting.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 35-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and two young children. He has owned a barber shop in his town for 12 years. He is known in the whole region for his good business reputation and his great customer service. 

Today, he is requesting to borrow $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase new products and tools in order to improve his business. He is intent on offering high quality services to his customers. In the future, he is planning to expand his business and open a proper women's beauty salon.

loans.use: to purchase new products and tools.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce S. is 28 years old. She is currently in the business of selling clothes. She will use her loan to stock more clothes. Joyce is married to a jobless man and they have two children (only one is in school). Her future goal is to build a house.

loans.use: stock more clothes.

loans.name: Sofia

texts.en:
Sofia is a married woman with two children – both of whom graduated from school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. 

For the past five years, Sofia has operated a beauty salon. Her potential customers are neighbouring community members. In addition, she also operates a cosmetics shop which contributes another source of income. Sofia dreams of incorporating her beauty salon business and establishing a hairdressing college. 

With the 20,000 Kenyan shilling loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase hair food oil, chemicals and a blow dryer. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase hair food oil, chemicals and a blow dryer.

loans.name: Celina

texts.en:
Celina is currently in a business of selling tomatoes and maize grain. She is 40 years old and married, with 5 children, all of whom go to school. Celina requested a loan to stock more tomatoes and maize grain to sell. 

She hopes to expand in the future with extra profits from her business.

loans.use: to stock more tomatoes and maize grain to sell.

loans.name: Mireji

texts.en:
Mireji is a married woman, with one child who attends school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.  For the past three years, she has operated a Kikoi’s selling business.  She sells from door-to-door to her neighbours and passersby. 

Mireji faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation in her business. She dreams of expanding and becoming self-reliant in the future. With the Kshs 20,000, she wants to purchase two bales of Kikoi’s for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase two bales of Kikoi’s for resale.

loans.name: Naema

texts.en: Naema S. is a 53-year-old married woman. She started a home business selling clothes and accessories four years ago to support her family. In these four years, she has managed to improve the quality of her products. She now wants to have her own shop, since she believes that she can compete in the market in her area by depending on word of mouth and the good reputation she has gained. She applied for a loan to purchase more products so she can have the her own store in the future.

loans.use: to have her own shop for clothing and accessories.

loans.name: Yomema

texts.en: Yomema is currently in a business of selling sugar and salt. She is 39 years old and married, with 6 children, all of whom go to school. Yomema requested a loan to stock more sugar and salt to sell. She hopes to expand in the future with extra profits from her business.

loans.use: to stock more sugar and salt to sell.

loans.name: Dilorom

texts.en:
Dilorom K. is a loving wife, and the mother of three children. She is engaged in sewing dresses. She works in an atelier of Zebo, in the street of Borbad, in Vahdat city. She sews dresses and then sells them in the market in Vahdat city.  Dilorom works very hard because she wants to earn a greater profit in order to improve their lives. Dilorom would like a loan of 5000 Somoni to purchase fabrics for sewing dresses and for expanding her business.  

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to buy fabrics

loans.name: Glady

texts.en: Glady A., 25 years old, is currently in a business of selling clothes.  She plans to use her loan to stock more clothes.  She is married to a teacher, and they have two children.  One goes to school.   Glady's future goal is to build a house for her mother.

loans.use: to stock more clothes.

loans.name: Gulbahor

texts.ru: Исмоилова Гулбахор проживает в районе Джиликул. Возраст, 41 год. Замужем, имеет 4 детей. Её муж находится в Российской Федерации. Сама она занимается растениеводством. В основном она выращивает овощи и злаковые культуры. В этой области 25 лет. Целью кредита является закуп минеральных удобрений для посева арбуза и дыни.
texts.en: Gulbahor I. lives in Jilikul. She is 41 years old, married, and has four children. Her husband is in the Russian Federation. She works in agriculture.  Basically, she grows vegetables and grains. She has been doing this work for 25 years.  She is taking out a loan to buy mineral fertilizers for her watermelon and melon crops.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers for her watermelon and melon crops.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.fr: Patrick M. a un studio photo, et client d’ACB depuis 2009.  Il a 28 ans, il est célibataire, né au Rwanda, Patrick a fini  G1 en journalisme.  Ce crédit est son 2 eme cycle avec ACB, et il va utiliser son prêt pour acheter deux appareils pour son studio.  Sa stratégie pour la croissance de l’affaire est de chercher les appareils performants et modernes pour améliorer les qualités de services qu’il offre.  Il voudrait s’autofinancer, et aussi chercher comment peut-il se marier ainsi fonder sa propre famille.
texts.en: Patrick M. owns a photo studio. He has been a customer of the microfinance institution ACB since 2009. He is 28 years old, is single, and was born in Rwanda. Patrick studied journalism at the university until level G1. This is his second loan cycle with ACB. He will use the loan to buy two cameras for his studio. His strategy for growth is to buy high-performing and modern equipment in order to improve the quality of his service. His goal is to become self-financing, and also to look for ways how to get married and start his own family.

loans.use: to buy two cameras for his photo studio.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen has been running a beauty salon for six years in Kangondo town, and gets a monthly profit of KES.30,000.  She is married to Mulwa, and they have three school-age children.

She was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer, and she is applying for her fifth loan from KADET LTD.  She plans to use the entire loan to buy weaves, cosmetics, braids and lotions.

In the future, Hellen hopes to grow her business, be financially stable, and offer her children a good education.

loans.use: to buy weaves, cosmetics, braids, and lotions

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, sugar, cooking oil and vegetables.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence G. is 41 years old and single. She is currently in the business of selling food. She intends to use use her loan to stock more food for resale. Her future goal is to build a concrete house.

loans.use: to stock more food for resale.

loans.name: Sankaire Ole

texts.en:
Sankaire Ole S. has been a livestock trader in Bissil market in Kajiado for the last 20 years and gets an income of KES.5,000 monthly. He is 36 years old, married to Nchama, and they have four children.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by a KADET staff member and he has applied for his first loan of KES. 60,000 to open a butchery in Bissil market. 

In future he hopes to grow his business and become a famous businessman in the town.

loans.use: to open a butchery shop.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 31-year-old single woman from Lebanon. She is living with her parents and three siblings. She has been working as a private teacher at her house since 2007. She has prepared a special education room with all the needed equipment to receive her students fittingly. 

In parallel, she has worked as an instructor in a local school since 2009. Her work is very important because she helps her father with the family expenses. Today, she is requesting to borrow $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase a laptop in order to facilitate her work preparation and do more research.

loans.use: to purchase a laptop.

loans.name: Mgeni

texts.en:
Mgeni is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. Her husband is a businessman who supports his family financially. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

For the past three years, she has operated a juice-making business and has also been making natural soap for sale using chemicals. She operates from home, selling to her neighbors and passersby. Mgeni faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation in her business. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the Kshs 10,000 she is requesting she wants to purchase chemicals for making natural soap and flavors and sugar for making juice drinks. She decided to work with Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase chemicals for making natural soap and flavors and sugar for making juice drinks.

loans.name: Nyaka

texts.en: Nyaka J. is 22 years old. She  is currently in business selling fish. She intends to use her loan to stock more fish. She is married to a businessman and they have one baby who is not yet in school. Her future goal is to build a big house.

loans.use: to stock more fish for resale.

loans.name: Mukono Women's Crafts Enterprise Group

texts.en:
Thirty-seven-year-old Faith N., a widow with five kids, says her decade-long tenure in her grocery store business in Butebe-Mukono is what she has been banking on to provide for herself and her family since the completion of her university education. 

Before she embarked on this business, she was teaching in many primary schools in and around the Mukono Town area. Faith still teaches and she also has a crafts-sales business that she also runs. 

Hard work, she says, has been her recourse in trying times. Faith, who is affiliated with the Mukono Women's Crafts Enterprise group, says this business generates her 200,000 shillings monthly as profit. With this loan, Faith says she is going to pay for the expansion of her grocery store.

loans.use: to expand her grocery-store business by buying more sugar, cooking oil, vegetables for resale.

loans.name: François

texts.fr: François R. est salarié, et client d’ACB depuis 2008.  Il a 28 ans, il est marié, né au Rwanda, il a 3 enfants entre 10 et 4 ans, François a fini  8 ans de l’école primaire.  Ce crédit est son 2 eme cycle avec ACB, et il va utiliser son prêt pour acheter le sable, porte métallique, ciment pour la construction de sa maison.  Sa stratégie pour la croissance de l’affaire est de construire une bonne maison d’habitation.  Il voudrait s’autofinancer, et assurer le bien-etre de sa famille.
texts.en: François R. is a salaried employee and has been a client of ACB since 2008.  Born in Rwanda, he is 28 years old, married and has three children whose ages range between 10 and 14.  François completed 8 years of elementary school.  This is his second loan with ACB and he is going to use his loan to buy sand, metal doors and cement to build his house.  His strategy to grow his business is to build a fine house to live in.  He would like to self-finance and to provide for his family's well being.

loans.use: to buy sand, metal doors and cement to build his house

loans.name: Umiyavi

texts.ru: Хасанова Умияви проживает в районе Дж. Руми. Возраст, 51 год. Она замужем, имеет троих детей. Её дети и муж находятся в Москве. Она два года как занимается торговлей. У нее магазин со смешанным ассортиментом. Ее бизнес приносит доход. На сегодняшний день в свободное время она хочет заняться животноводством. Кредит просит для закупа скота.
texts.en: Umiyavi H. lives in J.Rumy. She is 51 years old, married, and has three children. Her children and husband are in Moscow. She has been working in trade for two years. She has a shop that sells a variety of goods.  Her business brings in her income. In her leisure time, she would like to work in animal husbandry.  So, she is taking out a loan to buy cattle.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Apelie

texts.en: Apelie M. is 24 years old. She is currently in the business of selling alcohol. She will use her loan to stock more alcohol. She is married to a businessman and they have two children, only one of whom goes to school. Her future goal is to build a terminal house.

loans.use: to stock more alcohol.

loans.name: Bilal

texts.en: Bilal is a 26-year-old single man living in Saida. Bilal has been selling and repairing mobile phones, sim cards and electronics such as DVDs and CDs for seven years. He opened his own business in 2004 and he's very proud that he took this step. Bilal is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua for the third time, in order to buy electrical & electronic appliances necessary to start a new business. It will take place at his mobile shop in order to grow step by step and open a new shop. Bilal is a borrower in good standing. He's a man with a good reputation and is recommended to deal with. He seeks the best for his family members and for friends.Bilal hopes to expand his business and to make a small family of his own in the future.

loans.use: To buy electrical & electronic appliances for his new business

loans.name: 10 Đông Vệ Group

texts.en: Hương Lê Thị T. (52) owns and operates a retail clothing business. Her main source of income comes from providing general clothing services to local community members. She is a 41-year-old woman living in the town of T. Hoá. Hương is married and has two school-aged children.She has been engaged in the business for over six years and earns approximately 3,500,000 dong (VND) a month. In 2010, Hương joined T. Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,253,800 VND from T. Hoa Fund for Poor Women which was used to invest in expanding the business. She is now requesting a new loan of 6,159,600 VND which will be used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. This will be her second loan from T. Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Hương plans to use additional revenue to improve and expand her business. Hương is the leader of a five member group accessing a loan offered by T. Hoa Fund for Poor Women. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 10 Đông Vệ (08.01.10 Đông Vệ). About the Other Borrowers in the Group: 1. N. Thị T. Hà (53) is a 35 year-old woman who is requesting a 6,159,600 VND loan to support her business in the retail sector operating a clothing business. 2. P. Thị Tứ (54) is a 32 year-old woman who is requesting a 6,159,600 VND loan to support her business in the retail sector operating a clothing business. 3. N. Thị Xuân (55) is a 54 year-old woman who is requesting a 6,159,600 VND loan to support her business in the retail sector operating a clothing business. 4. T. Thị Hiền (56) is a 30 year-old woman who is requesting a 6,159,600 VND loan to support her business in the retail sector operating a clothing business. About T. Hoa Fund for Poor Women: The mission of Fund for T. Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the T. Hoa province. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders. ====================================== Hương Lê Thị T. (52) là 41 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy sống ở thành phố T. Hoá. Hương là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 5 các thành viên. Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ.. Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 10 Đông Vệ (08.01.10 Đông Vệ). Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên T. nhập, mà nguồn T. nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ cung cấp các dịch vụ quần áo thông thường cho người dân trong cộng đồng địa phương. Hương thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 6 năm. Từ các hoạt động này, Hương kiếm được khoảng 3,500,000 VND. Vào 2010, Hương đã tham gia T. Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy. Hương đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 3,253,800 VND từ T. Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng đầu tư mở rộng công việc kinh doanh. Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 6,159,600 VND. Khoản vay sẽ là 2nd khoản vay của người vay từ T. Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm: 1. N. Thị T. Hà (53) là 35 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6,159,600 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh quần áo. 2. P. Thị Tứ (54) là 32 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6,159,600 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh quần áo. 3. N. Thị Xuân (55) là 54 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6,159,600 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh quần áo. 4. T. Thị Hiền (56) là 30 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6,159,600 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh quần áo. Về T. Hoa Fund for Poor Women: Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo T. Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh T. Hóa. *Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. . Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and for working capital.

loans.name: Susuana

texts.en: Susuana K. is 20 years old and single. She is currently in business selling fruits and vegetables. She plans to use her loan to stock more fruits and vegetables. Her future goal is to buy a plot of land.

loans.use: to stock more fruit and vegetables.

loans.name: Ujumbe Group

texts.fr: Kashibondo W.  est entrepreneur, membre du groupe d’affaire « Ujumbe »,  âgée de 39 ans, mariée, mère de 8 enfants. Son mari est un fonctionnaire de l’administration publique à la division de poste et télécommunication « OCPT ». La cliente Kashibondo W. est vendeuse des ciments, chaux et autres matériaux de construction. Elle expose ses marchandises dans une quincaillerie.  Il ya 3 ans qu’elle exerce cette activité. Elle démarra son business avec de fonds propre reçu de son mari. Elle vient de réaliser 9 cycles avec les crédits de l’IMF Hekima. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir de s’approvisionner avec des 50 sacs de ciments et autres articles de construction. En plus, elle ambitionne agrandir son entreprise, scolariser ses enfants et construire une maison en dur.  La cliente Kashibondo W.  remercie Hekima pour  ses actions en faveur de pauvres exclus de banque classique. Il sied de signaler que le groupe d’affaire «  Ujumbe » est majoritairement féminins.
texts.en: Kashibondo W. is a businesswoman and member of the "Ujumbe" business group. She is 39 years old, married, and has 8 children. Her husband is a public administration civil servant in the postal and telecommunications division "OPCT." Kashibondo W. is a seller of cement, lime, and other construction materials. She displays her goods at a hardware store, and has run this business for three years. She launched her business with her own funds, given to her by her husband. She has just completed 9 loan cycles with the microfinance institution Hekima (one of Kiva's field partners). This new loan will serve to buy 50 bags of cement and other construction material. In addition, her ambition is to enlarge her business, educate her children, and build a permanent home. Kashibondo W. is thankful to Hekima for its actions on behalf of the poor who are excluded from the classical banking system. It is to be noted that the "Ujumbe" business group is composed primarily of women.

loans.use: to buy 50 bags of cement and other construction materials

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Ek

texts.en:
Ek S., 55, is married and resides in Battambong province, Cambodia, an area known for high quality rice. S. sells vegetables and fish, earning an income of about USD 8 per day. Her husband is a construction worker, earning an income of USD 3 per day. 

Each month, the family has to spend USD 80 on food and USD 54 on other necessary expenses. S. is requesting a loan of USD 1200 to purchase fruit for one of the children to resell. This will be her second loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy fruit for one of her children to resell.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman with five children, all of whom graduated from school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. 

For over ten years, she has operated a cereals selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. In addition she also operates a charcoal sales business, her other source of income. Fatuma faces a major challenge of price fluctuations in the market hence lower demand for products. She dreams of opening a wholesale cereals shop in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase sacks of cereals, beans and green grains for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of cereals, beans and green grains for sale.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace L., 28 years old, is currently in business selling fruits and vegetables. She plans to use her loan to stock more vegetables. She is married to a businessman and they have four children. Her future goal is to build a nice house for her kids.

loans.use: to stock more vegetables.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase second-hand clothes in bulk.

loans.name: 05 Đông Vệ Group

texts.en:
Thái C. Thị (16) is a 58-year-old woman living in the town of Thanh Hoá.  Thái is the group leader of a 5-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is 05 Đông Vệ (08.05.05 Đông Vệ).


Thái is married and has two school-aged children.  To make a living, Thái works in someone else's business venture in the retail sector running a general store.  The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community.  Thái has been engaged in this business for over five years and earns approximately 3,000,000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2010, Thái joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Thái has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,253,800 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business.  She is now requesting a new loan of 6,159,600 VND which will be used to invest in renovating the business premises.  This will be the 2nd loan taken out by the borrower from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Thái plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  Lê Thị N. Liên (17) is a 32-year-old woman who is requesting a 6,159,600 VND loan to support her general store.


2.  T. Thị Lương (18) is a 37-year-old woman who is requesting a 6,159,600 VND loan to support her clothing business.


3.  H. Thị Oanh (8) is a 56-year-old woman who is requesting a 6,159,600 VND loan to support her general store.


4.  Vũ Thị Thêm (9) is a 46-year-old woman who is requesting a 6,159,600 VND loan to support her general store.


About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 54-year-old married man from Lebanon. He lives with his wife and three children who are still attending school. He has owned a tractor for 7 years. His work is specialized in excavating land for cultivation and harvesting the planted crops. He works upon request of the land owners. He has been able to improve his business through his first loan that Kiva has granted him. 

 Today, he is requesting to take out a second loan of $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to perform much needed maintenance work on his tractor’s engine and body. In that way, he will be able to proceed with his work easier and faster.  In the future, he is hoping to buy land and start his own farming work.

loans.use: to perform much needed maintenance work on his tractor’s engine and body.

loans.name: Konstantin

texts.en:
Konstantin G. comes from the village of Sanebeli, Kareli district. He is 42 years old and lives with his wife Leila, two daughters (5 and 2 years old) and his parents (retired). 

The family’s total monthly income amounts to 800 Laris, approximately 40% of which comes from the parents’ pensions and government monthly social assistance given to the family, as they are regarded as living under the poverty line. The rest of the income comes from agricultural activities: Konstantin and Leila have two cows and their dairy products are sold locally. Also the family owns 1.85 ha of agricultural land, where maize, wheat, haricot beans, potatoes and apple trees are grown. Part of the harvested fruits and vegetables are consumed within the family and another part is sold on the local market. Also Konstantin has 4 oxen. He uses them for transportation of wood from the forest. The wood is sold in the village. 

With the requested loan Konstantin plans to purchase seeds for maize, haricot beans and potatoes, fertilizers and pay for tilling the land.  Using these materials he will be able to cultivate his land and sow the grains and vegetables. Konstantin and Leila hope that they will have a good harvest season and the received income will be enough to perform some renovation work in their house.

loans.use: to pay for land tilling service and purchase fertilizers and seeds.

loans.name: 06  Đôngvệ Group

texts.en:
Mai T. Thị (22) is a 51-year-old female living in the town of Thanh Hoá. Mai is the leader of a three-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 06 Đông Vệ (08.05.06 Đông Vệ).

Mai is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Mai runs a general store. Mai has been engaged in this business for over five years and earns approximately 3,000,000 VND a month.

In 2010, Mai joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Mai has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,253,800 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business. 

She is now requesting a new loan of 6,159,600 VND, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. This will be the second loan taken out by the borrower from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Mai plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business.

About the other borrowers in the group:

1. N. Thị L. Hương (19) is a 28-year-old woman who is requesting a 6,159,600 VND loan to support her business in the retail sector running a general store.

2. Q. Thị Nghi (20) is a 55-year-old woman who is requesting a 6,159,600 VND loan to support her business in the retail sector running a general store.

Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 6,159,600 VND.

Khoản vay sẽ là 2nd khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:

1.  N. Thị L. Hương (19) là 28 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6,159,600 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hàng bách hóa.

2.  Q. Thị Nghi (20) là 55 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6,159,600 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hàng bách hóa.

Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.

*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and to have working capital.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary A. is 32 years old. She is married to a house builder and they have three children, two of whom are in school. 

Currently, Mary is in the business of selling breads. She will use her loan to stock more breads.

Her future goal is to pay for her children's school fees.

loans.use: to stock more breads.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine N. lives in the Mengo Kisenyi neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has seven children, all of whom are in school. Christine lives in a home that she owns. She has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include feeding the family.   

Christine has a business of selling charcoal and bananas. She has been in this business for 10 years, and she works seven days out of every week. Christine sells her products from home, by means of wholesale/retail. She also generates additional income through selling samosas.

Christine has requested a loan of 700,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of charcoal and bunches of bananas.     

The main business challenges for Christine include seasonality and defaulters.  

Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start selling on wholesale only and also to educate her children up to university.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of bananas and bags of charcoal.

loans.name: 02 Đông Vệ Group

texts.en:
Hoan N. Thị (4) is a 46-year-old woman living in the town of Thanh Hoá. Hoan is the leader of a seven-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 02 Đông Vệ (08.04.02 Đông Vệ).

Hoan is married and has two school-aged children. 

To make a living, Hoan owns and operates a general store. Hoan has been engaged in this business for over five years and earns approximately 3,000,000 VND a month.

In 2010, Hoan joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation.  Hoan has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,253,800 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business.  

She is now requesting a new loan of 6,159,600 VND, which will be used to invest in renovating the business. This will be the second loan taken out by the borrower from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Hoan plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

About the other borrowers in the group:

1. Lê Thị Thuỵ (5) is a 27-year-old woman who is requesting a 6,159,600 VND loan to support her business in the retail sector running a general store.

2. N. Thị Xuyến (6) is a 31-year-old woman who is requesting a 6,159,600 VND loan to support her business in the food sector making and selling food.

3. Lê Thị Tâm (7) is a 29-year-old woman who is requesting a 6,159,600 VND loan to support her business in the retail sector running a general store.
