4. Lê Thị Thanh (8) is a 59-year-old woman who is requesting a 6,159,600 VND loan to support her business in the retail sector running a general store.

5. Lê Thị Vân (9) is a 33-year-old woman who is requesting a 6,159,600 VND loan to support her business in the food sector making and selling food.

6. Lê Thị C. Thạch (1) is a 64-year-old woman who is requesting a 6,159,600 VND loan to support her business in the retail sector running a general store.

About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:
The mission of Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

Hoan N. Thị (4) là 46 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Thanh Hoá.  Hoan là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 7 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 02 Đông Vệ (08.04.02 Đông Vệ).

Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ bán các loại sản phẩm khác nhau trong cộng đồng địa phương.  Hoan thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 5 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Hoan kiếm được khoảng 3,000,000 VND.  Vào 2010, Hoan đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Hoan đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 3,253,800 VND từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng đầu tư mở rộng công việc kinh doanh.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 6,159,600 VND.

Khoản vay sẽ là 2nd khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:

1.  Lê Thị Thuỵ (5) là 27 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6,159,600 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hàng bách hóa.

2.  N. Thị Xuyến (6) là 31 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6,159,600 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là sản xuất & buôn bán thức ăn.

3.  Lê Thị Tâm (7) là 29 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6,159,600 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hàng bách hóa.

4.  Lê Thị Thanh (8) là 59 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6,159,600 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hàng bách hóa.

5.  Lê Thị Vân (9) là 33 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6,159,600 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là sản xuất & buôn bán thức ăn.

6.  Lê Thị C. Thạch (1) là 64 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6,159,600 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hàng bách hóa.

Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:
Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.

*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: to invest in renovating her general store.

loans.name: Alvard

texts.en:
Alvard B. lives in Yerevan with her husband and two children. Alvard is a teacher, but her salary is very low. Alvard is also engaged in clothing sales. The main income comes from  sales and is not enough to meet her school-aged children’s needs. 

Alvard wants to increase her income and develop her business. With the requested loan she plans to purchase more clothes for resale. With the loan’s help Alvard will get more income and will be able to insure better living conditions for her children.

loans.use: to pay for new clothes for resale.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter N. K. is 61 years old and married. He has seven children.  

He has been selling eggs since 1990. He has sustained his business for these years through Faulu Kenya. His living standard has also changed since he joined Faulu Kenya in 1994. He hopes to open an outlet of his business in the future. He also dreams of buying a piece of land.  

He has requested 80,000 KES to buy more eggs.

loans.use: To buy more eggs to resell.

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima H. lives in the Naguru neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is widowed and has three children, none of whom is in school. She also takes care of additional family members (orphans).
Halima has a business selling charcoal. She has been in this business for ten years, and works seven days out of every week. Halima sells her products from home, by means of wholesale/retail. She has requested a loan of 800,000 Ugandan Shillings from Kiva partner, MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of charcoal.
Halima also generates additional income through rental rooms and selling piped water. Her main business challenges include seasonality and defaulters. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start selling on a wholesale basis only and also to educate her grandchildren up to university level. Halima lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Odgerel

texts.en: Mrs. Odgerel is a 41-year-old divorcee who lives with her two daughters and granddaughter in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. They live in their small family house in a suburb of Ulaanbaatar. Mrs. Odgerel is a single mother who has raised her children on her own for eight years. She has run a small cafeteria for nine years and employs some of her relatives as a chef and waitress. Mrs. Odgerel has gained a lot of experience in the food service field and has a loyal customer base. She is a self-motivated, hardworking woman. The district’s food service monitoring authorities often pay a visit to her cafeteria. The reminder from the last visit was to replace some kitchen equipment for health and safety reasons. Therefore she is asking for a loan to replace the necessary kitchen equipment, fix some appliances and to do some restoration work in the cafe to meet the local authority requirements.

loans.use: to replace kitchen equipment, fix some appliances and to do some restoration work in the cafeteria to meet local authority requirements

loans.name: Restuta

texts.en:
Restuta N. lives in the Kisaasi neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is single and has five children, none of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members (grandchildren).
Restuta has a business selling charcoal. She has been in this business for ten years, and she works seven days out of every week. Restuta sells her products from home, by means of wholesale/retail. She has requested a loan of 600,000 Ugandan Shillings from Kiva partner, MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of charcoal. Her main business challenges include seasonality and defaulters. Restuta's goals and aspirations for her business are to start selling on a wholesale basis only. Restuta lives in a home that she rents; she doesn't have access to electricity or piped water. Her major monthly expenses include feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Magret

texts.en:
Magret is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.
For the past four years, Magret has operated a greengrocery business, selling at the market to her neighbors and passers-by. Magret faces the major challenge of high transport costs in her business. She dreams of opening a boutique business in the future.
With her loan of 30,000 KES, she wants to purchase one sack of potatoes, tomatoes and onions. She decided to join Kiva partner, Yehu, to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of potatoes, tomatoes and onions.

loans.name: Moureen

texts.en: Moureen is 25 years old and single. She runs a salon business to earn a living. She has been in the business for five years and employs two people. She decided to go into business in order to earn a better income. Moureen has sustained her business because she knows how to attract customers. She is very determined and hopes to open another outlet of her business in the future. She has requested a loan of 80,000 KES to buy cosmetics and a hairdryer.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and a hairdryer.

loans.name: Houy

texts.en:
Houy S., 51, resides in Prey Veng Province, Cambodia, an area known as one of the largest rice-producing regions in Cambodia. S. is a housewife, while her husband is a construction worker who earns an income of USD 4 per day. Each month, the family has to spend USD 20 on food and USD 50 on the other necessary expenses.

S. is requesting a loan of USD 1200 to purchase a new motorbike for her children to commute to school and work. This will be her first from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for the children to commute to work and study.

loans.name: Hovsep

texts.en: Hovsep D. lives in Yerevan with his pensioner parents. Hovsep’s two brothers are in the army. He is engaged in baby clothing sales. The main income comes from sales, but it is not enough to meet the family needs. Hovsep wants to expand and develop his business.  With the requested loan he plans to purchase clothes for sale. With the loan’s help Hovsep will increase his income and insure better living conditions for his family.

loans.use: to pay for clothes for resale.

loans.name: Deborah

texts.en:
Deborah K. lives in the Nakulabye neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has six children, four of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members (grandchildren). Deborah lives in a home that she owns. She has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and  feeding the family.      

Deborah has a business of selling fish. She has been in this business for a few years, and she works seven days out of every week. Deborah   sells her products at the market, by means of retail. The main business challenges for Deborah include ever increasing prices of smoked fish and seasonality.   

Deborah has requested a loan of 1,000,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more baskets of fish. 

Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start selling on wholesale only and also to educate her children up to university.

loans.use: To buy more baskets of fish.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen N. K. is 31 years old and a member of Aim Self Help Group registered under Faulu Kenya. He uses his bicycle to transport meat, vegetables and household items to different vendors. He has ten years of experience in the business.  

Being a married man with two children, he puts extra effort in his business so as to earn enough income to meet his family’s needs. He has requested for 20, 000 Kes to buy two bicycles.

loans.use: To buy two bicycles.

loans.name: Malkhaz

texts.en:
Malkhaz lives in the village of Aradeti, Khashuri district. He is 41 years old and lives with wife Manana, two sons (17 and 15 years old) and his parents. Malkhaz and Manana are in charge of the family agricultural business. The children go to local secondary school and his parents are retired. 

Malkhaz’s family earns on average 500 Laris per month from agricultural activities. They have two milk cows and two calves. Dairy products (mainly traditional Georgian cheese) are sold on local market. Also they have a small pig-farm with seven pigs and three piglets. the piglets will be raised and then sold locally. Along with the above-mentioned, A.’s family owns approximately 3 ha of agricultural land, where potatoes, tomatoes and apple trees are grown. Harvested fruits and vegetables are sold locally. 

It’s now the season for sowing vegetables and Malkhaz needs a loan to purchase seeds for potatoes and fertilizers for both potatoes and tomatoes. Malkhaz hopes that after fertilizing he will have good harvest. The earned profit will be used to cover the children’s school expenses and part will be reinvested in agriculture.

loans.use: to purchase seeds for vegetables and fertilizers.

loans.name: Fraciah

texts.en:
Fraciah W. W. has been selling fruits and vegetables for two years. She is married to Simon and the mother of three children.

She was introduced to KADET Ltd. by a staff member, and this is her first loan from KADET. She will use the KES 20,000 to purchase more fruits and vegetables for sale. The anticipated profit she will use to open another grocery business in Athi River.

In the future, she hopes to grow her business and eventually purchase a plot of land and have her own business premise.

loans.use: to purchase more fruits and vegetables for sale.

loans.name: Avag

texts.en:
Avag G. lives in Ejmiatsin with his brother and pensioner parents. Avag is a student. His brother is a driver. Avag is engaged in sales. He sells food and household goods. The income he gets is not enough to pay for education. 

Avag wants to increase his food and household goods variety and develop his business. With the requested loan he plans to purchase more goods and expand the business. With the loan’s help Avag will get more income and will be able to pay for his education.

loans.use: to pay for goods for resale.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose N. N. lives in the Naguru neighbourhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has 7 children, all of whom are in school.  Rose has a business of selling charcoal.  She has been in this business for 10 years, and she works 1 day out of every week. Rose sells her products at the market, by means of wholesale/retail.    Rose has requested for a loan of 1000000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of charcoal. She also generates additional income through a pub.The main business challenge(s) for Rose include transportation and seasonality.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a delivery van and also to educate her children up to university.   Rose lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and  piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and  feeding the family expense(s).

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Mhammad

texts.en:
Mhammad is 33 years old and married. He is the father of three children. Mhammad lives with his family in Nabatieh. 

He works in repairing washing machines and electronic appliances with 23 years of experience. He was very small when he started working, and it was all for the sake of helping his family with their income and expenses.

Mhammad is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua for the forth time, in order to buy tools useful for fixing the machines he repairs. His previous loans had a great effect on his social and economic life. 

He hopes to give his children the best education they deserve, in addition to a happy childhood.
He hopes to expand his business and start selling new washing machines and other home appliances.

loans.use: to buy tools for fixing the machines he repairs.

loans.name: Teresia

texts.en:
Teresia W. R. is a 58-year-old farmer. She has been farming for the past seven years. She was previously employed as a teacher.  

Teresia is a widowed lady with six children between 22 and 33 years of age. With hard work in her business, she has managed to bring up her children.  

Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has managed to save her money and she wants to take a first loan. She has requesting 20,000 KES to buy a dairy cow.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Artur

texts.en: Artur M. lives in Tsakhkadzor with his wife. Artur’s children are students in the UK and the USA. Artur is engaged in gardening. The main income comes from gardening. Artur doesn’t have enough financial means to pay for his children’s education. He wants to develop his business and get more income. With the requested loan, Artur plans to buy saplings. With the loan’s help, Artur will get more income and will be able to pay for his children’s education.

loans.use: to pay for saplings

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en:
Mwanamisi is a married woman with three children, two of whom attend school while one is still too young for school. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

She operates a food stall business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. Mwanamisi faces a major challenge of price fluctuations in her business. She dreams of establishing a restaurant business in the future. 

With the Kshs 20,000 she is requesting she wants to purchase bundles of maize flour, rice, wheat flour and sugar. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of maize flour, rice, wheat flour and sugar.

loans.name: Hranush

texts.en:
Hranush K. lives in Yerevan together with her husband, three children and her mother-in-law. She is engaged in retail trade of women's clothes. Her husband is a stonemason. The main income comes from trade, but it is not enough to meet the family needs. 

Hranush has taken out this loan to develop her business. With the requested loan she plans to purchase more clothing and increase her working capital.

loans.use: to pay for clothes for resale.

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en: Wilson, a 21-year-old, sells jugs, caps and slippers to earn a living.  He has engaged in the business for three years.  He is very thankful to Faulu Kenya for helping him learn how to save his money.  He hopes to grow his business into wholesale in the next five years.  He has requested for a loan of 20, 000 Kenyan Shillings to open a kiosk where he will sell soda, cakes, sweets and mobile-phone credit cards.

loans.use: To open a kiosk to sell soda, cakes, sweets and mobile-phone credit cards

loans.name: Ariuntungalag

texts.en:
Ariuntungalag is 31 years old and lives with her husband and her son and daughter, who are 2 and 10 years old respectively. The family lives in Mongolia's capital, Ulaanbaatar, in a 'ger', a traditional tent. Her daughter attends primary school while her husband makes a water carriage then he sells it at Kharkhorin, one of the largest outdoor markets in Mongolia. 

Altantungalag helps support her family by operating two retail stalls where she sells building materials at Kharkhorin market. When she first began her business in 2003, she had 500,000 Mongolian Tugriks (MNT) in working capital but she has since expanded it to 2,400,000 MNT in working capital. She sells electric cords, locks, electric plugs, extension cords and other hardware items. . She is applying for a loan of 3,000,000 MNT to buy more materials for her second, new stall to sell to her customers during the busy shopping season ahead. 

Her main goal for 2011 is to build a house where her family will enjoy better living conditions.

loans.use: To buy more hardware to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Zagdsuren

texts.en:
Mrs.Zagdsuren is 38 years old and lives with her husband and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her family owns a small family house. Her husband Turtulga, 36, runs a transportation business carrying people between Ulaanbaatar and Zuunmod, the nearest city to the capital, 45 kilometers away from the capital. 

Zagdsuren has run a tailoring business for 11 years. She makes or fixes clothes and dresses according to her customers' orders. She is an experienced tailor who makes dresses starting from classic ones to traditional Mongolian national ones. She gets enough orders from customers, especially during national celebrations and weddings. She is asking for a loan to buy necessary spare parts and to do proper servicing of her husband's minivan.

loans.use: To buy necessary spare parts and to pay for servicing of her husband's minivan.

loans.name: Amma

texts.en:
Amma is 26 years old and lives in the area of Congo Town. She’s single and also a high school graduate. With little income coming in from her partner who sells gasoline at a mini service station, she was determined to make their lives better by starting up a small provisions shop. Amma has been in this business for a year now, and she enjoys the flow of her customers.

Amma is requesting a loan to purchase more rice, oil, etc., so as to enable her mini provisions store to become a bigger one. Her dream is to become an accountant in the nearest future.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, oil, etc.

loans.name: Marine

texts.en: Marine V. lives in Yeravan together with her two sons. Marine is a widow. She sells shoes and clothing.  Marine wants to develop her business. With the requested loan, Marine plans to purchase more clothing and shoes to increase her working capital. With the loan’s help she will get more income and insure better living conditions for her children.

loans.use: to pay for clothes and shoes for resale.

loans.name: Shelmith

texts.en: Shelmith is 38 years old, married and a mother of four.  She sells shoes to earn her living.  She has been in this business for four years.  She has learnt how to manage her business by budgeting and saving some money through Faulu Kenya.  She hopes to open a boutique in the future.  She has requested 15,000 Kes to buy shoes.

loans.use: To buy shoes for resale.

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Vivian is 30 years old and lives in the area of Congo Town. A freshman student at the university and still single, she has to take care of her twelve-year-old child.

Vivian has not given up and she operates her own little restaurant where she sells Liberian dishes and drinks. Vivian is requesting a loan to purchase more foodstuffs and drinks.

Vivian hopes to improve her child's education and educate herself as well.

loans.use: to purchase more foodstuffs and drinks.

loans.name: Moustafa

texts.en:
Moustafa is a 52 year old married man, father of four children, living and working in Beirut. Moustafa has worked  selling clothes since 1993. He is well known in his region. Moustafa sells men's wear and most of his friends, neighbors and relatives are his customers.  Mousatfa has received loans through Al Majmoua  4 times in the past.  He is an upstanding borrower and knows how to invest in his business. As with his previous loans, Moustafa is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua in order to buy new spring/summer collection to increase his income and fullfil his customers needs.
Moustafa hopes to expand his business more and to provide his family a secure healthy living.

loans.use: To buy a new Spring/Summer collection

loans.name: Davit

texts.en: Davit B. lives in Yerevan with his wife and children. He is engaged in the jewelry trade.  Davit’s family lives in his wife’s parents’ apartment. His wife’s parents themselves have moved abroad to find work there. Davit gets his main income from sales, but his financial means are not enough to meet the family needs and support his own household. So Davit wants to increase and develop his business. With the requested loan he plans to expand the jewelry inventory variety and increase sales.

loans.use: to pay for jewelry for resale.

loans.name: Kavule Effort Development Group A

texts.en: 38-year-old Florence N. operates a pharmacy in Nabuti-Mukono. The happily married mother of 5 has been operating the pharmacy for the past 7 years and she says she was inspired by her husband to try her hand at this business. Florence is a trained nurse and her training helps her a lot as she goes about her rounds. She says this business generates 130,000 shillings of profit per week. With the requested loan Florence plans to purchase more drugs to resell at her pharmacy.

loans.use: to purchase more drugs to sell at her pharmacy.

loans.name: Tuongozane Group

texts.fr: Kangesa K.  M. est entrepreneur, secrétaire du groupe d’affaire « Tuongozane »,  âgée de 44 ans, mariée, mère de 8 enfants dont 6 vont  à l’école. Son mari est un chômeur, sans emploi. La cliente Kangesa K.  M. est vendeuse des bananes. Elle exposeau marche central de Virunga.  Il ya 13 ans qu’elle exerce cette activité. Elle démarra son business avec de fonds propre issu d’une petite commission de vente parcelle de son voisin. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir de s’approvisionner avec des 80 régimes de bananes et la moitié sera affecté  à l’épargne. En plus, elle ambitionne agrandir son capital, scolariser ses enfants et construire une maison en dur.  La cliente Kangesa K.  M.  remercie Hekima pour  ses actions en faveur de pauvres exclus de banque classique. Il sied de signaler que le groupe d’affaire « Tuongozane » est majoritairement féminins.
texts.en: Kangesa K. M. is a businesswoman and secretary of the "Tuongozane" business group. She is 44 years old, married, and has 8 children, of whom 6 are in school. Her husband is currently unemployed. Kangesa K. M. sells bananas and displays her goods at the central market in Virunga. She has run this business for 13 years. She began her business with her own funds, issued by selling a small plot of land to her neighbour. This new loan will serve to supply her with 80 bunches of bananas, and the remaining half will be allocated to savings. In addition, her ambition is to enlarge her capital, educate her children, and construct a permanent home. Kangesa K. M. is thankful to Hekima (one of Kiva's field partners) for its actions on behalf of the poor who are excluded from the standard banking system. It is to be noted that the "Tuongozane" business group is composed primarily of women.

loans.use: to buy 80 bunches of bananas, and allocate the remaining half to savings.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Khurshed

texts.ru: Чеканов Хуршед проживает в районе Дж. Руми. Возраст, 39 лет. Женат. У него трое детей. Он более 5 лет занимается торговлей. В своей лавке он продает женскую и мужскую обувь. Еще он занимается продажей тканей. Кредит просит для покупки в оптом детской одежды и обуви, чтобы увеличить ассортимент своего товара.
texts.en: Khurshed C. lives in J.Rumy. He is 39 years old, married, and has three children. He has been working in trade for more than five years.  In his shop, he sells women’s wear and shoes.  He is taking out a loan to buy children's clothes and shoes wholesale, so that he can increase the variety of his goods.

loans.use: to buy children's clothes and shoes wholesale

loans.name: Margret

texts.en: Margret J. is 30 years old and divorced, with four children who are all in school. She is currently in the business of selling fruits and vegetables. Margret will use this loan to increase her stock of domestic animals. Her future goal is to pay for her children's school fees.

loans.use: to increase her stock of domestic animals.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en: Ruth is a 30-year-old married woman who lives in Congo Town. She has three children between the ages of 2-11, two of whom attend school. Ruth runs a beauty salon where she styles hair in her community. Ruth says it’s fun working in this business since there are more young women in her area and she raises a lot of money. Ruth is requesting a loan to buy more wigs, shampoo, conditioner, etc. to grow her business. In the future she hopes to have an international salon and send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more wigs, shampoo, conditioner, etc. for her salon.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more rice, oil, beans and cooking utensils for her restaurant

loans.name: Omar

texts.en:
Omar comes from the village of Kvemo Khvedureti in the Kareli District. He is 23 years old and lives with his wife Natia, two children and parents. Omar and Natia are leading the family agricultural activities. Their daughter is two years old and their son is one month old.  The parents are retired. 

The family has two cows. Their milk is used for cheese production. The cheese is sold locally. In addition, they own one hectare of agricultural land where potatoes, carrots, beets and onions are grown. Some of the vegetables are consumed by the family, but most of them are sold on the local market. 

With the requested credit, Omar will purchase potato and carrot seeds and fertilizers. He will sow these vegetables on his land and work hard during the whole season to have a good harvest. With the received profit, Omar plans to renovate his house. The family has a big house, but currently they can use only two rooms of it. The rest of the house isn't fit for living. It needs a thorough renovation.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Atee

texts.en: Atee R. is 24 years old, single and currently in the business of selling food in the local market. She plans to use the requested loan to purchase more food for sale. Her future goal is to pay for school fees.

loans.use: to increase her stock of food to sell.

loans.name: Sylvia

texts.en:
Sylvia T. lives in the Mengo Mackay neighborhood of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has 4 children, all of whom are in school. Sylvia   operates a retail shop and has been in this business for over 10 years. She works 7 days of every week selling her products at the market.

Sylvia has requested a loan of 1,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from Kiva's partner, MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap, jerrycans of cooking oil and other products. She also generates additional income through transporting people by motorcycle (called a boda-boda). The main business challenges for Sylvia's business include ever-increasing commodity prices and seasonality. 

Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a delivery van and also to educate her children through university. Sylvia lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding her family.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise such as bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of mineral water and bread to sell

loans.name: Charity

texts.en: Charity U. is 28 years old and married to a watchmaker. The couple has four children, two of whom are in school. She is currently in the business of selling fish and will use the requested loan to increase her stock of fish for sale. Charity's future goal is to build a bigger shop.

loans.use: to increase her stock of fish for sale.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en: Monica K. is 28 years old and married to a policeman. The couple has three children, one of whom attends school. She is currently in the business of selling food and plans to use the requested loan to increase her stock of food for sale. Her future goal is to build a small house.

loans.use: to increase her stock of food for sale.

loans.name: Nver

texts.en: Nver N. lives in Sisian with his wife, two sons and a daughter. Nver works at the school as a teacher. His son is a contract serviceman in the army. Unfortunately, the salaries are low and not enough to meet the family's needs. So Nver is also engaged in agriculture. He has applied to SEF to increase his livestock and develop farming. With the requested loan, Nver plans to buy sheep, fuel and seeds. With the loan’s help, Nver will get more income and be able to insure better living conditions for his family.

loans.use: to pay for sheep, seeds and fuel

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam N. lives in the Kalerwe neighborhood of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has 4 children, none of whom are in school. Mariam has a business selling cold drinks. She has been in this business for 2 years, and she works 6 days of every week. Mariam sells her products at the local market.

Mariam has requested a loan of 600,000 Ugandan Shillings from Kiva's partner, MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more boxes of water, crates of beer, passion fruits and sugar. She also generates additional income through selling chapatti (unleavened flatbread) and samosas (a type of pastry).The main challenges for Mariam's business include the rainy season and the ever-increasing prices of passion fruits and sugar.  

Her goals and aspirations for her business are to one day own a permanent business location. Mariam lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity but not to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include rent and food for her children.

loans.use: to buy more passion fruits, crates of soda and boxes of mineral water for sale.

loans.name: Sipura

texts.en: Sipura K. is 50 years old and divorced with four children, three of whom go to school. She is currently in the business of selling bread from her bakery and plans to use the requested loan to increase her stock of bread. Her future goal is to buy motorcycle.

loans.use: to buy more bread for sale.

loans.name: Ferina

texts.en: Ferina is currently in the business of selling green vegetables. She is 35 years old, married, and has five children. Four of them go to school. Ferina borrowed a loan to stock more green vegetables to sell. She hopes to expand in the future with extra profits from her business.

loans.use: to stock more green vegetables to sell

loans.name: Cicilia

texts.en: Cicilia P., 34 years old, is currently in the business of selling food. She will use her loan to stock more food. She is a widow with five children, but only two aren't going to school. Her goal is to take good care of her children's future.

loans.use: to stock more food for her business

loans.name: Odiljon

texts.en:
Odiljon A., a married father of one child, is a hardworking man who operates a bakery in a rented facility near the market of Shohmansur, where he sells his breads. Odiljon, who is helped by both his brother and sister in this business, is requesting a loan of USD1500 to purchase more flour for his enterprise. Prior to starting the bakery, he grew vegetables at home to sell at the market.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes its role as a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to buy flour for his bakery.

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora J. is 30 years old and married. She has four children and all of them go to school. 

Currently, she in a business of selling cabbage. She borrowed a loan to stock more cabbage to sell. 

She hopes to expand in the future with extra profits from her business.

loans.use: To stock more cabbage to sell.

loans.name: Kavule Effort  Development Group B

texts.en:
Teddy N., 50, has been operating a general merchandise retail shop for the past 10 years in Nabuti-Mukono. The happily married mother of three says she was inspired by her husband to start this business. 

At her shop she sells a wide variety of general retail commodities such as sugar, rice, soap, beans, rice, maize flour, basins, etc. She says this business generates 100,000 UGX weekly as profit.

With this loan, she says she is going to purchase more retail commodities to resell.

loans.use: to purchase more retail commodities to resell.

loans.name: Risolat

texts.en:
Risolat A. is 34 years old. She is married and has four children. She lives with her family in Kumsamgir, Tajikistan. 

She sells industrial products and grocery goods in the market. She has been in this business for a year. Her husband helps in this business. 

The loan she requests is to buy more products for her grocery store in order to get a better profit. She would like to get a loan of $3,000 USD to purchase new goods to increase the assortment of her goods and to provide working capital. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International:
Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes having been a key post along the Silk Road and having witnessed the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to epic mountain passes, a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC, and communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still lives in abject poverty.

IMON's History:
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit www.imon.tj

loans.use: To increase the assortment of goods for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine and tailoring kit

loans.name: Abd Al Jabar

texts.en:
Abd Al Jabar is a 33-year-old single man who lives in Chtaura with his elderly sick mother, who has no one except him to take good care of her. He started working 20 years ago; he was too young to work but life's necessities forced him to quit childhood and start another kind of life.
Abd Al Jabar is requesting a loan from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua, for the first time, in order to do necessary maintenance to cars he has already bought for trade. In fact it is easy for him to do this work since it has been his job for the previous 20 years. He works in repairing car bodies and painting them. He hopes to stay capable of taking good care of his beloved mother, and at the same time having his own family and improving his business.

loans.use: to do necessary maintenance on cars before resale.

loans.name: Zakaria

texts.en:
Zakaria is 51 years old. He lives in the village of Dighomi with his family. Zakaria and his wife Lia are engaged in agricultural activities. They own 2 cows and 200 sheep. With the milk of the cows and sheep, they produce cheese and sell it in their village. Lambs are also sold seasonally. Along with the above-mentioned, the family owns a greenhouse in the same village where they grow tomatoes. The tomatoes are sold to the vegetable wholesalers. 

Zakaria and Lia have two sons. One of them is 19 years old and a student. When he has time, he helps his parents in the greenhouse. 

With the requested loan, Zakaria wants to renovate the greenhouse and purchase feed for his sheep. Also, a part of the loan will be used for paying the study fee for their son. 

In the future, Zakaria plans to expand the business through increasing the amount of domestic animals on his farm.

loans.use: to purchase feed for sheep and materials for greenhouse renovation and to pay his son's study fee

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah is currently in the business of selling charcoal. She is 45 years old, married, and has eight children, only two of whom go to school. Sarah has taken a loan to stock more charcoal to sell. She hopes to expand her business in the future with the extra profits she makes.

loans.use: to stock more charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Nasiba

texts.en:
N. Nasiba is divorced and has two children. She is an active and hardworking woman. She works at home and feeds her children and is also engaged in farming. She cultivates agricultural products and sells them at the market. In this way she also feeds her family with vegetables. Nasiba would like to borrow 6,000 TJS to purchase fuel, lubricants, fertilizers and pesticides to expand her business.

More about Tajikistan
Tajikistan, a key post on the Silk Road, is perhaps best known for its rich history. It was the location for the end of Alexander the Great's rule, and is known for its great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country, with its epic mountain passes, is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language and a civilization that dates back to the fourth millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mix of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

However, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the USSR, damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93 per cent of the country is mountainous and only 7 per cent of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands of people to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

More about IMON International
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to buy fuel, lubricants, fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.name: Kamoliddin

texts.en: Kamoliddin is married with four children. He is a businessman from Kurgantyube. He offers car-repair services in his hometown. Kamoliddin launched this venture more than 20 years ago. He is an experienced technician who always tries to introduce newer equipment for a quality outcome of his work. His serious and responsible business approach has helped his business grow over many years. Kamoliddin is seeking a loan of $1,500 to purchase spare parts for the different vehicles he repairs in his workshop. A broader assortment of necessary parts will help Kamoliddin attract more customers to his venture; thus, increasing his monthly income. Kamoliddin is very serious about loan repayment. He has repaid previous loans without any delinquencies. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes being a key post along the Silk Road, and for the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to purchase spare parts to repair vehicles.

loans.name: Zachary

texts.en:
Zachary is a hardworking businessman who sells cooked maize and beans (githeri). He has been in the business for two years. He is able to provide for his family with the income he gets from his business.  

Through Faulu Kenya, he has been trained on business management. This has helped him to run his business well. He hopes to own a piece of land in the future. 

He has requested for 20,000 Kenyan shillings to build a stall and buy maize and beans.

loans.use: to build a stall and buy maize and beans.

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en:
Pauline is 22 years old and lives in Congo Town. She studied up to 5th grade only. She is single and has two children, ages 1 and 4.

In 2003, Pauline started a local restaurant where she sells Liberian food; sometimes it’s difficult to purchase food items like fish and meat, but she makes sure to purchase some anyway.

Pauline is requesting a loan to purchase more rice, coal, meat, fish and food items for her restaurant.

She wishes to open an account with an international bank and improve herself and her children's educational standards.

loans.use: to purchase rice, coal, meat, fish and food items for her restaurant.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en: Lucia is currently in the business of selling green vegetables. She is 35 years old, married, and has five children, three of whom go to school. Lucia took out a loan to stock more green vegetables to sell. She hopes to expand in the future with extra profits from her business.

loans.use: to stock more green vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Philip

texts.en: Philip is a 30-year-old member of Yie group in Faulu Kenya. He runs a salon and a barber shop so as to earn a living. He has been running the business for six years with three employees. Being a married man with two children, he works hard in his business so that he can provide for his family. He hopes to expand his business in five years. He has requested 30,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) to buy more chairs and shaving machines.

loans.use: to buy more chairs and shaving machines

loans.name: Gor

texts.en:
Gor S. is 36 years old and lives in the Tsakhkunk village area of Sevan. Gor is married and has a daughter and a son. 

Gor and his wife sustain their family by means of farming. They work very hard and they raise cows and calves, sheep and lambs. 

Gor intends to enlarge his farm, which will allow him to earn more in the future. Therefore he is asking for a 1,000,000 Armenian dram (AMD) loan to buy five sheep and four calves for his farm.

loans.use: to buy five sheep and four calves for his farm

loans.name: Jamshed

texts.ru: Амонов Чамшед проживает в районе Вахш. Ему 35 лет. Он женат, имеет 2 детей. Его жена, домохозяйка. Сам он занимается производством. У него высшее образование, он инженер. В основном он производит строительные материалы, то есть шпаклевку и водоэмульсионную краску. Целью кредита является закуп химикатов и пластмассовых ведер для производства.
texts.en: Jamshed A. lives in the Vakhsh region. He is 35 years old. He is married and has two children. His wife is a homemaker. He does manufacturing. He has higher education in engineering. He mainly produces building materials such as putty compound and latex paint. The purpose of the loan is buy chemicals and plastic buckets for production.

loans.use: to buy chemicals and plastic buckets

loans.name: Jenty

texts.en: Jenty is currently in the business of selling clothes and other items. She is 42 years old, married, has four children, two of whom go to school. Jenty took out a loan to stock more clothes and other items to sell. She hopes to expand in the future with extra profits from her business.

loans.use: to stock more clothes and other items to sell.

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en:
Theresa is a 26-year-old woman and lives in the Congo Town area, she's single and has a five year old daughter who is presently in school.

Theresa has been running a beauty parlor for nine years, and she hope to make it well known in the entire country. Theresa is requesting a loan to purchase more hair, cosmetics and dryers for her business.

She hopes her living conditions will improve in the near future.

loans.use: purchase more hair, cosmetics, and hair dryers

loans.name: Habibakhon

texts.ru: Абдурасулова Хабибахон проживает в районе Бохтар. Возраст, 56 лет. Она замужем. У нее двое детей. Она имеет среднее образование. Более 6 лет занимается животноводством. Она разводит скот у себя дома. В основном она откармливает и продает скот. Кредит берет для закупа крупнорогатого скота, чтобы увеличить их количество.
texts.en: Habibakhon A. lives in Bohtar. She is 56 years old, married, and has two children. She has a secondary education. She has been working in animal husbandry for more than six years.  She raises cattle at home. Basically she fattens and sells cattle. She is taking out a loan to buy cattle to increase her herd.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is currently in the business of selling clothes and dressmaking supplies. She is 49 years old, married, and has five children, two of whom go to school. Grace took out a loan to stock more clothes and dressmaking supplies to sell. She hopes to expand in the future with extra profits from her business.

loans.use: to stock clothes and dressmaking supplies

loans.name: Poghos

texts.en:
Poghos L. lives in the village of Akhali Khulgamo, in Ninotsminda municipality. He is 55 years old and married. Poghos and his wife Memzar have one son who is married. Poghos has a five-year-old grandson and a four-year old granddaughter. 

The source of the income for the family is agriculture. They are busy with stock-breeding and farming. The family has nine milk cows and four calves. Poghos and Memzar produce cheese and sell it locally. The calves are grown and sold locally. The family also owns 1.25 ha of agricultural land where they grow potatoes. Harvested potatoes are sold to the vegetable wholesalers. 

Poghos requested a loan to purchase additional calves. They will be raised and sold for a higher price. The gained profit will be reinvested in stock-breeding to expand the business and the family income.

loans.use: to purchase calves

loans.name: Zoya

texts.en:
Zoya is married with two children. She sells clothing at the central market in Novomoskovsk and has been in this business for ten years. During this time she has obtained many repeat customers who come again and again to buy clothing from her. 

There is a high demand for this type of clothing, so Zoya is going to continue developing her business. She has got enough energy and enthusiasm for this. Zoya also hopes that two her sons will continue this business in the future. 

Zoya would like to borrow 10,000 Ukrainian hryvnias (UAH) to purchase more seasonal clothing for sale. She hopes to increase her sales and make additional income for her family.

loans.use: to purchase seasonal clothing for sale

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel M. N. has been in the quarry business for 11 years and makes a profit of 17,500 Kenyan shillings (KES). He is married to Paskaline and they have three children. 

He was introduced to KADET Ltd. by a client who is already registered with KADET Ltd., and he is applying for his first loan so that he can buy another quarry site. He sells stones to his customers from Machakos, Athi River, Kitengela and Nairobi. 

The anticipated profit he will use to buy a lorry for transportation of stones to customers, and in the future to acquire a big quarry site to produce more stones to meet his customers' demand. He is very hard working.

loans.use: to purchase another quarry site

loans.name: Mullojon

texts.en:
I. Mulllojon is a hardworking man who is married and has four children. His wife is engaged in sewing dresses. He works as a taxi driver. In order to make a good profit to insure his children receive an education, Mullojon works from early morning till late at night. He would like to get a loan of 5100 Somoni to purchase spare parts for his car. With that way he will provide a comfortable ride for his clients. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to buy spare parts and pay for car repairs

loans.name: Sabohat

texts.ru: Хужамурадова Сабохат проживает в районе Чиликул. Возраст, 33 года. Она замужем, детей не имеет. Её муж находится в России. Сама она после отъезда мужа занялась торговлей. Сейчас у нее имеется продуктовый магазин. В этой области она три года. Кредит берет для покупки печенья, вафель, консервированных продуктов и хлопкового масла.
texts.en: Sabohat K. lives in Jilikul. She is 33 years old, married, and has no children. Her husband is in Russia. After her husband left, she started working in trade. Now she has a grocery shop. She has been doing this work for three years. She is taking out a loan to buy cookies, wafers, canned goods, and cottonseed oil.

loans.use: to buy cookies, wafers, canned goods, and cottonseed oil.

loans.name: Isaack

texts.en:
Our newest agent, Isaack B., has managed to save a substantial amount of money on his daily expenses by using Solio. He enjoys the light given by the Solio and his children are able to study longer into the night. 

With the money that he saves and the weekly reactivation fees, he has been able to set up a grocery business. The reactivation key has given him the status of ‘Mr. Stima’ (Mr. Electricity) in his community as he is in charge of 10 pieces of the Solio Kit which he reactivates for all clients under him for a fee. 

Solio has also helped Isaack in managing different people and making sure that they reactivate, which is both a challenging and enjoyable experience for him.

loans.use: to buy solar powered kits for others in his community to use

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en: Emelia G. is 30 years old and married to a soldier. The couple has three children, but unfortunately, none of them are in school. Emelia is in the food business. She is requesting a loan to stock more goods to sell and increase her inventory. In the future, Emelia’s goal is to build a big house.

loans.use: stock more goods to sell

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en: Lucia is 42 years old and married with six children. Four of her children go to school. Lucia is in the fish-selling business and is requesting a loan to purchase more fish to sell. In the future, Lucia hopes to increase her profit and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fish to sell

loans.name: Ghahraman

texts.en:
Ghahraman D. lives in Dovrus village, Syunik region, with his wife and son. Ghahraman’s son works at a school as a custodian, receiving a very small salary. Their main income comes from agriculture.  

Ghahraman’s financial means are not enough for him to develop his agriculture activity. He has applied to SEF for a loan to increase his herd and purchase seeds. Ghahraman has taken out several loans from SEF, and each time the loans have helped him to develop the business further.

loans.use: to pay for livestock and seeds.

loans.name: Beglar

texts.en:
Beglar K. is a farmer from the village of Mirashkhani in the Aspindza district. He is 44 years old and married. Beglar and Naziko, his wife, have two adult children. Their son is 17 years old and their daughter is 14 years. Naziko is a person with physical disabilities and receives financial assistance (70 Laris per month) from the government. 

Except for the pension, the only source of income for the family is agricultural activities. In particular, Beglar has two milk cows and five calves. He sells dairy products as well as calves locally. The family also owns a 0.5 hectare of agricultural land where they grow potatoes. The potatoes are also sold locally.

Beglar requested a loan to purchase potatoes for seeding. He will work hard the whole season and hopes that he gets a good harvest. Part of the received profit after the harvest season will be invested in the dairy farm and additional milk cows will be purchased. It will result in increased sales of dairy products and more income for the family.

loans.use: to purchase potatoes for seeding

loans.name: Sabina

texts.en:
Sabina is currently in a business of selling beans and cooking oil. She is 28 years old and married with three children; only one of them goes to school. 

Sabina borrowed a loan to stock more beans and cooking oil to sell. She hopes to expand her business with the extra profits in the future.

loans.use: to stock more beans and cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Cicilia

texts.en: Cicilia K., 45 years old, is in the business of selling alcohol. She will use her loan to stock more alcohol. A widow with six children, two of whom attend school, Cicilia's long-term goal is to buy a plot of land.

loans.use: to stock more alcohol.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary, who is currently in the business of selling groundnuts and simsim, is 35 years old, married, and has five children, three of whom go to school. Mary is requesting a loan to stock more groundnuts and simsim to sell, and hopes to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to stock more groundnuts and simsim to sell.

loans.name: Berenika

texts.en: Beremika K. is 37 years old and is currently in the business of selling vegetables. She will use her loan to stock more vegetables. She is a widow with eight children, but only two are not in school. Her future goal is to develop her business.

loans.use: to stock more vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Joice

texts.en: Joice is currently in the business of selling books. She is 26 years old and married with two children. One of them goes to school. Joice borrowed a loan to stock more books to sell. She hopes to expand in the future with extra profits from her business.

loans.use: to stock more books to sell.

loans.name: Wangnignigbe 2 Group

texts.fr:
Le groupement WANGNIGNIGBE 2 est composé de 19 membres qui se connaissent compte tenu du fait qu'ils cotisent ensemble dans le même quartier. La présidente de ce groupement, du nom de Eugenie, est celle ayant un doigt levé sur la photo. Dans le but de rehausser le niveau de leur activité afin de mieux faire face à la demande de leur clientèle, ce groupement sollicite pour la première fois l'appui financier de ALIDé.
Eugenie est née le 07 Février 1982 à Comè au Bénin. Eugenie est mariée à un soudeur du nom de Désiré et est mère de deux enfants, tous scolarisés. En plus de ses enfants, Eugenie a un autre enfant à sa charge. Il y a près de cinq ans que Eugenie s'est installée avec sa famille à Ouedo, dans la commune d'Abomey Calavi. Depuis trois ans, Eugenie prépare de la nourriture (pâte de maïs accompagnée de sauce aux poissons, riz, etc.) qu'elle vend dans son restaurant à Ouèdo. Cette activité lui génère des revenus l'aidant à subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants. Eugenie achète ses produits à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, et parfois au marché de Cococodji. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle, Eugenie sollicite ensemble avec ses autres membres, un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Son ambition est de faire de son restaurant une référence dans l'arrondissement de Ouèdo.
texts.en:
The "Wangnignigbe 2" group is composed of 19 members who know each other given the fact that they run their businesses together in the same area. The president of this group, named Eugenie, is the one whose finger is raised in the photo. With the goal of raising the level of their businesses in order to better meet the needs of their clientele, this group is seeking its first loan through ALIDÉ (one of Kiva's field partners).
Eugenie was born on 7 February 1982 in Comè, Benin. She is married to a welder named Désiré and has two children. both of whom are in school. In addition to her own children, Eugenie has one other child in her care. Close to five years ago, Eugenie and her family settled in Ouèdo, in the town of Abomey Calavi. For three years, Eugenie has been preparing food (maize paste accompanied by fish sauce, rice, etc.) that she sells at her restaurant in Ouèdo. This business generates an income that helps her provide for herself and her children. Eugenie buys her goods at Dantokpa, the international market in Benin, and sometimes at the Cococodji market. With the goal of strengthening her business and better satisfying her clientele, Eugenie, along with her fellow group members, is seeking a loan through ALIDÉ. Her ambition is to make her restaurant a landmark in the arrondissement of Ouèdo.

loans.use: to buy maize, fish, vegetable oil, and sauce condiments

loans.name: Joice

texts.en: Joice K. is 35 years old and she is currently in the business of selling vegetables. She will use her loan to stock more vegetables to sell.  She is married to a policeman and they have six children, three of whom are in school. Her future goal is to develop her business.

loans.use: to stock more vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en: Betty is currently in the business of selling perfumes. She is 24 years old and married with two children. Only one of them goes to school. Betty borrowed a loan to stock more perfumes to sell. She hopes to expand with extra profits from her business in the future.

loans.use: to stock more perfumes to sell.

loans.name: Yen

texts.en: Yen S., 48, resides in Prey Veng province, Cambodia, an area known as one of the largest rice producing regions in Cambodia. S. is a housewife while her husband is a construction worker, earning an income of $3 per day. Each month, the family has to spend $20 on food and $50 on the other necessary expenses. S. is requesting a loan of $1,000 to help one of her children get married. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to pay for one of her children's wedding.

loans.name: Zambarau Group

texts.en:
Sauda A. is in her late twenties and is married with one little son.  She has a pharmacy which she has been running for two years. She works from 7:00 am to 10:00 pm daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be Sauda's second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loan to increase the pharmacy stock and has paid back her loan successfully.  She hopes for a loan to buy more medicines for the pharmacy. Her dream is to one day own a big pharmacy and also build her own house.

Sauda will share this loan with her loan group "Zambarau", which has a total of 15 members.  The members of the group will hold each other accountable is paying back their loans.

In the picture, Sauda is in a flowered dress, second from left.

loans.use: to buy more medicines.

loans.name: Phan

texts.en: Phan C., 41, resides in Prey Veng province, Cambodia, an area known as one of the largest rice producing regions in Cambodia. C. is a housewife while her husband is a construction worker, earning an income of $10 per day. Each month, the family has to spend $42 on food and $50 on the other necessary expenses. C. is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase a generator for her husband to improve his construction business. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy a generator for her husband's construction business.

loans.name: Joice

texts.en: Joice is currently in the business of selling Irish potatoes. She is 30 years old and married with six children, only two of whom go to school. Joice borrowed a loan to stock more Irish potatoes to sell. She hopes to expand her business with extra profits in the future.

loans.use: to stock more Irish potatoes to sell.

loans.name: Serop

texts.en:
Serop K. lives in the village of Skhvilisi in the Akhaltsikhe district. Serop is 56 years old. He is married and lives with his wife Alina. 

Serop and Alina are farmers and farming is the only source of income for them. They own 1.75 hectare of agricultural land. The biggest part (1 hectare) of this land they use to grow potatoes and the rest is used to grow cabbage and onions. The land is very fertile in this part of the country, so they always get a good harvest. The vegetables are sold in September locally to the vegetable wholesalers. 

With the requested loan, Serop plans to purchase potatoes for seeding as well as fertilizers. He hopes that this season will be favorable for their farm. After he sells the harvest, he plans to purchase a small truck, which will be used for transporting the vegetables. When he has his own transportation, he will take the harvested vegetables to the capital city and sell them for a much higher price. It will significantly increase the income of the family and they will be able to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase potatoes and fertilizers

loans.name: Jipe Moyo Group

texts.en:
Selestine R. is in his mid-thirties and is married with one son who goes to school. He has been running a grocery store for seven years. He works from 9.00am to 11.00pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Selestine's 11th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He used his previous loans to increase on his grocery stock. He also bought more tables and chairs, paid rent and bought some land. He has paid back his loans successfully. He hopes for a loan to increase his stock of groceries.  His dream is to one day own his place and have a big grocery.

Selestine will share this loan with his loan group "Jipe Moyo", which has a total of 16 members.  The members of the group will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

In the picture, Selestine is a fat man in the middle at the back in a dark shirt.

loans.use: to increase his stock of groceries.

loans.name: Ema

texts.en: Ema is currently in the business of selling sweet potatoes. She is 23 years old and married with two children, neither of whom goes to school. Ema borrowed a loan to stock more sweet potatoes to sell. She hopes to expand in the future with extra profits from her business.

loans.use: to stock more sweet potatoes to sell.

loans.name: Srey

texts.en:
Srey Y. resides in Battambong province, Cambodia, an area known for quality rice products. Y. sells dessert, earning an income of $2 per day. Her husband is a construction worker, earning an income of $3 per day. Each month, the family has to spend $80 on food and $20 on the other necessary expenses. 

Y. is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase a motorbike for her husband to commute to work. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more groceries to stock the store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more second-hand clothes.

loans.name: Yem

texts.en: Yem B. resides in Battambong province, Cambodia, an area known for quality rice products. B. and his wife are farmers, earning an income of about $2 each per day. Each month, the family has to spend $50 on food and $13 on the other necessary expenses. B. is requesting a loan of $1,200 to purchase pigs and build a pig pen. This will be his first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy pigs and build a pig pen.

loans.name: Charity

texts.en: Charity is currently in the business of selling cassava. She is 23 years old and married with four children, only two of whom go to school. Charity borrowed a loan to stock more cassava to sell. She hopes to expand in the future with extra profits from her business.

loans.use: to stock more cassava to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to add to his stock of timber and wood glue.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes is currently in the business of selling bananas. She is 30 years old and married with eight children, two of whom go to school. Agnes borrowed a loan to stock more bananas to sell. She hopes to expand in the future with extra profits from her business.

loans.use: to stock more bananas to sell.

loans.name: Phorn

texts.en: Phorn C., 44, is married and resides in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia, an area known for rubber plantations. She sells groceries, earning an income of about $4 per day. Her husband is a motor-taxi driver, earning an income of around $3 per day. Each month, the family has to spend $50 on food and $35 on the other necessary expenses. She is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase more groceries to stock the store. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to stock her store.

loans.name: Maelewano Zomboko Group

texts.en:
Arafa S. is in her early sixties and is married with four children and grandchildren.  She has been selling vegetables for many years.  She works from 6:00 am to 5:00 pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Arafa's 3rd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to build her small house and has paid back her loans successfully.  She hopes for a loan to buy more coconuts and vegetables to sell. Her dream is to one day finish her house.

Arafa will share this loan with her loan group, "Maelewano Zomboko", which has a total of 15 members.  The members of the group will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

In the picture Arafa is 1st on the left, covering herself with a yellow sarong.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables and coconuts to sell.

loans.name: Prom

texts.en: Prom C., 31, is married and resides in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia, an area known for rubber plantations. She sells fruits, earning an income of about $5 per day. Her husband is employed at a rubber plantation, earning an income of $2 per day. Each month, the family has to spend $124 on food and $25 on the other necessary expenses. She is requesting a loan of $1,200 to purchase a motorbike for her husband to commute to work. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for her husband to commute to work.

loans.name: Kong

texts.en: Kong N., 52, is married and resides in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia, an area known for rubber plantations. She produces traditional cakes to sell, earning an income of about $6 per day. Her husband buys cows to resell, earning an income of $1.50 per day. Each month, the family has to spend $65 on food and $35 on the other necessary expenses. She is requesting a loan of $600 to purchase chickens to resell. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy chickens to resell.

loans.name: Tep

texts.en: Tep M., 43, is married and resides in Takeo province, Cambodia, an area known for Pre-angkorean temples. M. raises pigs, earning an income of about $2 per day. Her husband raises ducks, earning an income of around $4 per day. Each month, the family has to spend $20 on food and $50 on the other necessary expenses. M. is requesting a loan of $1,200 to purchase more ducks to raise for sale. This will be her second loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy more ducks to raise for sale.

loans.name: Joshua

texts.en:
Joshua is a resident of Nkubu in Central Kenya and has been in farming for 15 years, producing bananas, maize, beans and eggs. His produce is sold locally. He is married and has three children between the ages of 16 and 7. They all attend school. He gets additional income from his employment as a driver.

Joshua has requested a loan of 47,250 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says the dairy cow will improve his income and make him able to expand his farming more and educate his children.

Joshua says the challenges in the farming business are in finding funds for purchasing farm supplies and for paying laborers, which are costly. He is glad, however, that Juhudi loans are accessible.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Manano

texts.en: A. is 25 years old and married with two children, one of whom goes to school. She sells rice and beans. A. is requesting a loan to buy more rice and beans to sell. In the future, she hopes to use her profit to expand her business.

loans.use: buy rice and beans to sell

loans.name: Chouk

texts.en: Chouk V., 47, is married and resides in Phnom Penh City, Cambodia, the most populated area in the country. V. and her husband produce chess tables, earning an income of about USD 3 each per day. Each month, the family has to spend USD 150 on food and USD 20 on the other necessary expenses. Chouk is requesting a loan of USD 700 to purchase wood to produce more chess tables. This will be her third loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy more wood to produce chess tables

loans.name: Geresa

texts.en: Geresa J. is 30 years old, married, with 8 children. 6 of them go to school. Geresa currently is in a business of selling tomatoes. She is asking for a loan lo to stock more tomatoes to sell. Geresa hopes to expand in the future with extra profits from her business.

loans.use: Stock more tomatoes to sell.

loans.name: Duncan

texts.en:
Duncan C. is a resident of Kitale Town in Western Kenya. He is married with three children ages between 11 years and three months. Duncan has been in farming for 6 years producing milk and selling to the local market. He employs two farmhands. 

Duncan is requesting  a loan amounting to 81,000 KES  to purchase and insure a dairy cow through Juhudi Kilimo as well as to put up a dairy unit. He says the income will make him financially stable and better able to take care of his family. He is also focusing on owning better dairy breeds.

Duncan says getting reliable suppliers of quality dairy breeds is still a great challenge as often the breeders can not be trusted to be truthful about the breeds..

loans.use: Purchase and insure  a dairy cow and to build a dairy unit

loans.name: Las Paceñas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LAS PACEÑAS” iniciará su primer ciclo  en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Cascada, está compuesta por once integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Tomasa. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: taller de costura, venta de repuestos de minibús, tejido de chompa, venta de sal yodada, tejido de macrame, tienda de barrio, comidera, venta de golosinas, macrame de mantas.

La señora Tomasa,  indica que es el segundo ciclo en una asociación comunal en Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de los promotores que fueron a su zona. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio venta de golosinas que viene realizando hace siete años atrás; este negocio lo desarrollo poco a poco.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para la compra de golosinas (que servirá para incrementar su capital) los que adquiere de la Ceja (lugar comercial de la cuidad de El Alto), posteriormente lo venderá en la Escuela Republica de Japón, de lunes a viernes, todo el día.
