Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es soltera y vive con sus dos hijos.
  
Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la salud.
texts.en:
The communal bank "LAS PACEÑAS" is beginning its first loan cycle in Pro Mujer, which belongs to the Cascada Social Center.  It is comprised of 11 members and led by a board of directors presided over by Mrs. Tomasa.  The businesses of the members vary and include: sewing, minivan repair parts sales, knitting of sweaters, iodized salt sales, macrame weaving, convenience store, diner, sweets sales and blanket macrame.

Mrs. Tomasa says this is her second cycle in Pro Mujer and she was invited to join by promoters in the area.

She plans to use the loan to buy sweets (to increase her capital) in Ceja (a commercial area in El Alto city).  She will sell them in the "Escuela Repubica de Japón" school from Monday through Friday, all day long.  This work allows her to generate an income to support her family as best she can.  She is single and lives with her two children.

When asked what she likes best about Pro Mujer, she says health is most important.

loans.use: To buy sweets

loans.name: Maya

texts.en:
Maya is 33 years old, married and has two children: a 13-year-old boy and a 7-year-old girl. Both children go to school. Maya and her family live in the village of Nakhshirghele, Terjola District. The main source of income for the family is agriculture. They have four milk cows and produce traditional Georgian cheese. Tsinadzes always have cheese clients, because they produce quality cheese. Also, the family owns a 1 hectare plot of the land. Part of this land is used for a vineyard and the other part for strawberry and nut growing. The harvested fruits are sold locally. 

Kakhaber works in a local factory making construction materials. He also helps his wife with the farming activities. 

Maya requested a loan for the purchase of an additional milk cow. It will allow her to produce more cheese and increase the family income. Maya and Kakhaber plan to make some savings and invest in the further development of their farming activities.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow.

loans.name: Fanny

texts.en: Fanny is seeking a loan of $3,000 from Grameen America to support her ice cream truck business.  Fanny has been a member of Grameen America for the past two years, during which time she has received three loans and proven herself to be an exemplary borrower.  In fact, she has never missed a payment and has established herself as a leader and a source of support among her fellow Group and Center members.  Prior to receiving her first loan, Fanny was working at McDonald’s and dreaming about starting her own business.  Now, she operates a successful food truck business where she sells ice cream and other treats.  Fanny plans to use this latest loan to upgrade to a bigger ice cream truck and to purchase the food she needs to fill it.  Having a larger ice cream truck will allow Fanny to capitalize on the major increase in her business that comes with the warmer months.  With this loan, she expects to see her business boom and to get even closer to her dream of opening a store-front ice cream shop.

loans.use: to purchase a larger ice cream truck

loans.name: Angelique

texts.en: Angelique is 32 years old, with 5 children between the ages of 10 and 2 years old. Her husband is a farmer and they are both hardworking. Angelique has been selling banana juice for 3 years. She is requesting a loan to buy more banana juice. She hopes to use the profits to buy more equipment for her business.

loans.use: to buy banana juice for sale

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es:
Silvia pertenece al banco comunal “Espíritu Santo” perteneciente a la ciudad de Talcahuano. Ella tiene una peluquería ubicada en un local el cual arrienda desde hace 6 meses aproximadamente, es un lugar muy concurrido, por lo que su clientela es frecuente. Silvia se dedica a éste rubro desde hace 15 años, su horario laboral es de 10ºº de la mañana hasta las 20ºº hrs., de lunes a sábado. Sus materiales los compra en tiendas y distribuidoras de productos de belleza.
Con el préstamo comprará materiales para su peluquería, específicamente tinturas, oxidantes, secador de cabello y una máquina desvelladora.
Sus metas son contratar a una persona que la ayude en el negocio, ya que por ahora Silvia trabaja sola. Además sus proyectos son instalarse con un Centro de estética integral. 
Sus sueños a nivel personal son obtener su casa propia, ya que a causa del terremoto del 27 de febrero del año 2010, perdió todo, incluyendo su negocio y vivienda.
Silvia vive junto a su esposo y su hija de 17 años de edad.
Silvia está muy contenta y agradecida del crédito otorgado por Fondo Esperanza, ya que con éste podrá invertir y generar mayores ganancia, respecto a las reuniones ella se divierte junto a los demás socios del grupo, ya que las reuniones son gratas y hay muy buena convivencia.
De los talleres impartidos, Silvia ha aprendido a administrar su negocio y tener cierta contención emocional con su clientela, ya que usualmente llegan a comentarle sus experiencias de vida. Ella en general está muy contenta con lo que realiza, ya que es su pasión. 
Talcahuano es una comuna y ciudad-puerto de la región del Biobío, al sur de Chile.Es conocida como uno de los principales puertos del país. Su nombre en mapudungun (lengua mapuche) significa "cielo tronador". Posee un paisaje natural  muy atractivo, debido a la combinación de ríos, mar, planicies fértiles, vegas y los cuerpos montañosos, con una hermosa vegetación. Su economía gira en torno a su puerto, su Base Naval, y un importante barrio industrial con empresas siderúrgicas, refinería de petróleo, petroquímica, cemento, gas, etc.
texts.en:
Silvia belongs to the “Espíritu Santo” (Holy Ghost) community bank which is located in the city of Talcahuano.  She owns a hairdressing salon in premises that she has been renting for approximately six months.  The salon is located in a very busy place and so she has frequent customers.  Silvia has been in this line of work for 15 years.  She works from 10.00am to 8.00pm, from Monday to Saturday.  She buys her materials from stores and beauty product distributors.

Silvia will use her loan to buy materials for her hairdressing salon, specifically dyes, oxidation dyes, a hair dryer and clippers.

Silvia's goal is to hire a person to help her in her business since right now she works on her own.  She also plans to set up an esthetic center in her business.

Silvia's dream on a personal level is to obtain her own home since she lost everything in the earthquake on February 27th, 2010, including her business and home.

Silvia lives together with her husband and her 17 year-old daughter.

Silvia is very happy and grateful to have been offered a loan by Fondo Esperanza since it will enable her to invest and make more profit.  As regards the meetings, she enjoys herself together with her fellow group members since the meetings are pleasant and they all get on very well together.  Through the workshops Fondo Esperanza provide, Silvia has learned how to manage her business and how to provide a certain level of emotional support to her customers as they often relate their life experiences to her.  In general Silvia is very happy with what she does since it is her passion.

Talcahuano is a municipality and city-port in Biobío region, in the south of Chile.  It is known as one of the main ports in the country.  The name in Mapudungun (Mapuche language) means 'thunderous sky'.  It has very attractive natural landscape owing to the combination of rivers, sea, fertile plains, meadows and mountains, with beautiful vegetation.  The city's economy is based around its port, its naval base and an important industrial area with iron and steel companies, oil refineries, petrochemical companies, cement companies, gas companies, etc.

loans.use: to buy materials for her hairdressing salon, specifically dyes, oxidation dyes, a hair dryer and clippers

loans.name: Haidi

texts.en:
Haidi has a successful business selling t-shirts, accessories, calling cards and other novelty items out of her own store. She is effusive about her love for her job and the benefits of running her own business. While she had a store prior to joining Grameen America one year ago, she lacked enough capital to fully stock it with inventory and therefore struggled to make the business profitable.

With Haidi’s first two loans, she was able to sell a variety of new products and saw her business begin to thrive. She is now seeking a third loan of $1,500 to purchase additional inventory, such as clothing and accessories, to sell at her shop. Haidi has spent years learning her trade and knows that she can continue steadily growing her business as long as she has access to the necessary loan capital. Haidi is a hardworking, successful microentrepreneur, and a loan of $1,500 is all she needs to work towards making her dreams a reality. Haidi has two young children and looks forward to creating an even more prosperous life for her family.

loans.use: to pay for inventory (clothes, accessories, etc) for her store.

loans.name: Unidad Vecinal Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “UNIDAD VECINAL” iniciará su primer ciclo  en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Cascada, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Sonia. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: comercio de comida, venta de ropa, venta de artículos para el hogar, apertura de negocio.

La señora Sonia,  indica que es la primera ves que integra una asociación comunal en Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de los promotores. En la actualidad ella quiere iniciar un negocio de tienda en su zona, por recomendación de un familiar.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para la comprar mercadería para la tienda (fideo, arroz, aceite, panes, etc.) que pretende comprar de los mayoristas. Esta forma de trabajo le permitirá generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella vive en unión libre y tiene un hijo.
  
Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación en salud y crédito
texts.en:
The “UNIDAD VECINAL” [Neighborly Unity] community bank began its first cycle in Pro Mujer, as a part of the Cascada center. It is made up of eight members and led by a board of directors headed by Sonia. The members' businesses in the community bank are varied. Among them we have: selling food, selling clothes, selling household items, opening a business.
 
Sonia indicates that this is the first time that she has belonged to a community bank in Pro Mujer. She joined at the invitation of the promoters. At present, she wants to open a store in her area, on the recommendation of a family member.    

The loan she will take out now is to buy merchandise for the store (pasta, rice, oil, bread, etc.). She itends to buy them from wholesalers. This work will allow her to generate resources to support her family as much as possible. She is in a common law marriage and has a son. 
  
When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the health and credit trainings.

loans.use: to buy store merchandise

loans.name: Seraphine

texts.en: Seraphine is 35 years old, with 4 school-going children between the ages of 6 and 16 years old. Her husband is a farmer who also helps her run her business. Seraphine has been selling beef and goat meat for 6 years and the business has helped her pay her children’s school fees. She is requesting a loan to buy more goats and cows to slaughter. She plans to save all her profits and open up another business later on.

loans.use: to buy goats and cows.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to outfit her house

loans.name: Wazo Tageta Group

texts.en:
Rozi S. is in her late twenties and is married. She has had a food sales business for one year. She works from 6:30 a.m. to 6:00 p.m. daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be Rozi's third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to increase her stock and to pay school fees for her brother's sister. Rozi has successfully repaid her loans. She hopes for a new loan to buy a sack of rice, half a bucket of cooking oil and a sack of wheat flour. Her dream is to one day open a moderate restaurant.

Rozi will share this loan with her loan group "Wazo Tegeta" which has a total of 17 members, who will hold each other accountable in repaying their loans. In the picture, Rozi is in the middle of the front row wearing a green and white blouse.

loans.use: To buy rice, cooking oil and wheat flour.

loans.name: Drogba Group

texts.en:
Hamisi Husan is in his early thirties and is married with four children who are still in school. He has been running a fish business for 2 years. He works from 7:00am to 4:00pm (7 hours) daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be Hamisi's second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loan to build his own house and has paid back his loan successfully. He hopes for a loan to finish his house. His dream is to open a big fruit and vegetable business.

Hamisi will share this loan with his loan group "Drogba" which has a total of 15 members. The members of this group will hold each accountable in paying back their loans.

In the picture, Hamisi is first on the right.

loans.use: to finish his house

loans.name: Roin

texts.en:
Roin B. comes from the village of Siktarva, Terjola district. He is 38 years old and unmarried. He lives with his parents, Elena and Ilia. They are retired, but both of them are in good health and help Roin run his agricultural business. Roin had been serving in the Georgian army for several years. A couple of years ago, he resigned and started farming. 

Butskhrikidzes have three milk cows. They produce traditional Georgian cheese, which is sold at the local market by Elena. Also, they own 1 hectare of agricultural land with a vineyard and 300 nut trees. With the grapes, Roin produces wine and vodka which he sells to the local population. Nuts are sold to the local market as well. 

With the requested loan, Roin will purchase eight sheep. He will sell cheese and wool. For the first couple of years, he plans to reinvest all profit gained from breeding sheep into the business, in order to increase the number of sheep and expand the business.

loans.use: to purchase eight sheep.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence is 38 years old. She has 5 children who are between 2 and 13 years old and all are in school. Florence is married to a welder.She is a tailor and she does tailoring in a room in which she sells sugar salt and other items.She has been selling sugar,soap(blue)etc, for 2 years as you can see from her photo back ground.Together with her tailoring business she affords to pay school fees for her children. She is requesting a loan to buy more sugar and some welding equipment for her husband.

loans.use: To buy sugar to sell

loans.name: Dali

texts.en:
Dali G. is a 60-year-old farmer. She lives in the village of Siktarva in the Terjola district. Dali is married and has a daughter, Khatuni, who is 38 years old. Khatuni is unmarried. 

The income of Dali and Ruben’s (husband) family comes from agricultural activities. In particular, they have two milk cows. They use the milk to produce traditional Georgian cheese and sell it on the local open market. In addition, they have a small pig-breeding farm with one pig and piglets. Piglets are sold to the wholesaler. Along with the above-mentioned activities, the family has a one-hectare vineyard.  Dali and Ruben produce wine and sell it to the wholesaler. 

Dali requested a loan to build a new cattle-shed where she can have much more than two cows. In the future, she plans to increase the number of cows on her farm and she will need a bigger cattle shed. Cheese produced by Dali is of high quality and is demanded on the local market. According to her estimations, when she has more cows she won’t have problems selling the increased amount of the cheese. It will positively impact her family’s income and they will be able to purchase new items for the household, in order to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase materials to build a cattle shed

loans.name: Benediction Group

texts.fr:
BENEDICTION est un groupement constitué de quinze personnes et dont la présidente (celle qui a le doigt levé sur la photo) est nommée Eugenie. Les membres du groupe se connaissent parce qu'ils ont l'habitude de faire des cotisations dans le même quartier à Abomey Calavi. Dans le but d’augmenter leur fonds de roulement, ce groupement sollicite pour la première fois, un crédit auprès de ALIDé.
Née le 05 Avril 1961 à Dassa-Zoumè dans le département des Collines, Eugenie vit depuis dix ans à Tankpè, dans la commune d'Abomey Calavi. Eugenie est mariée à un monsieur nommé Placide et a un enfant, qui est scolarisé. En dehors de son enfant, Eugenie a un autre enfant à charge. Eugenie assure ensemble avec son mari les différentes charges de la maison. Eugenie a arrêté l'école au cours secondaire. Depuis une quinzaine d'année, Eugenie vend divers produits (maïs, haricot, riz, conserves, savons, etc.) dans sa boutique size à son domicile. Cette activité lui génère des revenus l'aidant à contribuer aux dépenses familiales. Eugenie achète ses produits à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin et au marché de Houègbo au Bénin. Ce premier prêt permettra certainement à Eugenie et à son groupe de rehausser le niveau de leur activité et d’accroître leur clientèle et leur revenu. Dans l'avenir, Eugenie ambitionne construire une maison et la mettre en location.
texts.en:
"Benediction" is a group composed of 15 people whose president (the one with the raised finger in the photo) is named Eugenie. The group members know each other because they usually run their businesses in the same area of Abomey Calavi. With the goal of increasing its working capital, this group is seeking its first loan through ALIDÉ (one of Kiva's field partners).
Born on 5 April 1961 in Dassa-Zoumè in the department of Les Collines, Eugenie has lived for ten years in Tankpè, in the town of Abomey Calavi. She is married to a gentleman named Placide and has one child, who currently attends school. In addition to her own child, Eugenie has another child in her care. Eugenie and her husband take care of the various household expenses together. Eugenie ended her studies at the secondary level. For about fifteen years, she has sold various items (maize, beans, rice, canned goods, soap, etc.) at her store located in her home. This business provides her with an income that helps her contribute to the family's expenses. Eugenie buys her goods at Dantokpa, the international market in Benin, and at the Houègbo market in Benin. This first loan will definitely allow Eugenie and her group to raise the level of their businesses and increase their clientele and income. In the future, Eugenie's ambition is to build a house and rent it out.

loans.use: To buy canned goods, maize, beans, manioc flour, and soap.

loans.name: Haydee

texts.es:
Haydee forma parte del banco comunal “Espíritu Santo” perteneciente a la ciudad de Talcahuano. Ella se dedica al corte y confección de ropa en general. Su taller de costuras lo tiene ubicado al interior de su casa. Sus clientes son colegios, empresas y particulares. Confeccionando uniformes y costuras en general. En su taller Haydee cuenta con 3 máquinas de coser, entre estas una máquina de coser en línea, otra bordadora y una overlook básica. Sus materiales los compra en la ciudad de Concepción y cuando se da la ocasión de viajar a la ciudad de Santiago compra ahí sus materiales. Además la hermana de Haydee la ayuda con las compras y se las envía a la ciudad de Talcahuano por encomienda. 
Con el préstamo comprará una máquina de coser overlook industrial. Además de materiales para sus costuras, específicamente telas.
Sus metas son ampliar su negocio y contratar a una persona que le ayude en el taller, ya que durante todo el año la demanda de sus servicios es alta. Solo durante los meses de mayo, junio y julio, las ventas tienden a disminuir. Sin embargo todo el año llegan a su casa clientes particulares. 
Haydee vive junto a su esposo, su hija de 24 años y su nieto de 4 años de edad. Su hija estudia Construcción Civil. Sus sueños a nivel personal, son poder brindarle a su familia un mejor bienestar. 
Haydee está muy agradecida del crédito obtenido por Fondo Esperanza, ya que con éste podrá invertir en su negocio y generar mayores ganancias. Las reuniones a las cuales asiste son muy gratas y comparte bastante con los demás socios del banco comunal. Con las capacitaciones ha podido incorporar a su negocio diferentes técnicas de contabilidad, sobre todo en el registro de ingresos y gastos generados en su negocio. 
Talcahuano es una comuna y ciudad-puerto de la región del Bíobío, al sur de Chile. Es conocida como uno de los principales puertos del país. Su nombre en mapudungun (lengua mapuche) significa "cielo tronador". Posee un paisaje natural  muy atractivo, debido a la combinación de ríos, mar, planicies fértiles, vegas y los cuerpos montañosos, con una hermosa vegetación. Su economía gira en torno a su puerto, su Base Naval, y un importante barrio industrial con empresas siderúrgicas, refinería de petróleo, petroquímica, cemento, gas, etc.
texts.en:
Haydee is a member of the “Espíritu Santo” (Holy Ghost) community bank which is located in the city of Talcahuano.  Her business is general dressmaking.  Her sewing workshop is located in her home and her customers are schools, companies and private customers.  She makes uniforms and clothes in general.  In her workshop, Haydee has three sewing machines: one straight line machine, one embroidery machine and one basic overlock machine.  She buys her materials in the city of Concepción and when she needs to she also travels to the city of Santiago to buy her materials there.  Haydee's sister also helps her with her purchases and sends her parcels to the city of Talcahuano.

Haydee will use her loan to buy an industrial overlock sewing machine.  She will also buy materials for her sewing work, specifically fabrics.  Her goals are to expand her business and to hire someone to help her in her workshop since the demand for her services is high throughout the year.  Only during the months of May, June and July do her sales tend to drop.  However, throughout the year she receives private customers in her home.  

Haydee lives together with her husband, her 24 year-old daughter and her 4 year-old grandson.  Her daughter is studying civil construction.  Haydee's dream on a personal level is to be able to better provide for her family's well-being.

Haydee is very grateful for the loan she has been offered by Fondo Esperanza since it will enable her to invest in her business and make more profit.  She finds the meetings to be very pleasant and she shares a lot with the other members of her community bank.  The training sessions have enabled her to incorporate different accounting techniques into her business, above all as regards the recording of incomings and outgoings in her business.

Talcahuano is a municipality and city-port in Bíobío region, in the south of Chile.  It is known as one of the main ports in the country.  Its name in Mapudungun (Mapuche language) means 'thunderous sky'.  It has a very attractive natural landscape, owing to the combination of rivers, sea, fertile plains, meadows and mountains, with beautiful vegetation.  Its economy revolves around its port, its naval base and an important industrial area with iron and steel companies, oil refineries, petrochemical companies, cement companies, gas companies, etc.

loans.use: to buy an industrial overlock sewing machine and materials for her sewing, specifically fabric

loans.name: Ronald

texts.en:
Ronald M. S. is 38 years old, widowed and has 2 children ages 13 and 6 years old, whom he hopes to give good education to the university level. 

Ronald is a charcoal dealer in Mombasa. Mombasa is along the coastal region of Kenya and is well known for its many tourist attraction sites, particularly the Indian ocean white beaches. Ronald has been selling charcoal for the last 2 years to the local people and has managed to give employment to 2 people. He says that this business is profitable, but the major challenge he has is there are so many people in the same kind of business as his in the area, so customers are spoiled for choice. However, he works very hard to keep his business doing well. He is using his loan of 50,000 KES to buy more charcoal to expand his business. He hopes to grow his business and start supplying gas in the future. He describes himself as a visionary man.

loans.use: purchase charcoal to sell

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is 44 years old and lives in Sinkor. She is married and her husband has his own business. They have three children aged 13, 8 and 4. All of the children live at home and are attending school. 

For three years, Sarah has operated a small shop where she sells drinks, milk, soap, tissue and other products. She opened it with her own money. She is proud to have a business that attracts customers and is happy when they come to her store to shop. Sometimes she sells on credit and has had problems with a few customers who don't want to pay. 

Sarah has requested a loan to purchase drinks, milk, soap, tissue and other products to restock her shop. In the future she wants to build a house and be a successful businesswoman.

loans.use: to purchase drinks, milk, soap, tissue and other products to restock her shop.

loans.name: Nino

texts.en:
Nino K. lives in the village of Pkhero in the Adigeni district. She is 51 years old. Nino is married and has a 24-year-old daughter and 23-year-old son. 

Nino has a grocery store in the village. She sells different types of grocery products in the store. Her average monthly profit is 270 Laris. Nino's husband Bejan is a farmer who earns on average 200 Laris per month. 

The house where Nino’s family lives is very old and needs capital for renovation. Nino wants to create a clean and comfortable environment for the family. She decided to request a loan for house renovation. She hopes that the improvement of their living conditions will positively impact their business activities as well.

loans.use: to purchase materials to renovate her house

loans.name: Aminata

texts.en:
Aminata is 37 years old and lives in Sinkor. She is married and her husband is in business. They have two children aged 21 and 20 who are living on their own. 

For ten years Aminata has run a small shop where she sells soap, bread, drinks and other products. She opened the shop with the help of her husband and likes being in business because it makes her respected in the community. 

Aminata has requested a loan to purchase more soap, bread and drinks. In the future, she plans to build her own house.

loans.use: to purchase more soap, bread and drinks.

loans.name: Hilda Yaneth

texts.es:
La joven Hilda Yaneth F. N. es propietaria de un salon de belleza que opera bajo el nombre de SALA DE BELLEZA VENUS, ahi presta los servicios de cortes de pelo, estetica y cosmetología femenina y masculina, cuenta con  mas de 3 dos años de experiencia en deicho negocio, tiene una buena clientela gracias a los buenos trabajos que realiza, su negocio se encuentra ubicado a media cuadra al este de Banhcafe en las cercanías  del centro de la Ciudad de Danlí, lo que le permite a sus clientes el fácil acceso.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de productos de uso en su salón y asi surtir su negocio con una gama de productos de primera calidad para la satisfacción de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Hilda Yaneth F. N. is the owner of a beauty salon called SALA DE BELLEZA VENUS (Venus Beauty Salon). In it, Hilda offers haircuts as well as cosmetic services for men and women. She has over three years of experience in this business and has developed a good client base, thanks to the high quality of her work.

The business is located to the east of  Banhcafe, in the suburbs of the city of Danlí. This location allows Hilda's clients to have easy access to her services. Hilda will use the loan to purchase supplies for her salon in order to be able to offer a good range of first-quality products to ensure satisfaction of her clients.

loans.use: to purchase shampoo, conditioner, lotions, creams, oils, etc

loans.name: Livingstone

texts.en:
Livingstone O. is a married man. His wife is a businesswoman and they have three children aged between nine years old and two months old. They hope to educate their children to the university level. Livingstone operates motorcycles in Kakamega. Kakamega is a rich agricultural region in the western part of Kenya. The region is known for its large-scale production of sugarcane and thus it is called the sugarbelt region. 

Besides this business, Livingstone runs a clothing sales shop. He has been running this business for ten years and has managed to give employment to one person. His motorcycle business is profitable and his major challenge is weather changes: during the rainy seasons, the roads become impassable and people prefer to use vans. However he works very hard to keep his business doing well. He is using his loan of Kes 80,000 to buy clothes and handbags to boost his clothing sales business. He hopes to grow his businesses and in the future buy a plot of land where he will build a house. He describes himself as focused and determined.

loans.use: to buy clothes and handbags for his shop.

loans.name: Afoussetou

texts.fr: Mme Afoussetou est âgée de 35ans. Elle est mère de 02 enfants et est mariée à un militaire. Elle revend des produits de premières nécessités (savon, lait, sucre, huile végétale, riz…)   au marché de Kégué après l’avoir acheté au grand marché de Lomé. Elle fait cette activité depuis 2006. Ce second prêt lui servira  à acheter des produits de premières nécessités afin d’accroitre son activité et s’occuper en partie de sa famille.
texts.en: Ms. Afoussetou is 35 years old. She is the mother of two children and is married to a military serviceman. She re-sells basic necessities (soap, milk, sugar, vegetable oil, rice, etc.) at the Kégué market after buying these items at the grand market in Lomé. She has run this business since 2006. This second loan will serve to buy basic necessities in order to enlarge her business and thus contribute in part to the care of her family.

loans.use: to buy and sell primary necessities (milk, sugar, rice, etc).

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David M. W. is thirty-five years old and married. His wife is a pharmacist and they have two children aged six and four. They hope to educate their children to the university level. David runs a general store in Sheywe, in Kakamega. Kakamega is a rich agricultural region in the western part of Kenya. It is known for its large scale production of sugarcane and thus called the sugarbelt region. 

David has been running his business for one year. His business is profitable and the major challenge he has is the low income of his customers. However he works very hard to keep his business doing well. Besides this business, David and his wife run a pharmacy in Nairobi. He is also a civil servant working with the ministry of gender and social serivces. He is using his loan of Kes 85,000 to restock his general store to meet the demands of his customers. He hopes to grow his businesses and become the market leader in businesses in Kakamega. He describes himself as self-motivated, dynamic, optimistic and he says that the sky is the limit.

loans.use: to buy sugar, rice, cooking oil, and detergents for his store.

loans.name: Genesis Group

texts.es:
el grupo Genesis esta ubicado en la La Redonda Jamastran, esta integrado por 3 personas que se conocen muy bien, trabajan juntos y tienen sus propios negocios, juntos han logrado salir adelante, a continuacion se detallan las diferentes actividades que ellos realizan:

la sra. Santos Cristina López R. se dedica al comercio, cuenta con una pulpería y bici partes, tiene varios años experiencia en el manejo de este tipo de negocio, permitiéndole tener muy buena clientela, en su negocio se encuentra de todo un poco, tanto para el consumo y a su vez una variedad de repuestos para bicicletas, este transporte es bien popular en la zona ya que les facilita el traslado para sus trabajos, estudios o de recreación.
el negocio de doña Cristina ha ido teniendo un crecimiento significativo ahora ya cuentan con energía eléctrica y ya puede vender productos que requieren refrigeración tal como ser carnes embutidos refrescos charamuscas, paletas y lácteos        
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de mercadería y asi surtir mejor su negocio y mantener de todo un poco y satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes.     

la sra. Nohemí del Carmen R. se dedica al comercio, vende ropa americana clasificada, tiene 4 meses de dedicarse a dicha actividad ya que anteriormente tenia una pequeña pulpería la que tuvo que quitar,  una vez instalada la energía eléctrica en la zona los negocios mas grandes compraron equipos de refrigeración y ella no contaba con capital para invertir en su negocio y esto hizo que su negocio bajara y es po eso que opto por dedicarse a otra actividad generadora de ingresos, es así que doña Nohemí instala el nuevo negocio de venta de ropa americana la que sale a vender a sus vecinos y lugares circunvecinos tanto de contado como de crédito, con los ingresos que le genera este negocio cubre sus gastos personales y los gastos del hogar.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de un fardo de ropa americana de verano y así lograr satisfacer la demanda de su exigente clientela.     

el sr. Santos Julián López R. se dedica a la micro agroindustria pues siembra granos básicos, como el rió pasa por la cercanías de la comunidad de donde vive aprovechan a lo máximo para le riego de una pequeña parcela de tierra que consta de media manzana, este rubro que ha tomado auge en la zona ya que las condiciones climatológicas se prestan para el cultivo de granos basicos, Santos comercializa a los compradores que vienen de la republica de El Salvador, los que pagan a buen precio el producto, también a compradores de la zona que abastecen el mercado local.      
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de insumos y fertilizantes para lograr un mejor desarrollo en su cultivo.
texts.en:
The Genesis group is located in La Redonda Jamastran.  It has three members who know each other very well.  They work together and also have their own businesses.  Together they have managed to get ahead.  Here we will provide details of their different business activities:

Santos Cristina López R. sells products.  She has a grocery store and a bicycle parts business.  She has several years experience in running this type of business which means that she has a very good customer base.  In her business, you can find a little bit of everything, both food products and, at the same time, a variety of bicycle parts.  This mode of transport is very popular in her area since it enables people to get to work and school and is also used for recreational purposes.

Cristina's business has been experiencing significant growth.  She now has electricity and can sell products that require refrigeration such as cold cuts, soft drinks popsicles and dairy products.

Cristina will use her loan to buy merchandise so that she can better stock her business and have a little bit of everything available so that she can meet her customer demand.

Nohemí del Carmen R. sells products.  She sells American clothes.  She has been in this business for four months.  Before this she used to have a small grocery store which she had to abandon.  Once they installed electricity in the area, the bigger businesses bought refrigeration equipment and she didn't have enough capital to invest in her business.  This meant that her business declined.  For this reason, she decided to start another business activity in order to make money.  She set up her new business selling American clothes.  She goes out to sell to her neighbors and in neighboring areas.  She makes her sales both for cash and on credit.  She uses the income from this business to cover her personal expenses and her household expenses.

Nohemí will use her loan to buy a bundle of American summer clothes so that she can satisfy her customers.

Santos Julián López R. is a small farmer.  He grows basic grains.  As a river passes nearby the community where he lives, he takes maximum advantage in order to irrigate a small plot of land which measures half a 'manzana' (note: one 'manzana' = 1.68 acres).  This business has risen in his area since the climatic conditions lend themselves to growing basic grains.  Santos sells to buyers who come from El Salvador.  They pay a good price for his produce.  He also sells to buyers from his area who supply the local market.

Santos will use his loan to buy supplies and fertilizers so that he can improve his crops.

loans.use: to buy bicycle parts, butter, oil, margarine, beans, rice, sugar, coffee, bread, soft drinks, juices, corn flour, salt, condiments, eggs, used clothes, basic grains to grow and fertilizers

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr: Agée de 43ans, Mme Afi est veuve et mère de d’un(01) enfant. Elle réside à Adéhui  et est revendeuse d’œufs. En 2008 elle a démarré l’activité en s’approvisionnant à Zanguéra et en revendant à Adéhui  dans sa maison. Elle a payé ses 02 derniers prêt sans difficultés et sollicite ce troisième prêt pour acheter des œufs pour revendre  pour accroître du bénéfice afin de mieux s’occuper  de son seul enfant  vu qu’elle est veuve.
texts.en: Ms. Afi is 43 years old, widowed, and has one child. She lives in Adéhui and is a retailer of eggs. In 2008, she began this business by supplying herself in Zanguéra and re-selling her goods in Adéhui at her home. She repaid her two previous loans without difficulty, and is seeking this third loan to buy eggs for resale in order to increase her profits and thus be able to better take care of her only child, given that she is a widow.

loans.use: to buy and re-sell eggs.

loans.name: Joseph S.'s Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you teachers of the Yoni-Banna Secondary School in Mile Ninety-One, a town in northern Sierra Leone. Yoni-Banna Secondary School was founded in 1964 by the UMC Mission. Currently, the school is staffed with 45 employees and has an enrollment of 1,500 pupils. 

Joseph S. S. is a teacher at the school and leader of this group of borrowers. The 43-year-old Joseph was born in Magburaka, a town in northern Sierra Leone. He has been in the teaching profession for 17 years. He is married and has four children – one in primary school, two in secondary school and one in college. Joseph has requested this loan in order to buy household materials - a generator and chairs. 

Staff from this institution, like many other schools within SMT’s operational areas, come to SMT to apply for loans. At the end of each month, these teachers can repay the loan out of their monthly salaries. The institution’s bursar is directly responsible for deducting the repayment and pays SMT on their behalf.

(Also pictured in the bottom right corner of the photo is Daniel A. F., a borrower who was not able to be present for a group photo.)

loans.use: to buy a generator and chairs.

loans.name: El Reflejo Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal “EL REFLEJO”, está conformado por 18 integrantes, pertenecientes a la ciudad de Linares. Todos ellos se dedican a diferentes rubros los cuales son venta de ropa interior, perfumes, joyas, pescados y costuras.
Carmen quien en la foto se encuentra al fondo del grupo, su cabello está tomado y su color es castaño claro, además viste una polera color lila y un suéter color negro y su rostro se encuentra enmarcado con un color rojo. Ella se dedica al corte y confección de ropa de todo tipo.  Su horario laboral es de lunes a domingo, durante las tardes. Su taller de costuras lo tiene ubicado al interior de su casa. Sus clientes son principalmente particulares. Quienes demandan sus servicios principalmente para arreglar y/o modificar algunas prendas. Sus materiales los compra en la ciudad de Santiago, ya que los precios para comerciantes son a bajo costo, por ende más convenientes. Además sus maquinarias también las arregla en ésta ciudad. 
Con éste préstamo comprará telas e hilos para abastecerse de materiales e invertir más en su negocio. 
Sus metas son tener algún día una boutique para ofrecer sus confecciones, actualmente se encuentra confeccionando ropa de cama, específicamente sábanas y cojines que debe realizar a mano. Por lo tanto éste es un proyecto que ya se está concretando. Además le gustaría tener como clientes a colegios y empresas. 
Carmen vive junto a sus dos hijos de 13 y 22 años de edad, además de la compañía de su hermana. A su hijo menor le gusta el rubro del comercio, él es quien acompaña a Carmen en todos los trámites de su negocio, ya sea entrega de ropa a los clientes y compra de materiales.
Ella está muy agradecida del crédito obtenido por Fondo Esperanza, ya que le ha brindado la oportunidad de emprender su negocio y concretar sus proyectos.
Respecto a las reuniones grupales, estas son muy gratas, además que comparten experiencias y datos, por lo que existe una muy buena comunicación y solidaridad entre ellos. 
Linares es un importante centro urbano de la región del Maule, ubicado en la zona centro del país. En esta zona se desarrolla de manera importante la producción agrícola y también vitivinícola sobresaliendo en el ámbito de las exportaciones. Destacan los cultivos de cereales (arroz, trigo, maíz y avena), hortalizas (remolacha, repollo, lechuga y acelga y legumbres) y frutas. Linares es la principal provincia productora de arroz, en Chile; de hecho, el 78% de la producción nacional de este cereal se da en esta provincia, especialmente en la comuna de Parral.
texts.en:
There are eighteen members of El Refejo Community Bank in the town of Linares. They have a variety of jobs such as selling underwear, perfume, jewelry, fish, and sewing.

At the back of the group in the photograph is Carmen with the light brown hair, lilac-coloured t-shirt, black sweater, and pink complexion. She makes all types of clothing and works every day of the week in the afternoons. Her workshop is located inside her house. Most of her customers are private individuals who primarily come to her to have alterations made to their clothes. She buys her supplies in Santiago where people with businesses can get lower prices, and it’s also more convenient too. She can get her sewing machines mended there also.

With this loan Carmen plans to buy fabric and thread so she can have more supplies on hand. Her goal one day is to have a store where she can sell the items she makes. Currently she is making bedding (sheets and pillow cases) which have to be done by hand so she only does this by special order. She would like to have schools and businesses as customers.

Carmen lives with her two children aged 13 and 22 and her sister. Her younger son would like to have his own business so he helps Carmen with the paperwork, deliveries of clothing to customers, and buying supplies.

She is very grateful for the loan from Kiva partner Fondo Esperanza as it has given her the opportunity to get her business going on a better footing. The group meetings are enjoyable as the members share experiences and information--everyone communicates with and supports each other. 

Linares is an important town in the Maule region located in the centre of the country. Agriculture is very important, and grapes for export are of increasing importance. Cereal crops (rice, wheat, maize, oats) and vegetables (beets, cabbage, lettuce, chard) and fruit grow well. Linares is the main producer of rice in Chile with 78% of national production coming from this province, especially from the community of Parral.

loans.use: to buy sewing supplies

loans.name: Allabeko Group

texts.fr:
Mme Compaoré est la présidente du groupe allabeko.Elle est mariée et mère de 5 enfants. Le plus âgé a 16 ans et le moins âgé a 3 ans.4 de ses enfants vont à l’école. Elle a 5 personnes a sa charge.

Mme Compaoré vend des gâteaux, des fruits et légumes et du sésame. Elle pratique l’activité depuis 12 ans. Elle s’approvisionne au marché de sanba.ses clients sont les gens du quartier (voisins).

Elle veut utiliser son argent pour acheter de la farine de blé en vu d’augmenter sa vente de gâteaux.

Mme Compaoré veut utiliser les bénéfices de son activité pour nourrir ses enfants et participer aux frais  scolaire de ses enfants qui vont a l’école. Elle a comme ambition de vendre ses gâteaux plus loin que le quartier dans les autres zones de son pays. Elle veut mettre l’eau et le courant dans sa famille
texts.en:
Madame Compaoré is the president of the Allabeko group. She is married and the mother of 5 children. Her oldest child is 16 and her youngest is 3. 4 of her children go to school She is responsible for caring for 5 people.

Madame Compaoré sells cakes, fruits and vegetables, and sesame. She has had this business for the past 12 years. She buys her supplies at the Semba Grand Market. Her clients are her neighbors.

She wants to use her loan to buy wheat flour in order to produce more cakes.

Madame Compaoré wants to use the profits from her business to feed her family and contribute to the school fees for her children who go to school. Her ambition is to sell cakes further from her neighborhood and in other parts of the country. She would like to install running water for her family.

loans.use: to buy a sack of wheat flour to make her cakes

loans.name: Torre Fuerte Group

texts.es:
El grupo solidario Torre Fuerte se dedica a la actividad comercial desde hace muchos años y son personas que se conocen muy bien y en esta ocacion decidieron formar un grupo para trabajar y asi salir adelante con sus negocios y sus familias. a continuacion se detallan las diferentes actividades que ellos realizan:

La señora Maria Elizabeth P. V. se dedica a la venta de pan, su negocio esta ubicado en su casa de habitacion en la colonia Obrera de San Lorenzo Valle, Maria se dedica a dicha actividad desde hace varios años, produce semitas, pan de yema y galletas.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de huevos, harina, margarina, manteca, azucar, vainilla y leña.

La señora Fatima Lourdes F. esta casada y se dedica a la venta de refrescos y jugos, por las tardes se dedica a prestar los servicios de corte de cabello ya que tambien es estilista profesional.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de refrescos, jugos y perfumes.

El joven Danny Ulises S. M. se dedica a la venta de mariscos como ser pescado rojo, pescado blanco y camarones, su producto lo vende en la comunidad de Santa Rosa de el pais de El Salvador y tambien en el mercado municipal de San Lorenzo, Danny se dedica a esta actividad desde hace 5 años y su negocio marcha bien,  quiere expandir mas su negocio.
el credito lo utilizara para compra de pescado y camaron.
texts.en:
The Torre Fuerte group’s members have all been involved in business for many years. They know each other well and one day decided to form a group to work together and thus help each other and their families to get ahead both in business and in life in general. 

Information about their jobs:
Sra. Maria Elizabeth P. Villatora had been a baker for several years. Her business is located in her home in the neighbourhood of Obrero de San Lorenzo Valle. She makes semitas, yema bread, and cookies. She plans to use the loan to buy eggs, flour, margarine, butter, sugar, vanilla, and firewood.

Sra. Fatima Lourdes F. is married. She sells soft drinks and juices, and in the afternoons she works in a hair salon as she is also a professional stylist. She will use the loan to buy soft drinks, juices, and perfumes.

Danny Ulises S. M. is a young man who sells seafood such as different kinds of fish and shrimps in the community of Santa Rosa in El Salvador, as well as in the municipal market of San Lorenzo. He’s had this job for five years, and all is going well. He wishes to expand his business and will use the loan to buy fish and shrimps.

loans.use: to buy eggs, flour, margarine, butter, sugar, vanilla, firewood, seafood, drinks, perfumes.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Dédé Sikavi

texts.fr: Jeune dame active de 22ans, Mme sikavi est revendeuse de produits de produits cosmétiques  et réside à Hédzranawoé. Elle achète au Grand Marché de Lomé et revend au marché de Hédzranawoé. Elle veut accroitre son activité et ajouter à cette dernière d’autres activités génératrices de revenu  c’est pour cela elle sollicite ce second prêt pour acheter  des produits cosmétiques et des tissus pour revendre à ses nombreuses clientes afin d’avoir de profit  pour s’épanouir. Elle se donne à cette activité il ya 02ans.
texts.en: An active young lady aged 22, Ms. Sikavi is a retailer of cosmetics and lives in Hédzranawoé. She buys her goods at the Grand Market in Lomé and re-sells them at the market in Hédzranawoé. She wants to increase her business and also wants to add alternative income-generating activities. She is thus seeking this second loan to buy cosmetics and fabric to re-sell to her many customers in order to obtain a profit that will allow her business to bloom. She has devoted herself to this business for two years.

loans.use: to buy and re-sell cosmetics.

loans.name: Mee Group

texts.en:
Elita C., 37, operates a retail business that sells groceries in Gweru where she lives. She has applied for this loan through MicroKing for the purposes of increasing her stock levels by buying sugar, rice, bread, soap, etc. 

Elita and her husband are both teachers and get their supplementary income from their teaching professions. They have two children aged 13 and 10, both attending school. Elita has been running the business for the past 10 years and she employs one person. 

She faces some transportation challenges on deliveries as well as competition. Low stock levels are a cause of concern for her and she hopes that the capital injection will assist on increasing the stock levels. She envisions herself operating from her own shop premises and diversifying into selling electrical goods. 

Note: In the photo, the lady seated is Elita.

loans.use: to increase her grocery shop stock levels

loans.name: Old Zengeza 5 Corner Shop Club Group

texts.en:
Alfred A. is the leader of Old Zengeza 5 Corner Shop Club from Chitungwiza and he is a vegetable vendor.  He is 42, married, and has three children aged 22, 17 and 10. The one aged 10 is still attending school.  

Alfred has been in the business of selling vegetables and fruits for 13 years now and does not have any other sources of income as his wife does not have any form of employment.  His main challenge is lack of enough capital that forces him to travel for orders on a daily basis. 


Alfred requested this loan through MicroKing for the purposes of buying tomatoes, green vegetables, sweet potatoes, apples and bananas for resale. He sees the loan amount improving the family's income and ultimately the quality of life for the family. He sees himself operating many stalls with increased income streams in the near future

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables for resale

loans.name: Wangnignigbe Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe WANGNIGNIGBE est formé de sept personnes qui se connaissent depuis leur enfance. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Antoinette, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. C’est la première fois que ce groupe sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de leur activité.
Antoinette est mariée à un menuisier du nom de Antoine. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés et vivant à leur charge. Antoinette habite Saint Louis  dans la commune d'Abomey Calavi avec ses enfants et son mari depuis treize ans. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges familiales. Il y a près de treize ans que antoinette  mène comme activité la vente  de mêche. Parallèlement à cette activité, Antoinette  vend des produits cosmétiques. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et de mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle, Antoinette désire obtenir un autre financement, ensemble avec ses autres membres.
texts.en:
The "Wangnignigbe" group is composed of seven people who have known each other since childhood. The group representative, named Antoinette, is the one whose hand is raised in the photo. This is the first time that this group is seeking financial support through ALIDÉ (one of Kiva's field partners) with the goal of raising the level of their businesses.
Antoinette is married to a carpenter named Antoine. The couple have four children, all of whom are in their care and attend school. Antoinette has lived in the Saint Louis area of the town of Abomey Calavi with her husband and children for thirteen years. The couple takes care of the family expenses together. For close to thirteen years, Antoinette has run a business selling hair extensions. Along with this activity, she also sells cosmetics. With the goal of strengthening her business and better responding to her customers' demands, Antoinette would like to obtain another loan together with her fellow group members.

loans.use: to buy hair extensions and cosmetics.

loans.name: Deborah Group

texts.en:
Sichelesile N., 28, has applied for a loan from Kiva partner MicroKing Finance to restock stationery. She will utilize the loan money to buy binding and laminating material, as well as books and ball point pens for resale. She also offers typing and photocopying services and has eight years of business experience. She employs five people. 

Sichelesile comes from the city of Gweru, which is normally referred to as the city of progress. She takes good care of her four children aged 10, eight, six and two, of whom three are attending school. Her husband works for scripture union and together they take care of two other dependents. 

Sichelesile is hopeful that a capital injection will prove beneficial for the future growth of her business. She desires to open and operate a big bookshop and Internet cafe. She is also very grateful for the financial support to women and the empowerment of women. 

Note: In the photo, the lady seated is Sichelesile.

loans.use: To buy binding & laminating material and books for resale

loans.name: Ester

texts.es:
Ester forma parte del banco comunal “Premio al Esfuerzo” perteneciente a la ciudad de Concepción. 
Ella tiene un almacén en el cual vende abarrotes, frutas y verduras, está ubicado al interior de su casa. Se dedica a éste negocio desde hace 2 años.
Su mercadería la compra generalmente en supermercados mayoristas y distribuidoras, donde los precios son a bajo costo y convenientes para el negocio de Ester. Su familia la ayuda en el traslado de mercadería. 
Con el préstamo comprará mercadería para abastecer su negocio.
Sus metas son tener un local establecido en el cual pueda ofrecer y vender sus productos de abarrotes, frutas y verduras.
Sus sueños son reconstruir su casa, ya que a causa del terremoto del 27 de febrero del año 2010, su vivienda fue destruida, por lo que necesita reparaciones. 
Ester vive junto a su hijo, quién en la actualidad se encuentra hospitalizado debido a un accidente laboral, por lo que Ester debe concurrir diariamente a visitarlo, debido a esto ha postergado la atención de su negocio. 
Ester está muy contenta y agradecida del crédito obtenido por Fondo Esperanza, ya que con éste podrá invertir en su negocio y generar mayores ganancias. Las reuniones a las cuales participa son muy amenas, por lo que se siente a gusto. 
Concepción, está asentada en la desembocadura del río Bíobío, uno de los más grandes del país, al sur de Chile, en la región del Bíobío. Ha tenido una importante función en nuestra historia, siendo sede de importantes batallas y asentamiento relevante, especialmente durante la Guerra de Arauco, por estar en la frontera con territorio mapuche. Actualmente la ciudad posee un importante desarrollo económico y demográfico, llegando a ser considerada como uno de los núcleos urbanos, demográfico, administrativo, financiero y comercial más relevantes de Chile, después de Santiago y Valparaíso.
texts.en:
Ester is a member of the Premio al Esfuerzo Community Bank in the town of Concepción. She runs a store from her house selling groceries, fruit, and vegetables and has had the store for two years. Ester generally buys the merchandise from nearby wholesale supermarkets and distributors where the prices are lower. Her family helps her transport the goods. With the loan Ester plans to buy more merchandise for her store.

Her goal is to own a store in a permanent location from which to sell groceries, fruit, and vegetables. Her dream is to rebuild her house as the February 27, 2010 earthquake caused much damage, and repairs are needed. 

Ester lives with her son who is currently in hospital due to a work accident so she has to visit him every day. As a result her business has suffered.

She is very happy and grateful for the loan provided by Kiva partner Fondo Esperanza since it has enabled her to invest in her business and generate more income. The meetings in which she participates are very enjoyable.

The town of Concepción is located at the mouth of the River Bíobío, one of the biggest rivers in the country, in Bíobio region in southern Chile. The city played an important role in Chilean history, being the home of important battles and a major settlement, particularly during the Arauco War. Concepción lies on the border next to the Mapuche territory. The city is currently undergoing significant economic and demographic development. It is considered to be one of the major urban, demographic, administrative, financial, and commercial centers in Chile, just behind Santiago and Valparaiso.

loans.use: to buy groceries, fruit, and vegetables

loans.name: Victory Group

texts.en:
Hellen M., 35, is the leader of Victory Group, which has applied for a loan from Kiva partner MicroKing. Hellen will be buying winter clothing for her flea market. She is a single mother of 2 children; her oldest is attending school, and her youngest is two years old. 

She specifically intends to buy winter wear for kids (track suits, jackets and jerseys). She has been operating the flea market business which is her sole source of income for the past two and a half years. She intends to own and operate a boutique in the future. In the interim she sees the loan proceeds improving her family's income and lifestyle.    

Hellen can only sing praises for MicroKing and Kiva and hopes for continued support. 

Note: In the photo, the lady seated is Hellen.

loans.use: To purchase winter clothing for stocking her flea market

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es: L. Sra. Yolanda es una persona que  actualmente vive soL., L. visitan sus hijos los fines D. semana, actualmente  su esposo trabaja en estados unidos y  le envía dinero  por semana para sus gastos solo que este  dinero  no le es suficiente para hacerle algunos arreglos a su casa ya  que  actualmente L. pintura D. su hogar esta ya algo deteriorada  y  necesita pintura   del  interior  y exterior D.  su vivienda, L. Sra. Yolanda esta  muy   agradecida  por  el apoyo  brindado para poder  hacer  realidad   su proyecto.
texts.en: Yolanda currently lives on her own.  Her children visit her on weekends.  Yolanda's husband is currently working in the United States and sends her money every week to cover her expenses.  However, this money isn't enough to make some repairs to her home.  The paintwork is somewhat worn and she needs to re-paint both insiD. and outsiD..  Yolanda is very grateful for the support she has been offered which will enable her to carry out her project.

loans.use: to paint the inside and outside of her home

loans.name: Ovidio

texts.es: El Sr. Ovidio es un comerciante muy activo y trabaja mucho para darle gusto a sus clientes, el se dedica  a la venta  de  chicharrones en su domicilio y los vende por toda la ciudad,  es muy conocido con muchísimas personas que ya son sus clientes desde hace algunos años y en esta temporada va a invertir en  mercancía para ofrecer el servicio  a su publico  que lo sigue por el rico sabor y sazón del producto, debido a esto desea el crédito para poder surtir suficiente y  abastecer al publico  ya  que  gracias a  este  ingreso  el  puede  sacar adelante  a su  familia.
texts.en: Ovidio is a very active salesman and he works hard in order to please his customers.  His business is selling chicharrones (pork crackling).  He sells from his home and all over the city.  He is very well known by a lot of people who have been his customers for years.  This season, he will invest in supplies so that he can continue to offer a service to his customers who buy from him because of the rich taste and flavor of his product.  He would like a loan so that he can stock up with enough supplies to serve his customers since this income enables him to get his family ahead in life.

loans.use: to buy supplies for making chicharrones (pork crackling)

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.es: El Sr. Benjamin y su esposa tienen una tienda de abarrotes y hasta el momento les ha ido muy bien en el negocio, pero como iniciaron con un capital muy pequeño, los clientes les están solicitando productos que aun no tiene, ellos están  ubicados en una colonia retirada de los centros comerciales de  la ciudad  por  lo que el gasto  que  ellos   realizan para  surtir   la mercancía  es  mas  elevado, es por  este  motivo  que el Sr. Benjamin y  su esposa   recurrieron con nosotros para  poder  realizar  la  compra  de  mercancía  y de esta  manera   ofrecer   a sus  clientes  una  mayor  variedad de  productos.
texts.en: Benjamin and his wife own a grocery store and, up to now, their business has done very well.  However, as they started out with very little capital, their customers are asking them for products that they still don't have in stock.  They are located in a residential development which is quite far from the shopping centers of the city which means that the amount it costs them to stock up with merchandise is higher.  For this reason, Benjamin and his wife came to us so that they could buy merchandise and offer their customers a wider variety of products.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for his grocery store

loans.name: Maria Trinidad

texts.es: La Sra. María  es una persona muy seria y trabajadora ella esta casada con el Sr. Jesús y junto a  sus  tres  hijos  forman una  familia, actualmente  tienen  un negocio de  comida  que  es de donde  obtienen  sus  ingresos y  en esta  ocasión solicitan   de  nuestro  apoyo  para  realizar la compra  de mercancía y  así  continuar  ofreciendo  a  sus  pequeños  una excelente  calidad  de   vida.
texts.en: María is a very serious and hard-working person.  She is married to Jesús and they have three children.  They currently have a food business which is where they make their income.  On this occasion, they are requesting our support in buying merchandise so that they can continue offering their little ones an excellent quality of life.

loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay to repair her vehicle

loans.name: Marina Lizzeth

texts.es: La Sra. Marina requiere  de  nuestro  apoyo para  realizar   su proyecto  ya  que ella decea invertir en  la  compra de mercancía para la apertura de una tienda de abarrotes ya que   con  esfuezo y recursos propios adquirio el mobiliario, pero  le  hace   falta  el  capital para   realizar   la compra  de los  productos  que   venderá, agradece  el   apoyo  que  a  recibido  de  nuestra parte  para  hacer de  su   sueño una realidad.
texts.en: Marina needs our support to carry out her project.  She would like to invest in buying merchandise to open a grocery store.  With effort and her own resources, she acquired the furnishings for her store but she doesn't have enough capital to buy the products that she will sell.  She is grateful for the support that she has received from us which will enable her to make her dream a reality.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her grocery store

loans.name: Lilia

texts.es:
La señora Lilia J. C. tiene  49 años de edad y vive en una casa en alquiler vivienda que esta ubicada en el barrio San Jose de la ciudad de Tarija. Lilia es madre soltera de dos hijos, por circunstancias de la vida se quedo sola ahora ella tiene que trabajar para poder sacar adelante a sus hijos. Lilia se dedica desde hace mas de 25 años a trabajar como costurera muy conocida por sus clientes que solicitan sus servicios,  Lilia quiere tener mejores ingresos para salir adelante junto con sus hijos , pero ella nos cuenta que tiene la necesidad de comprar material de trabajo como ser telas, forros, entretelas, etc. Ya que tiene un pedido de varias prendas de vestir de esa forma poder  realizar los trabajos que tiene por hacer, para un grupo de estudiantes. Como ella ya tiene experiencia en el rubro el credito sera destindo para la compra de dicho material que es necesario para realizar su actividad para de ese modo poder incrementar sus ingresos económicos.         
                                                                                                                                                                                               Lilia nos cuenta que quiere mejorar las condiciones de vida que tiene, por eso nos dice que el proximo credito que solicite sera para la compra una maquina de costura.
texts.en:
Lilia J. C. is 49 years old and lives in a rental house which is located in San José neighborhood, in the city of Tarija.  She is a single mother and has two children.  Through life circumstances, Lilia was left alone and now she has to work in order to get her children ahead.

Lilia has been working as a seamstress for 25 years.  She is very well known by her customers who request her services.  Lilia would like to make better profits so that she and her children can get ahead in life.  However, she tells us that she needs to buy materials for her work such as fabric, linings, interlining, etc. She has a pending order for several items of clothing.  With this purchase, she will be able to carry out the work that she has, which is for a group of students.  As Lilia has experience in this line of work, her loan will be used to buy these materials which are necessary for her to carry out her work.  In this way, she will be able to increase her income.

Lilia tells us that she would like to improve her living conditions.  She says that her next loan will be used to buy a sewing machine.

loans.use: to buy material for her work

loans.name: Caleb

texts.en:
In 2007, Caleb was working as a subcontractor in charge of 8 to 12-man construction crews working on a wide range of residential projects. When the real estate bubble burst, he like many in the construction industry went from having more work than he could handle to no work at all and his license as a contractor went inactive. 
 
Now, Caleb is ready to start working on big projects again, but this time as his own boss. “When I was working for general contractors, they weren’t even around most of the time. They’d leave me in charge of the crew and occasionally check in on the progress, but I was doing the work.” 
 
Caleb has never taken on debt, which, until recently, seemed like a good thing. However, because he avoided things like credit cards in the past, Caleb hasn’t built up a credit history. Not only does this make it difficult to secure a bank loan, but also a contractor’s license. 
 
“Before the recession, [to secure a license] they’d look at your performance and if there were any negative marks on your record. Now they look at your credit score, and if you don’t have a credit history that license gets a lot more expensive,” explained Caleb. 
 
When Caleb asked his bank for a small business loan to help him cover the costs of the license and insurance, which would allow him to take on a crew and larger jobs, they weren’t interested in providing the small amount he needed. Instead, the bank referred him to his local microlender, Opportunity Fund, where he was approved for a $3,500 microloan. 
 
With the loan, Caleb successfully secured his license, bond, and liability insurance. These three key elements will now help him grow his business. When asked if he had any favorite project to work on, he listed everything from elaborate door systems in Maui to decks in Marin County to old Victorian-style homes in San Francisco. “I love being able to see the improvement; to look at what I’ve done compared to what was there before. I like all the jobs I do, now that I think about it.”

loans.use: to renew his contractor license, purchase insurance, & establish credit

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a refrigerator.

loans.name: Martin

texts.es: El Sr. Martín  en esta ocasión  requiere  de  nuestro  apoyo debido  a que  su esposa  necesita  una placa  dental pero  por el momento  ella  no  tiene los   ingresos  suficientes  para   cubrir  estos  gastos, agradece   el  apoyo que a  recibido  ya  que   su   familia  y  su esposa  representan lo  mas  importante  en  su  vida y  siempre  se a  preocupado  por sacarlos adelante y  brindarles  una  excelente calidad  de  vida.
texts.en: Martín currently needs our help because his wife needs dentures, but at the moment they don't have enough income to cover the expenses. Martin appreciates the support he is receiving because his wife and family are the most important things in his life, and he is always working to help then get ahead and give them an excellent quality of life.

loans.use: to pay for dentures for his wife.

loans.name: Santa Ana Group

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Asunción se conformó un grupo llamado "Santa Ana", en honor a dicha santa por los favores y cuidados recibidos por ella.
Las integrantes de este comité  se dedican a variadas actividades entre las que se puede destacar  la venta de ropas, minutas, de empanadas, tortillas, croquetas, asaditos de carne, y  otras actividades.
Este grupo se encuentra en su 9vo ciclo en donde se puede destacar el sentido de resposabilidad y los deseos de progresar que tienen de cada una de las integrantes en la asistencia a las capacitaciones.
La sra. Viviana se dedica a la venta de bebidas, ella posee un depósito de refrescos, cervezas, sidras, vinos, gaseosas y otras bebidas en el local mismo de su casa, desde hace mucho tiempo, es un negocio que fue prosperando rapidamente gracias a la buena atencion que ofrece a sus clientes y a la buena calidad de us productos.
Se ha convertido en el medio por el cual obtiene los ingresos económicos para su canasta familiar, para poder prosperar y vivir dignamente.
Ella solicita el crédito para poder comprar más bebidas para su depósito, pues de esta manera tendría más oportunidades de complacer los gustos de su clientela y ganar más beneficios.
Todas las mujeres del comité esperan contar con el apoyo de Kiva.
texts.en:
In the city of Asunción, a group was created which was named "Santa Ana" in honor of the saint from whom the group's members have received favors and care.

The members of this committee work in different business activities which include selling clothes, snacks, empanadas, tortillas, croquettes, roast meat, and other activities.

This group is entering its 9th loan cycle.  Their sense of responsibility and their desire to make progress are clear.  They all attend their training sessions.

Viviana sells drinks.  She has a store in her home where she sells soft drinks, beer, cider, wine, soda and other drinks.  She has been in this business for a long time.  Her business has quickly prospered thanks to the good customer service that she offers and the good quality of her products.

Viviana's business has become the source of income with which she covers her family's basic daily needs.  Through it, she has been able to prosper and live a decent life.

Viviana is requesting this loan to buy more drinks for her store since this will give her more opportunities to please the tastes of her customers and gain more benefits.

All the women in the committee hope to be able to count on Kiva's support.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, soda, cider, wine, beer, etc.

loans.name: Miriam Victoria

texts.es:
La Señora. Miriam Arizaga es socia del banco comunal La Paz, vive por el barrio Las Peñas en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es de clima frió, fue nombrada en 1999 patrimonio cultural de la humanidad, su gente es muy calida  y con un gran carisma.

Doña Miriam tiene 35 años, es casada y tiene 2 hijos de 13 y 7 años de edad, su primer hijo estudia en el colegio y su segunda hija esta en una escuelita de la ciudad.  Su esposo es de profesión chofer y labora conduciendo un vehiculo de una fabrica, con el trabajo conyugal han logrado construir su casa propia.

La Señora. Miriam es consultora y se dedica a la venta de productos Yanbal, Avon y ropa por catalogo, actividad que  la desempeña hace 6 años, no tiene un horario fijo y trabaja   de domingo a domingo.
 
Es socia del banco comunal hace 9 años y su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de cosméticos y ropa.

Su sueño es que sus hijos lleguen a ser profesionales.
texts.en:
Miriam Arizaga is a member of La Paz community bank.  She lives in Las Peñas neighborhood, in the city of Cuenca.  This is a cold-climate city which was named a World Heritage Site in 1999.  The locals are very warm and have a lot of charisma.

Miriam is 35 years old, married, and has two children aged 13 and 7.  Her eldest (a boy) is in high school and her youngest (a girl) is in a local elementary school.  Her husband is a driver and drives a factory vehicle.  Through their joint work, they have managed to build their own home.

Miriam is a beauty consultant and she sells Yanbal products, Avon products and clothes through catalogs.  She has been in this line of work for six years.  She works from Sunday to Sunday but does not work regular hours.

Miriam has been a member of her community bank for nine years and she will invest her new loan in buying cosmetics and clothes.  Her dream is for her children to become professionals.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and clothes

loans.name: Rosa Balbina

texts.es:
La Señora. Rosa Balbina es socia del banco comunal La Paz, vive por el sector del Vecino en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es de clima frió, fue nombrada en 1999 patrimonio cultural de la humanidad, su gente es muy calida  y con un gran carisma.

Doña Rosa tiene 30 años, es madre soltera de 3 hijos de 15, 10 y 7 años de edad, su primera hija estudia en una academia y sus dos últimos hijos en una escuela de la ciudad. No tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.

La Señora. Rosa  se dedica a la venta de granos y frutas en un mercado de la ciudad, esta actividad la realiza hace 20 años, no tiene un puesto propio por lo que vende recorriendo desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 5 de la tarde y de domingo a domingo.

Se encuentra en el segundo crédito que realiza en el banco comunal al cual fue invitada por una vecina. Su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de frutas para tener una mayor variedad.

Su sueño es tener  casa propia.
texts.en:
Rosa Balbina is a member of La Paz community bank.  She lives in El Vecino sector, in the city of Cuenca.  This is a cold-climate city which was named a World Heritage Site in 1999.  The locals are very warm and have a lot of charisma.

Rosa is 30 years old.  She is a single mother and has three children aged 15, 10 and 7.  Her eldest (a girl) is studying in an academy and her two younger children attend a local elementary school.  They do not own their own home but live in a rental house.

Rosa sells grains and fruit in a market in the city.  She has been in this business for 20 years.  She doesn't own a sales location and so makes her sales as an itinerant street vendor, from 6.00am to 5.00pm, from Sunday to Sunday.

Rosa is in her second loan cycle with her community bank.  She was invited to join by a neighbor.  She will invest this new loan in buying fruit so that she has a wider range to sell.

Rosa's dream is to own her own home.

loans.use: to buy fruit

loans.name: Fabiola Alexandra

texts.es:
La Señora Fabiola T. es socia del banco comunal La Paz vive por el cantón Girón, el mismo que es reconocido por sus Valles, sus lugares turísticos, su gente se dedica al comercio, cría de animales y agricultura, son personas muy amables y de un gran carisma.

La Señora. Fabiola tiene 34 años y vive en unión libre, tiene 2 hijos de 18 y 13 años de edad, su primer hijo trabaja  solo para sus gastos personales, su segunda hija estudia en el colegio. Su esposo labora en un taller propio en donde confecciona ropa deportiva, no tiene casa propia por lo que viven arrendando. 

Doña Fabiola es oriunda de la provincia de los Ríos, ha llegado a la ciudad hace 6 años. Ella trabaja en una pollería, esta actividad  la realiza hace 2 años, labora de domingo a domingo  desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 7 de la noche.
 
Se encuentra en el tercer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y lo va a invertir en la compra de ropa como: blusas, camisetas,pantalones, etc. para iniciar con este negocio.
 
Su meta es  terminar su casa que está construyendo en Babahoyo.
texts.en:
Fabiola T. is a member of the “La Paz” (Peace) Communal Bank.  She lives in the Girón canton.  This canton is known for its valleys, its tourist locations, its people who are devoted to commerce, raising animals, and farming.  They are very kind people with a great deal of charisma.

Fabiola, age 34, is in a common-law-marriage.  She has two children, ages 18 and 13.  Her first child works for his personal expenses.  Her second child attends school.  Her husband works in his own shop where he makes sportswear.  She does not have her own house; they rent where they live.

Fabiola is from the Ríos province, and she came to the city six years ago.  She has been working in a poultry store for two years.  She works from Sunday to Sunday from seven in the morning until seven at night.

This is her third loan in the communal bank.  She will use it to buy clothes like blouses, t-shirts, and pants, etc. in order to start  this business.

Her goal is to finish her house, which she is building in Babahoyo.

loans.use: to buy blouses, t-shirts, and pants, etc.

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora Group

texts.es:
El comité Maria Auxiliadora nace mediante la gestión y el apoyo de otro comité que se encontraba trabajando en la ciudad de San Lorenzo.
Este comité se fijó como objetivo principal el crecimiento de cada una de sus integrantes, todas las miembros son reconocidas en el lugar como mujeres muy trabajadoras.
La Sra. Maria Magdalena R., es presidenta del grupo y tiene 47 años, ella está domiciliada en la ciudad de Laurelty, es una mujer emprendedora, trabajadora y por sobretodo muy optimista.
