Ella se dedica a la quiniela, es un juego de azar muy común en Paraguay, en el cual los números son diversión y combinación para los sorteos que se realizan y trasmiten por televisión y radio, incluso los resultados son publicados cada día por periódicos e internet.
La sra. Maria Magdalena desea obtener el crédito para poder tener su puesto de trabajo con un poco más de comodidad y poder comprar mayores espacios para este juego de azar, de modo a obtener mayor participación de parte de las personas y ganar ella algunos ingresos para mantener a su familia.
texts.en:
The Maria Auxiliadora Communal Bank was born through the effort and support of another communal bank, which is working in the city of San Lorenzo.

This communal bank set their main objective to be the growth of each one of its members.  All of the members are known in the area as very hard-working women.

Maria Magdalena R., age 47, is the president of the group.  She lives in the city of Laurelty. She is an enterprising, hard-working, and above all, a very optimistic woman.  She devotes herself to “quiniela”, a very common game of chance (lottery) in Paraguay.  In the game the numbers are a diversion, and the combinations for the lotteries are transmitted on television and on the radio.  The results are also published every day in newspapers and on the internet.

Maria Magdalena wants to get a loan to be able to make the stand where she works a bit more comfortable.  She wants to be able to buy more space for this game of chance.  That way she can get more people to participate, and she will get greater income to support her family.

loans.use: to invest in her business stand

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria came to Grameen America two years ago looking for an opportunity. She loved to cook and was always being praised for her talent in the kitchen, but had no way of transforming that gift into professional success. Now, Maria runs her own business selling ice cream and other desserts out of her food truck. She used her first three Grameen America loans to get her business off the ground and acquire the necessary licensing and permit stickers. Now, she is seeking a fourth loan of 3,000 USD to stock up on ice cream and other ingredients and to renew her permit sticker so she can continue growing her business doing what she loves. Maria hopes to one day buy a food cart big enough for her to cook and serve a wide array of her favorite foods, from ice cream to tamales. Maria works incredibly hard in pursuit of her goals and has already created her own business from scratch. Now, with just a 3,000 USD loan, she will have the opportunity to continue building the future she has always dreamed of.

loans.use: to pay for ingredients and a permit sticker for her food truck

loans.name: Kuña Porä Group

texts.es:
El Comité se encuentra en el 4to. ciclo del programa “Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras”, cuenta con 15 integrantes, todas del barrio Las Garzas de la ciudad de San Antonio - Villa Elisa; el grupo demuestra excelente moral de pago, disponen de un buen ahorro y también realizan actividades varias para su caja chica.
Son unidas y respetuosas entre sí, todas las decisiones las toman en forma democrática, utilizando el sistema de la votación para cualquier decisión a tomar.
La presidenta, Claudelina B., se destaca por su capacidad de liderazgo, alienta a sus compañeras a seguir esforzándose para salir adelante, valoran bastante la oportunidad que la Fundación les sigue brindando y todas tienen sus respectivos microemprendimientos.
Ella se dedica a la venta de ropas y gracias a anteriores créditos otorgados a este comité por Kiva fue incrementando su negocio, hoy día solicita un nuevo préstamo para poder comprar abrigos, pantalones, remeras, buzos y otras prendas de invierno, de modo a seguir obteniendo buenos resultados en sus ventas.
texts.en:
The group is in its fourth cycle with the Committee of Women Entrepreneurs Program.  There are 15 members, and they are all from the Las Garzas neighborhood in the city of San Antonio – Villa Elisa.

The group demonstrates excellent morals about their payments.  They make use of good savings, and they also engage in various activities for their petty cash.  They are united and respectful of each other.  They make all of their decisions in a democratic way, using the voting system for whatever decision they make.

Claudelina B., the president, stands out for her leadership ability.  She encourages her colleagues to continue putting forth great effort in order to get ahead.  They really value the opportunity that the Fundación continues to give them, and they all have their own small businesses.

She sells clothes, and thanks to previous Kiva loans to this communal bank, she has been expanding her business.  Now she is requesting a new loan to be able to buy coats, pants, t-shirts, sweatshirts, and other winter garments.  That way she will continue getting good results from her sales.

loans.use: to buy coats, pants, t-shirts, sweatshirts, etc.

loans.name: Hector Ernesto

texts.es: El Sr. Héctor  es una persona muy respetuosa y honesta, el esta separado de su esposa actualmente, el único ingreso que  obtiene  es  gracias  a   la venta de hot-dogs  ya  que  el tiene ocho  años con su negocio , el desea en un futuro tener otro carrito de hot-dogs  para  poder incrementar  el  volumen  de sus  ventas y además   ofrecer  mayor  satisfacción a  un gran  numero  de  clientes.
texts.en: Héctor is a very respectful and honest person. He and his wife are currently separated. The only income he has comes from his work selling hotdogs. He has been in this business for eight years. In the future he would like to have second hotdog cart to be able to increase his sales volume and also be able to satisfy the demand of a larger number of customers.

loans.use: to purchase a cart for the sale of hotdogs.

loans.name: Rosa Paulina

texts.es:
La Señora. Rosa M. es socia del banco comunal El Aguacate, vive en la comunidad que lleva el mismo nombre del banco comunal en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es conocida como Santa Ana de los 4 ríos, por su belleza colonial que fue nombrada en 1999  patrimonio cultural de la humanidad, su gente es muy calida y amable.

La Señora Rosa tiene 29 años, es casada y tiene 4 hijos de 14, 11, 6 y 3 años de edad, su primera hija estudia en el colegio y su segundo y tercer hijo en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo labora en el área de la construcción como albañil, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.
 
Doña Rosa labora hace un mes limpiando casas pero antes tenía una picantería (restaurante) que la tuvo que cerrar ya que estaba en un sitio prohibido, ahora ella va a reiniciar con este negocio en un nuevo local.
  
Se encuentra en el tercer crédito que realiza en el  banco comunal y lo va a invertir en la instalación de su nueva picantería (restaurante).

Su meta es  retomar su negocio y hacerlo crecer y  tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Rosa M. is a member of the Aguacate ("Avocado") Communal Bank.  She lives in the community that bears the same name as the community bank in the city of Cuenca, a city also known as "Santa Ana of the Four Rivers."  Due to its beauty and colonial architecture, it was recognized as a cultural heritage site in 1999.  Its people are very warm and friendly.

Rosa is 29 years old and married with four children, who are ages 14, 11, 6 and 3.  Her oldest daughter is a high school student and the second and third are students in a little school in the city.  Her husband works in construction as a mason.  They do not own their own home and instead are renters.

Rosa worked cleaning houses for a month but prior to this had a cookhouse (restaurant) that had to close because it was located on a banned site.  Now she will reopen this business in a new location.

This is her third loan cycle with the communal bank and the proceeds will be invested in establishing the new restaurant.  

Her goal is to reestablish and grow the business so as to one day own her own home.

loans.use: to establish a new restaurant.

loans.name: Ana María

texts.es:
La Señorita Ana T. es socia del banco comunal El Aguacate, vive por el sector de Monay en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es conocida como  Santa Ana de los 4 ríos, por su belleza colonial que fue nombrada en 1999  patrimonio cultural de la humanidad, su gente es muy cálida y amable.

La Señorita Ana tiene 28 años, es soltera y vive con sus padres, la casa en la que habitan es arrendada ya que su casa está en construcción.

Nuestra socia trabaja en una joyería hace 7 años, labora de lunes a viernes de 8 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde.

Es el primer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal al cual fue invitada por su cuñada. El dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en materiales de construcción para su casa.
 
Su meta es  iniciar  sus estudios universitarios.
texts.en:
Ana T. is a member of El Aguacate community bank.  She lives in Monay sector, in the city of Cuenca.  This city is known as Santa Ana de los Cuatro Ríos (Saint Anne of the Four Rivers).  Owing to its colonial beauty, it was named a World Heritage Site in 1999.  Its people are very warm and kind.

Ana is 28 years old, single, and lives with her parents.  They live in a rental house as their home is currently being built.

Ana has been working in a jeweler's for seven years.  She works from Monday to Friday, from 8.00am to 6.00pm.

This is Ana's first loan as a member of her community bank which she was invited to join by her sister-in-law.  She will invest her loan in buying building supplies for her house.

Ana's goal is to start a university course.

loans.use: to buy building supplies

loans.name: Mujeres Trabajadoras Group

texts.es:
Este comité se formó gracias a la señora Olga R., ella es una señora muy amable y activa, vive en su propia casita, es soltera pero siempre supo salir adelante a pesar de todo.
Ella es modista y solicitó el crédito para poder agrandar su negocio ya que eso le ayudaría bastante, comprando telas, lienzos, tijeras, y todos aquellos materiales de trabajo que le hacen falta.
Este comité es un grupo antiguo que a pesar de tener pequeños problemas supieron salir siempre adelante. La señora Olga al empezar el grupo fue una integrante más sin destacarse, pero luego la eligieron como la presidenta del grupo y supo llevar muy bien al grupo por el camino de la perseverancia y prosperidad, se enteró por medio de otros grupos acerca de Kiva y le interesó bastante comunicandose con la fundación, ella recorrió casa por casa en su barrio para conformar el grupo. 
Este es un grupo muy unido, juntas decidieron realizar actividades cada mes para obtener su caja chica, todas ellas tienen su micro-empresa.
Ellas son del Barrio Villa Bonita  de la Ciudad de Villa Elisa, sus metas son sacar siempre adelante al grupo, a sus micro-empresas y también a sus familias.
texts.en:
This committee was founded thanks to Olga R..  Olga is a very kind and active woman who lives in her own small home.  She is single but has always known how to get ahead in spite of everything.

Olga is a dressmaker and she requested this loan so that she could expand her business since it would help her a lot.  She will buy fabrics, linen, scissors and other work materials that she needs.

This committee is a long-standing group which, in spite of the small problems that they have had, have always known how to get ahead.  When Olga started the group, she was just another member and didn't stand out at all.  However, she was elected president of the group and has led the group very well along the road of perseverance and prosperity.  She found out about Kiva through other groups and was interested.  She spoke with Fundación Paraguaya and went house to house in her neighborhood to form a group.

This is a very united group.  Together they decided to carry out activities each month in order to add to their petty cash.  Each member owns her own small business.

The women live in Villa Bonita neighborhood, in the city of Villa Elisa.  Their goals are to always work in order to get ahead with their group, their small businesses and also their families.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, linen, scissors and other dressmaking supplies

loans.name: Diana Maritza

texts.es:
La Señora. Diana G. es socia del banco comunal El Aguacate, vive en la comunidad que lleva el mismo nombre del banco comunal en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es conocida como Santa Ana de los 4 ríos, por su belleza colonia que fue nombrada en 1999  patrimonio cultural de la humanidad, su gente es muy cálida y amable.

Doña Diana tiene 24 años, es casada y tiene un hijo de 7 años de edad que estudia en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo labora en una fábrica de bloques y almacenamiento de madera, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven en una casa prestada.

La Señora. Diana se dedica a los quehaceres de su hogar y a la venta de ropa, ella les vende  a sus vecinos y personas conocidas.

Se encuentra en el tercer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y  lo va a invertir en la compra de mercadería como: ropa de niños, pantalones, camisetas, blusas, etc. para surtir su negocio.

Su meta es sacar adelante a su hijo para que tenga un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Diana G. is a member of El Aguacate community bank.  She lives in the community of El Aguacate, in the city of Cuenca.  This city is also known as Santa Ana de los Cuatro Ríos (Saint Anne of the Four Rivers).  It was named a World Heritage Site in 1999 because of its colonial beauty.  Its people are very warm and kind.

Diana is 24 years old, married, and has one 7 year-old son who attends a local elementary school.  Her husband works in a brick factory / wood warehouse.  They don't own their own home but live in a borrowed house.

Diana does her housework and also sells clothes.  She sells to her neighbors and acquaintances.

This is the third loan that Diana has accessed through her community bank.  She will invest it in buying merchandise such as children's clothes, pants, t-shirts, blouses, etc. to stock her business.

Diana's goal is to get her son ahead in life so that he can enjoy a better future.

loans.use: to buy children's clothes, blouses, pants, t-shirts, etc.

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Group

texts.es:
La formación del comité la inició la señora Catalina L. quien está domiciliada en el km 12 Monday de Ciudad del Este. Ella contactó con la Fundación Paraguaya para que se forme el comité entre sus amigas y vecinas del barrio.
El comité se denomina “Kuña Guapa”. Las señoras tienen su propios ingresos; algunas poseen despensa, Venta de leche, venta de comestible, costurera y otras trabajan como empleada doméstica. Están en el Tercer Ciclo y está constituido por 11 integrantes; el grupo se destaca en el barrio por ser muy responsable y solidario. Las integrantes poseen un gran espíritu emprendedor, trabajarán en conjunto en  la realización de actividades para recaudar fondos que puedan salvaguardar al comité en caso de necesidad.
La sra. Catalina se dedica a vender comestibles en su despensa, es un negocio que le genera buenos ingresos económicos para poder mantener a su familia; es una característica de todas estas mujeres la necesidad de generar buenas ganancias pues son personas muy humildes que desean prosperar y aumentar el nivel de vida que poseen.
Ella solicita el crédito para poder comprar más productos de primera necesidad, como lo son las frutas y verduras.
texts.en:
Catalina Lopez, who lives at kilometer 12 Monday in the Ciudad del Este, founded this communal bank.  She contacted the Fundación Paraguaya in order to form the group with her friends and neighbors in the neighborhood.

The communal bank is called “Kuña Guapa”.  The women have their own earnings.  Some have grocery stores, sell milk, sell food, or sew; and others work as domestic employees.  They are in their third cycle, and the group is comprised of 11 members.

The group stands out in the neighborhood for being very responsible and supportive.  The members have a great entrepreneurial spirit.  They will work together in carrying out their business activities in order to collect funds.  These funds will be able to safeguard the communal bank in case they need it.

Catalina sells food in her grocery store.  It is a business that generates good income in order to be able to support her family.    The need to generate good income is characteristic of all of the women.  They are very humble people who wish to prosper and raise their standard of living.

She is requesting a loan to be able to buy more basic needs products like fruits and vegetables.

loans.use: to buy more basic needs products like fruits and vegetables and general groceries

loans.name: Cuencanitas (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Cuencanitas está formado por 8 mujeres muy carismáticas, alegres,  luchadoras y emprendedoras. Laboran en diferentes actividades sin descuidar a sus familias, sus trabajos les han permitido ayudar en la economía de sus hogares y se sientes muy orgullosas por ello. Viven en diferentes lugares de la ciudad de Cuenca,  esta ciudad un clima frió y esta bañada por 4 ríos, tiene un hermoso centro histórico, su gente mantiene su cultura y tradiciones. 

La Señora. Mónica A. vive en por el sector de Chilcapamba en la ciudad de Cuenca. Tiene 27 años, es casada y tiene 3 hijos de 9, 6 y 2 años de edad, sus dos primeros hijos  estudian en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo labora en el área de la construcción ya que es albañil, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.
 
Doña Mónica ha iniciado su negocio hace 2 meses, ella vende ropa especialmente pantalones. También se dedica a la venta de cosméticos de la marca de Yanbal, sus productos los vende recorriendo la ciudad, a sus familiares y conocidos.
 
Este es el primer crédito que realiza en la banca comunal y  lo va a invertir en la compra de ropa y cosméticos.
 
Su sueño es  tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
The Cuencanitas community bank is made up of eight very charismatic, cheerful, hard-working and enterprising women.  They each work in their respective businesses without neglecting their families.  Their jobs have enabled them to help their households financially and they feel very proud of this fact.  The women live in different parts of the city of Cuenca.  Cuenca is a cold-climate city.  It is surrounded by four rivers and has a beautiful historic center.  Its people maintain their culture and traditions.

Mónica A. lives in Chilcapamba sector, in the city of Cuenca.  She is 27 years old, married, and has three children aged 9, 6 and 2.  Her two eldest children attend a local elementary school.  Her husband is a construction worker.  They don't own their own home but live in a rental house.

Mónica started her business two months ago.  She sells clothes, especially pants.  She also sells Yanbal-brand cosmetics.  She sells her products throughout the city, to her family members and acquaintances.

This is the first loan Mónica has accessed through her community bank.  She will invest it in buying clothes and cosmetics.

Mónica's dream is to own her own home.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and clothes

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora Group

texts.es:
El comité “Maria Auxiliadora” se formó con la unión de varias vecinas de un asentamiento muy humilde de  la ciudad de Mariano Roque Alonso.
Las integrantes son personas humildes que formaron un grupo para salir de la pobreza extrema que aqueja a gran parte del país. Se compremetieron a luchar hombro con hombro para lograr los objetivos propuestos  y trabajar conjuntamente  con actividades que fortalecen su compañerismo.
La sra. Adolfina G. es un ejemplo de sacrificio, ella realiza servicios de manicura y pedicura, de manera ambulante, es decir, va a las casas de sus clientes, no posee un lugar fijo de trabajo por eso a veces le cuesta mucho, pues no puede cuidar todo el tiempo a su familia y atender su hogar, pero sabe que solo con sacrificios podría sacarlos adelante.
Ella solicita el crédito de Kiva para poder comprar todos los materiales necesarios para su trabajo de manicura y pedicura como esmaltes, alcoholes, lijas, tijeritas, alicates, etc.
texts.en:
The "Maria Auxiliadora" communal bank was created through the union of various neighbors from a humble settlement in the city of Mariano Roque Alonso. The members are all humble people who created the group to be able to get out of the extreme poverty that afflicts a large portion of the country. They have all committed to fight side-by-side to meet their goals and to work together on activities that strengthen their partnership.

Adolfina G. is a great example of personal sacrifice. She is a traveling vendor who goes to her clients' houses to provide manicure and pedicure services. She doesn't have a fixed work location and for this reason her work is difficult for her. She can't spend the time she needs to take care of her family and maintain her household, but she knows that these sacrifices can help her family get ahead.

Adolfina is asking for a loan through Kiva to be able to purchase the materials she needs for her manicures and pedicures, such as nail polish, rubbing alcohol, nail files, scissors, nail clippers, etc.

loans.use: to purchase manicure and pedicure materials.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, rice and sugar

loans.name: Diana Maribel

texts.es:
La Señora. Diana Álvarez es socia del banco comunal El Crédito, vive por el sector del Crea en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es de clima frió, cuenta con varios lugares turísticos para visitar, su gastronomía cautiva el paladar de propios y extraños, su gente mantiene la cultura y tradiciones

La Señora. Diana tiene 33 años, es casada y tiene 3 hijos de 12, 11 y 7 años de edad, sus tres hijos estudian en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo se encuentra en el extranjero, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendado.
 
Doña Diana se dedica al comercio, vende todo tipo de ropa, esta actividad la realiza hace 3 años, vende su mercadería en su casa de domingo a domingo y sin un horario fijo, la mayoría de su clientela son sus amigos y conocidos.

En la banca comunal se encuentra hace 6 años, su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra mercadería como: camisetas, blusas, pantalones, ropa de niños, etc. para ampliar mucho más su negocio.

Su meta es tener casa propia.
texts.en:
Diana Álvarez is a member of the communal bank El Crédito. She lives in the Crea section of the city of Cuenca. This city has a cold climate and has various tourist sites to visit. Its gastronomy attracts the palates of locals and foreigners. Its people maintain the culture and traditions. 

Diana is 33-years-old. She's married and has 3 children of 12, 11, and 7-years-old. Her three children study in a small school in the city. Her husband is currently out of the country. They don't have their own home and are renting.

Diana sells all types of clothes for a living. She's been doing this for 3 years. She sells her merchandise from her house 7 days a week and without a fixed schedule. The majority of her customers are friends and acquaintances.

She's been with the communal bank for 6 years. She will invest her loan in the purchase of merchandise such as: t-shirts, blouses, pants, children's clothes, etc. in order to expand her business. 

Her goal is to have her own home.

loans.use: buy t-shirts, blouses, pants, children's clothes, etc.

loans.name: Poaju Group

texts.es:
Este comité se formo en el Barrio Bernardino C. de la Ciudad de Caaguazú.
La señora Norma Elizabeth Z. participó de una reunión informativa en donde le encantó la idea de formar un comité en su zona, invitó a las señoras más responsables y con mucho entusiasmo se unieron en equipo en donde la responsabilidad es conjunta, solicitando así un apoyo crediticio a la Fundación Paraguaya. Las mismas son señoras que desean un progreso personal y familiar, luchan cada día para que esto sea posible.
La sra. Zunilda se dedica a la venta de joyas, ella compra joyas en Luque a menores costos y luego los vende por Caaguazú obteniendo una pequeña ganancia económica, es la manera en que ella puede mantener a sus hijos, es muy conocida por esta actividad en su zona y debido a la belleza y calidad de sus joyas aumenta la cantidad de clientes.
Ella solicita el crédito para poder aumentar la cantidad de joyas que ofrece de modo a aumentar sus ingresos ya que su meta es poseer su propia joyería alguna vez.
texts.en:
This committee was established in the neighborhood of Bernardino C. in the city of Caaguazú. Sra. Norma Elizabeth Z. participated in an informational meeting and liked the idea of forming a committee in her area. She invited responsible women who were excited about forming a group so that they could work together and apply for a solidarity loan from Fundación Paraguaya. These same ladies want to make progress on a personal level and with their families. They struggle each day to make this possible.

Sra. Zunilda sells jewelry. She buys her merchandise in Luque at low cost and then sells it in Caaguazú in order to earn a little bit of money so that she can support her children. Zunilda is well-known for her local business. Due to the beauty and quality of the jewelry she offers, she has been able to increase her customer base.

The loan she is requesting will be used to increase her inventory of jewelry that she offers so that she can earn more income. Her goal is to have her own jewelry store someday.

loans.use: to purchase gold and silver jewelry to sell.

loans.name: Martha Isabel

texts.es:
La Señora. Martha A. es socia del banco comunal El Crédito, vive por la parroquia de Baños, esta parroquia es muy visitada por las fuentes de aguas termales que le han permitido a los habitantes de la zona crear piscinas para la distracción de propios y extranjeros, tiene una gran variedad en su gastronomía, su gente es muy amable, cordial y mantienen la cultura y tradiciones.

Doña Martha tiene 27 años, es casada y ha concebido 2 hijos, uno de 3 años y un bebé de 3 meses.  Su esposo labora en un taller de latonería (arreglo de latas de los vehículos), con el trabajo conyugal han logrado construir su casa propia.
 
La Señora Martha es de profesión estilista, ha estudiado por 3 años en una academia y ahora tiene un salón de belleza, labora de lunes a sábados desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 8 de la noche. También es profesora de belleza y dicta clases 3 días a la semana.

Es socia del banco comunal hace 1 año y su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de productos como tintes de cabello, permanentes, esmaltes de uñas, etc. para su gabinete.
 
Su meta es tener un vehículo.
texts.en:
Mrs. Martha A. is a member of the El Crédito (Loan) Community Bank. This region is a popular tourist location because of its thermal pools that have allowed for the inhabitants to make private and public pools. It has a wide variety of foods, and the people are very kind, polite, and maintain their culture and traditions.

Mrs. Martha is 27 years old, married, and has two sons, a three year old and a 3 month old baby. Her husband works in a body shop fixing cars. Together, they have been able to work and build their own home.

Martha is a beautician. She studied for 3 years in an academy and now has a beauty salon. She works from Monday to Saturday from 8:00 am until 8:00 pm. She also teaches at beauty school three days a week. She has been a member of the community bank for one year and will use the loan to buy products such as hair dye, perms, nail polish, and more for her cabinet.

Her goal is to have a car.

loans.use: buy hair dye, perms, nail polish, etc.

loans.name: Santa Rita De Casia Group

texts.es:
Santa Rita de Casia se denomina el excelente grupo de mujeres conformado en la ciudad de Ita, gracias a que la actual presidenta, la Sra. Karina B., contactó con la asesora en una reunión semanal que la misma tenía en la zona, para informarse de la forma de trabajo que tiene el Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras, una vez asesorada acerca del programa logró juntar a 15 mujeres, quienes se encuentran trabajando muy a gusto en el 1° ciclo.
La sra. Karina se dedica a la venta de ropas, en especial de abrigos, por eso cuando se acerca el invierno sus clientes ya saben donde tienen que recurrir para comprar los mejores abrigos, originales en diseño y excelentes en calidad, por eso desea poder obtener este crédito de Kiva para comprar más abrigos y seguir ganando clientes, manteniendo su fama de buena vendedora en su ramo.
Ella es una mujer muy dedicada a su familia, y lo que más desea es poder sacar a sus familiares de la pobreza.
texts.en:
“Santa Rita de Casia” is the name of this fine group of women that was established in the city of Ita. Thanks to the current president, Sra. Karina B., they were able to get into contact with a loan officer during the weekly meeting that was held in the area. There they were informed about the work required for the Committee of Enterprising Women Program. Once they were informed about the program requirements, a group was established consisting of 15 women who are comfortable working with one another. They are participating in their first loan cycle.

Sra. Karina sells clothing, especially coats. When the winter season arrives, her customers know they can turn to her in order to buy the best coats that are original in design and of excellent quality. For this reason, Karina is obtaining a Kiva loan so that she can buy more coats to help her continue attracting customers. This will maintain her reputation as an excellent seller in her trade. Karina is a woman who is extremely dedicated to her family. What she desires most is for her family members to overcome poverty.

loans.use: to purchase coats to sell.

loans.name: Karen Andrea

texts.es:
La Señora Karen A. es socia del banco comunal El Crédito, vive por el sector de la Ciudadela Bella Vista en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es de clima frió, cuenta con varios lugares turísticos para visitar, su gastronomía cautiva el paladar de propios y extraños, su gente mantiene la cultura y tradiciones.

La Señora Karen tiene 21 años, es casada y tiene un bebé de 3 meses de edad. Su esposo es de profesión comerciante, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando. 

Nuestra socia tiene un local donde vende comida rápida, esta actividad la desempeña hace 7 meses, labora de lunes a viernes desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 10 de la noche.

Se encuentra en el segundo crédito que realiza en el banco comunal al cual fue  invitada  por su mamá. Su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de mesas para su local.
 
Su meta es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Karen A. is a member of El Crédito Communal Bank. She lives near the Ciudadela Bella Vista area of the city of Cuenca. The city has a cold climate and many tourist attractions to visit. The food captivates the palates of local and foreigners and its people maintain their culture and traditions.

Karen is 21 years old, married, and has a 3-month-old baby. Her husband is a merchant and they do not own their house, which is why they rent.

She has a business where she sells fast food. She has been in this business for seven months and works Monday through Friday from 8am to 10pm.

This is her second loan cycle with the communal bank, where she was invited by her mother. She will invest the loan in the purchase of tables for her business.

Her goal is to have her own house.

loans.use: to buy tables.

loans.name: Claudia Virginia

texts.es:
La señorita Claudia de 31 años de edad, es una joven emprendedora y madre soltera de una niña de 3 años. Alquila un local comercial en donde vende todo tipo de lencerías, bijuoteries, carteras y accesorios varios.
Ella se inició en este negocio gracias al apoyo económico de su padre que realiza trabajos de tapicería, empezó vendiendo a sus amigos, compañeros y vecinos de su barrio, luego se animó y alquiló un local comercial para la venta, actualmente cuenta con un próspero negocio.
Acude a la Fundación Paraguaya para acceder a una pequeña ayuda crediticia que destinaría a la compra de lencerías y carteras. La misma al retirarse agradeció la ayuda a la Fundación Paraguaya por el apoyo, esperando contar con la ayuda de Kiva.
texts.en:
Claudia, 31 years of age, is a young entrepreneurial single mother of a 3-year old daughter.  She rents a space locally where she sells all types of lingerie, costume jewelry, purses and various accessories.

She started this business thanks to financial support from her father, who was in tapestry making.  She started selling to friends, companions and local neighbors.  Later, she was encouraged, and rented her own locale for the business.  She currently has a prosperous enterprise.

She turns to the Fundación Paraguaya to access a small amount of loan assistance to buy lingerie and purses.  She thanks Fundación Paraguaya for their support, and hopes to count on Kiva’s help.

loans.use: buy lingerie and purses.

loans.name: Gladys Cristina

texts.es:
La señora Gladys Cristina tiene 22 años, es madre soltera y viven ella y su hija en la casa de sus padres en el Barrio Jardín de la ciudad de Encarnación.
Tiene un puesto de venta de termos y juguetes en la terminal de ómnibus de Encarnación, con más de 4 años de antigüedad en ese rubro ella se ha destacado laboralmente y ha logrado mantenerse estable y de igual manera a ha sabido cuidar moral y económicamente a su hijita.
Es una persona muy trabajadora y gracias a la actividad que realiza ha podido ir creciendo en su micro-empresa. El destino del crédito que solicita sería realizar compras de más juguetes para la venta.
texts.en:
Gladys Cristina is 22 years old and a single mother who, along with her daughter, lives in her parents’ home in the Jardín section of the city of Encarnación.

She has a post for sales of Thermoses and toys at the bus terminal of Encarnación.  With more than 4 years of experience in the trade, she has stood out work-wise and has managed to maintain stability.  Likewise, she has known how to care for her daughter emotionally and financially.

She is a very hardworking person and, thanks to her activities, has been able to grow her micro-enterprise.  The loan would be destined for buying more toys to offer for sale.

loans.use: buy toys to sell.

loans.name: Alicio Ramon

texts.es:
El señor Alicio A. vive con su esposa e hijas en la compañía Yeguarizo de la ciudad de Ybycui.
Nos cuenta que desde hace tiempo es electricista de autos y camiones, primero trabajaba en la ciudad de Carapeguá en el mismo rubro, ya luego se trasladó en su ciudad de residencia.
Esto se debió a que con el tiempo se hizo más fuerte la competencia en aquella zona, lo que generó una escasez de trabajo total en esa época, y tuvo que dejar esa ciudad e ir a probar suerte en la ciudad de Ybycui.
Agradece a Dios porque le fue de maravillas ya que ahora cuenta con una buena cartera de clientes, con eso puede sostener bien a su familia y hacer que sus hijas culminen sus estudios secundarios e iniciar los universitarios.
El préstamo solicitado será destinado para la compra de herramientas que serán utilizadas en su trabajo.
texts.en:
Alicio A. lives with his wife and daughters in the Yeguarizo section of the city of Ybycui.

He tells us that, for some time now, he has been a car and truck electrician.  At first, he worked in the city of Carapeguá in the same trade.  He later moved to this city, where he now resides.

The move took place because, over time, the competition in that zone grew, creating a shortage of work during that era.  He had to leave the area and go try his luck in the city of Ybycui.

He thanks God because everything turned out marvelously, and he now can count on a good client base.  This allows him to support his family well and his daughters to finish their secondary school studies and start at university.

The loan requested would be destined to buy tools that he would use for his work.

loans.use: buy tools for his work.

loans.name: Marina

texts.es:
La Sra. Marina tiene  45 años y es madre soltera  de un hijo pequeñito. Ella se dedica a la confección de prendas de vestir, exclusivamente uniformes para colegios, escuelas y empresas.
Trabajó desde muy pequeña con su madre, de quien aprendió el oficio, luego de mucho esfuerzo y dedicación logró montar un pequeño taller con cuatro máquinas de coser, y hoy día ya posee una buena clientela formada.
Es muy conocida por su zona pro la calidad de sus prendas y el precio accesible que otorga a cada confección que realiza, ahora ella necesita de este crédito para comprar telas en cantidad y de esta manera abaratar aún más el costo de sus prendas.
Marina en el futuro  desea  abrir un salón propio y exhibir las confecciones únicas que realiza.
texts.en:
Marina is 45 years old and the single mother of a young son.  She dedicates herself to making clothing, exclusively school and business uniforms.

She worked from a young age with her mother, from whom she learned the trade.  After much effort and dedication, she managed to open a small workshop with four sewing machines.  Today, she has a well-established customer base.

She is known throughout her area for the quality of her clothing and the reasonable price she charges for each of her creations.  She now needs this loan to buy fabric in bulk so she can lower the prices of her clothing even more.  Marina wants to open her own salon and showcase the unique clothes that she makes.

The loan requested would be destined for the purchase of the tools of her trade.

loans.use: buy fabrics, threads, glues, buttons, zippers, borders.

loans.name: Vidalia

texts.es:
Vidalia tiene 31 años. Ella posee un puesto de venta de ropas para damas, caballeros y niños en el Mercado Municipal de la ciudad de San Lorenzo, además de juegos de toallas, sábanas y manteles.
Ella trabaja en esta actividad desde el año 2006. Es madre soltera de dos hijos menores de edad.
Necesita de este crédito para adquirir prendas de la nueva temporada (Otoño). En sus inicios trabajó con su hermana, quien también se dedica a la misma actividad, pero gracias a sus esfuerzos pudo independizar su puesto.
En el futuro desea culminar la construcción de su vivienda, que la está mandando realizar de a poco acorde a sus posibilidades económicas; para que de esta forma le pueda brindar mayor seguridad a sus hijos, y más adelante también darles la posibilidad de que puedan estudiar y llegar inclusive a obtener sus títulos universitarios.
texts.en:
Vidalia is 31 years old.  She sells clothes for women, men and children at a stand she has in the Municipal Market of the city of San Lorenzo.  She also sells sets of towels, sheets and tablecloths.  She’s been doing this work since 2006.  She is a single mother of two minor children.

She needs this loan to buy clothes for the upcoming season (Fall).  In the beginning, she worked with her sister but, thanks to her efforts, she was able to carry her stand independently.

In the future, she would like to complete construction on her house.  She is working on little by little, as her financial situation allows.  This would enable her to provide better security for her children.  In the future, she would also like to give them the possibility of studying and even the ability to obtain college degrees.

loans.use: buy clothing for the upcoming Fall season.

loans.name: Adriana

texts.es:
La señora Adriana tiene 27 años, es madre soltera, viven ella y su hijo en una casa propia en el barrio Cerro Real de la ciudad de Caacupé, distante 56 km de la capital del País, la ciudad de Asunción.
La Sra. Adriana posee una despensa y carnicería en su domicilio, debido a su excelente calidad de productos y a su dedicada atención a los clientes cuenta con una gran clientela formada, que muchas veces supera la cantidad de demanda que puede abastecer.
Por eso solicita a la Fundación Paraguaya y Kiva un crédito para la compra de carne en reces, de modo que pueda cumplir la demanda de su clientela y así obtener más ingresos a su unidad familiar.
En el futuro desea seguir trabajando con la Fundación y Kiva para ir creciendo día a día y para asegurar el sustento de su familia.
texts.en:
Adriana is 27 years old.  She is a single mother who lives with her son in her own home, in Cerro Real neighborhood, in the city of Caacupé, 56 km from the country's capital city Asunción.

Adriana has a grocery and butcher's store in her home.  Owing to the excellent quality of her products and her good customer service, she has a large customer base which means her demand sometimes outstrips her ability to supply.

For this reason, Adriana is requesting a loan from Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva so that she can buy beef.  This will enable her to meet her customers' demands and thereby make more income for her family.

In the future, Adriana would like to continue working with Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva so that she can continue to grow every day and ensure the support of her family.

loans.use: to buy beef

loans.name: Victor Eduardo

texts.es:
El señor Victor tiene 27 años de edad, es soltero y vive con sus padres, pues en su país la costumbre es independizarse de la casa paterna al convivir en pareja, es muy inusual independizarse antes, él aún no tiene hijos.
Victor se dedica a la compra, procesamiento  y venta de cueros, tiene experiencia desde hace más de 8 años en el ramo.
Hoy día tiene clientela formada y una gran visión de crecimiento, pues la producción es de buena calidad y con gran aceptación en la zona; según comentó siempre se dedicó en ese ramo ya que su padre le heredó el negocio.
Victor solicita el crédito para comprar cueros al por mayor y así poder incrementar sus ingresos, tiene muchos pedidos y la única forma de satisfacer la demanda es a través de una inyección de capital.
Su máximo sueño es convertir su curtiembre en una gran industria y así aportar trabajo a su comunidad.
texts.en:
Victor is 27 years old, single, and lives with is parents.  In his country, the custom is to leave home to live with a partner; it is very unusual to become independent before that.  He does not yet have any children.

Victor dedicates himself to buying, processing, and selling leather.  He has 8 years of experience in this trade.  Currently, he has a good customer base and a vision of growth for the business.  His products are of good quality and well received in his area.  He commented that he has always been in the trade, having inherited the business from his father.

Victor requests this loan to buy leather at wholesale, which would allow him to increase his income.  He has many orders, and the only way to satisfy demand is through an injection of capital.

His greatest dream is to convert his tannery into a large industry and, in this manner, bring more jobs to his community.

loans.use: buy leather.

loans.name: Mario Ruben

texts.es:
El señor Mario S. tiene 44 años de edad, está casado con la señora Inocencia Benítez desde hace tiempo y tienen 5 hijos pequeños. Viven en su propia casa que está situada en el Barrio Arroyo Pora del distrito de Cambyreta, ciudad de Encarnación.
El señor Mario y su esposa son comerciantes desde hace dos décadas aproximadamente, ellos se dedican a la elaboración y venta de chipas, cocido (bebida paraguaya que se mezcla con leche generalmente), marineras, empanadas y minutas varias, tienen muchos clientes hacia la zona de la Aduana, el circuito comercial y otros.
Gracias a esta actividad ellos han podido salir adelante, pudieron ir ampliando su microempresa y mediante este hecho mantener su hogar, educar a sus hijos y solventar cualquier gasto imprevisto que se le pudiera presentar.
Ellos han solicitado este crédito para la compra de insumos para elaboración de chipas (panificado típico del Paraguay elaborado a base de almidón y mucho queso).
texts.en:
Mario S. is 44 years old, married to Inocencia Benítez for some time, and has 5 small children.  He lives in his own house located in the Arroyo Pora neighborhood, district of Cambyreta, in the city of Encarnación.

Mario and his wife have been in commerce for approximately two decades.  They dedicate themselves to making and selling chipas, cocido (a Paraguayan beverage that is usually mixed with milk), marineras, empanadas, and a variety of smaller dishes.  They have many customers, even to the Aduana zone, the commercial zone and others.

Thanks to this activity, they have both been able to get ahead and expand their enterprise.  Through this means they’ve also been able to maintain their home, educate their children, and meet any unexpected expense that might present itself.

They have requested this loan to buy ingredients for making chipas (a typical Paraguayan bread product made with starch and a lot of cheese).

loans.use: buy ingredients for making chipas:  cheese, starch, cornflour, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Reinaldo Ramon

texts.es:
El Sr. Reinaldo C. tiene 41 años de edad, está casado hace varios años, tiene hijos y todos están en edad escolar aún.
Actualmente posee una gomería y anexo un taller de motocicletas y todo tipo de biciclos, este negocio cuenta con 5 años de antigüedad. 
Se inició con un pequeño capital propio, y con la ayuda de su cónyuge de a poco fue ampliando su gomería y ya más tarde, gracias al esfuerzo pasó a brindar un servicio de asistencia a motociclistas y todo tipo de biciclos, la experiencia lo adquirió trabajando varios años como chofer de grúa.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de repuestos, cubiertas y herramientas manuales.
texts.en:
Reinaldo C. is 41 years old, married, and has children that are all still in school.  Currently, he has a tire shop and an annex with a motorcycle and bicycle repair shop.  He’s had the business for 5 years.

He started with a small amount of his own capital and, with his wife’s help, he expanded his tire shop little by little.  Later, thanks to his efforts, he was able to start a service helping motorcycle and bike riders with repairs.  He got the experience by working several years as a crane operator.

He requests this loan to buy replacement parts, covers, and tools.

loans.use: buy replacement parts, covers, and tools.

loans.name: Aida Rosalia

texts.es:
La Sra. Aida B. D. R. tiene 30 años D. edad, es casada y vive en el Barrio Primero D. Marzo D. la Ciudad D. Coronel Oviedo.
Aida es una señora muy sacrificada, se dedica a la peluqueria que montó gracias a un préstamo que realizó en una etapa anterior a esta, ahora solicita este préstamo para comprar más insumos como shampoo, cremas D. enjuague, fijadores y otros tantos materiales para su stock, porque tiene muchos clientes.
Se acercó a la Fundación Paraguaya en busca D. apoyo y está muy contenta porque la institución le haya podido ofrecer la posibilidad D. solicitar un crédito, D. esa forma podría mejorar el servicio a sus clientes y dar un mayor ingreso a su familia, ayudándole a su marido con los gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
Aida Benites D. R. is 30 years old, married, and lives in the Primero D. Marzo neighborhood of the city of Coronel Oviedo.

She has sacrificed much, and dedicates herself to hairdressing.  She started out thanks to a loan maD. previous to this one, and now she requests this credit to buy more supplies such as shampoos, conditioners, hairspray and other supplies as she has many customers.

She came to Fundación Paraguaya seeking support, and is very happy because the institution has been able to offer her the opportunity to have access to a loan.  This would allow her to serve her customers better and proviD. more income for her family, which helps her husband with the household expenses.

loans.use: buy supplies for her business such as shampoos, conditioners and hairspray.

loans.name: Chey

texts.en: Chey V., 41, is widowed and resides in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia, an area known for rubber plantations. V. is a teacher at a public school, earning an income of about 4.33 USD per day. Each month, the family has to spend 46 USD on food and 12 USD on the other necessary expenses. V. is requesting a loan of 600 USD to purchase corn to grow for sale. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to purchase corn to grow for sale

loans.name: Vat

texts.en: Vat T., 52, is a farmer in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She has income of about 1.80 USD per day. Her husband, Kim Von, is 46. His job is buying cows for resale, earning an income of about 3.33 USD per day. They have 3 children who work in factories. Each month, the family has to spend 61 USD on food, 2 USD on utilities and 20 USD on the other necessary expenses. Vat T. is requesting a loan of 800 USD to purchase cows for resale. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long- standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy cows to resell

loans.name: Sreng

texts.en: Sreng V., 46, resides in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She is a farmer, pig raiser, and sells vegetables and dried fish. She has income of about 4.51 USD per day. Her husband, Chres Ly, is 51. His job is buying cows for resale, earning an income about 16.66 USD per day. They have 2 children; one is a student. Each month, the family has to spend 33.5 USD on food, 22.5 USD for their child’s fee for studying, and 35 USD on the other necessary expenses. Sreng V. is requesting a loan of 1,000 USD to purchase cows for resale. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner. V. appears in the photograph with her husband.

loans.use: to buy cows to resell

loans.name: Alberto Dionisio

texts.es:
El sr. Alberto Dionisio B. tiene 41 años y está casado con la sra. Blanca Mendoza de 32 años, tienen 3 hijos, uno de 16 que está cursando la secundaria y dos menores de 9 y 5 años respectivamente que están cursando sus estudios primarios. Viven en la ciudad de Villa Elisa.
El sr. Alberto se dedica a la venta de leña y metros de maderas a la empresa Cerámica San Isidro de la ciudad de Nueva Italia. El paga por hectáreas al propietario del inmueble en el cual podan los árboles, de los cuales hacen luego la leña y el metro. Para ello cuenta con motosierras y un camión mediante el cual traslada su mercadería hasta la localidad de cerámica.
Alberto solicita el préstamo para invertirlo en capital de trabajo, pagando las hectáreas en las cuales trabaja y así no fallar en su trabajo ni a su familia, ya que él los mantiene dignamente.
texts.en:
Alberto Dionisio B. is 41 years old, married to Blanca Mendoza, 32 years of age, and they have 3 children.  One is 16 and in secondary school, and the two younger ones are 9 and 5 and in primary school.  They live in the city of Villa Elisa.

Alberto dedicates himself to selling wood to the Cerámica San Isidro corporation in the city of Nueva Italia.  He pays the owner of the land from which he takes the lumber by the hectare.  He has trucks that he uses to transport his merchandise to the ceramics business.

Alberto requests this loan to use as working capital, paying for the land where he works.  This way, he won’t fail in his business or for his family, who he supports with dignity.

loans.use: to pay for leasing hectares of land for wood.

loans.name: Nou

texts.en: Nou C., 52, is married and resides in Takeo province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorean temples. She is a farmer and has raised chickens since 2000, earning an income about 1 USD per day. Her husband is a construction worker, earning an income about 5 USD per day. They have 3 children who work. They earn 9.5 USD per day. Each month, the family has to spend 75 USD on food, 5 USD on utility expenses, 15 USD in fees and 80 USD on the other necessary expenses. C. is requesting a loan of 1,200 USD to open a motor repair station and purchase the equipment. This will be her second loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to open a motor repair station

loans.name: Noun's Group

texts.en:
There are five members forming this group loan. Mrs. Noun is a group leader selected by the other members. Each member of this group will use their money to support their different purpose.

Mrs. Noun is a farmer who owns a plot of land that she uses to grow rice for a living. Her husband, Mr. Chea, is a construction worker who is able to earn a small salary to support his family.  They have a child who is attending the local school. 

In order to support her husband's work, Mrs. Noun would like to ask for a loan to buy a motorcycle for her husband's transportation.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for her husband's transportation.

loans.name: Heng

texts.en: Heng S., 50, is married and resides in Takeo province, Cambodia. She sells cow ties, earning an income of about 8.3 USD per day. She has 2 children; one is a laborer and the other a grocer, earning an income of about 2.3 USD each per day. Each month, the family has to spend 75 USD on food, 5 USD on utility expenses and 90 USD on other necessary expenses. S. is requesting a loan of 1,000 USD to produce rice wine and raise pigs. This will be her second loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to produce rice wine and raise pigs

loans.name: Emilce Concepcion

texts.es:
La señora Emilce Concepcion B. R. cuenta  con 30 años de edad, es  madre, sus hijas están en edad escolar.
Ella se dedica al comercio independiente de productos cosméticos de una afamada marca, pero quiere contar con un stock de mercaderias mas variado, de manera a satisfacer las diversas necedidades de sus clientes y de esa manera aumentar el volumen de ventas.
El objetivo por el que trabaja duro cada día Emilce es, además de la manutención de sus hijas, establecer un local comercial y de esa manera ofertar los productos que hoy no está pudiendo ofrecer a falta de la economía necesaria.  
Ella solicita el crédito para poder comprar cosméticos de otras marcas y otros productos como bijouteries y prendas íntimas.
texts.en:
Emilce Concepcion B. R. is 30 years old.  She is a mother and has school-age daughters.

Emilce sells a well-known brand of cosmetics independently.  However, she would like to have a more varied stock of merchandise so that she can meet the diverse needs of her customers and, in this way, increase her sales volume.

The goal towards which Emilce works hard every day, in addition to supporting her daughters, is that of setting up a sales location and selling products that she can't sell right now because she doesn't have the necessary money.

Emilce is requesting a loan to buy other brands of cosmetics and other products such as costume jewelry and lingerie.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and other products to sell

loans.name: Sor's Group

texts.en:
This group loan consists of six members who will use their portions of the loan for different purposes. Mrs. Sor, born in 1965, is the group leader selected by the other members.

Mrs. Sor's husband, Mr. Kuch, is a security guard who is able to earn a small salary to support his family. This couple has three children: one is a motorbike taxi driver, one is a fish seller, and one is a seamstress in a garment factory. 

Mrs. Sor earns a living by selling groceries. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it. Thus she decided to ask for a loan to buy more groceries.

loans.use: To buy more groceries to enlarge her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy cow ties to sell

loans.name: 80 Quảng Hưng Group

texts.en:
Cúc N. Thị is a 58-year-old woman is married and has one adult-aged child. She lives in the town of Thanh Hoá. Cúc is the group leader of a three-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women (FPW). While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 80 Quảng Hưng (18-3-80 Quảng Hưng).

Cúc raises livestock to sell. She has been in business for over nine years and earns approximately 500,000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2011, Cúc joined FPW to gain access to its financial services. She is requesting her first loan from FPW, 4,248,000 VND which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. Cúc plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business.

About the Other Borrowers in the Group:

1. H. Thị Minh is a 61-year-old woman who raises livestock. She is requesting a 4,248,000 VND loan.

2. P. Thị Vinh is a 47-year-old female who also raises livestock. She is requesting a 4,248,000 VND loan.

About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in Cambodia’s Thanh Hoa province.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: Kol

texts.en:
Kol P., 50, is married and resides in Takeo province, Cambodia. She is a cow producer and she raises pigs and chickens. Kol earns about 1.60 USD per day. Her husband is construction worker who earns about 3.30 USD daily. The couple has two children who work in a garment factory, earning about 3 USD per day. Each month, the family has to spend 180 USD on food, utilities, fees and other necessary expenses. 

Koh is requesting a loan of 750 USD to buy a motorcycle for her children to use to go to work. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for her children to commute to work.

loans.name: Felix

texts.es:
El Sr. Felix está casado con la Sra. Segunda hace varios años, tienen 4 hijos mayores, todos casados e independientes a ellos.
Juntos montaron una despensa en su casa, que está ubicada en un barrio muy poblado de la zona, se iniciaron con un pequeño capital que consiguieron con otros trabajos que han realizado anteriormente como asalariados.
Gracias al trabajo que están realizando actualmente han educado a sus hijos y han comprado todas las comodidades para su hogar.
El Sr. Felix además de la despensa trabaja como empaquetador de carbón en su mismo domicilio.
Él ha demostrado ser una persona muy responsable y honesta en sus compromisos, ya obtuvo otros créditos con la institución y cumplió en forma excelente con sus obligaciones.
Nuevamente solicita otro crédito para poder comprar mercaderías para su despensa como arroz, fideos, azúcar, frutas y verduras.
texts.en:
Felix has been married to Segunda for several years.  They have four grown-up children who are all married and live independently.  Together they set up a grocery store in their home which is located in a very densely-populated neighborhood.  They started out with a small amount of capital that they made from salaried jobs that they had previously.

Thanks to the work that they are currently engaged in, they have managed to educate their children and bought all the comforts they need for their home.  In addition to working in their grocery store, Felix also works packing charcoal at home.  He has shown himself to be a very responsible and honest person in his obligations.  He has received previous loans from the institution and met his obligations perfectly.

Felix is requesting this new loan so that he can buy merchandise for his grocery store such as rice, noodles, sugar, fruit and vegetables.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for his grocery store such as rice, noodles, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Linh's Group

texts.en:
Fifteen people have made a village bank loan group. Mrs. Linh was born in 1956 is the village bank president; she was selected by the other members. Each member of this loan group will use their portion of the loan differently.

Her husband, Mr. Ngin, who was born in 1952, is a teacher and earns a small salary. He also helps his wife to farm. They have three children: one is a wedding beautician, one works for an MFI, and one is a student. 

Mrs. Linh is a farmer who owns a plot of land which she uses to grow rice and taro. She would like to ask for a loan to buy taro root for growing on her farm.

loans.use: to buy taro root for growing.

loans.name: Gumercinda

texts.es:
La Sra. Gumercinda tiene 45 años de edad, está casada y tiene dos hijas, ambas mayores de edad, vive cerca del centro de la ciudad de Itá donde posee una despensa desde hace más de 6 años, allí surte a sus vecinos y a ocasionales clientes de todo tipo de artículos de primera necesidad para el hogar, como por ejemplo azúcar, yerba, carbón, lácteos, bebidas en general, fideo, embutidos y otras mercaderías.
Su hija la ayuda a atender la despensa cuando ella va al mercado y realiza la compra de mercaderías, en el centro de Itá, para reponer sus productos vendidos.
Posee mucha clientela, y sus ventas las realiza al contado.
Ella opera con la Fundación Paraguaya desde el año 2006, demostrando puntualidad en el pago de todas sus cuotas. En esta ocasión solicita el crédito para la compra de más mercaderías para su despensa.
texts.en:
Gumercinda is 45 years old, married, and has two grown-up daughters.  She lives near Itá city center where she has owned a grocery store for more than six years.  There she serves her neighbors and other customers with basic household products such as sugar, yerba, charcoal, dairy products, drinks, noodles, cold cuts and other merchandise.  Her daughter helps her by serving in the store when she goes to the market in the center of Itá to buy merchandise to replace the products she has sold.

Gumercinda has a lot of customers and she sells her products for cash.  She has been working with Fundación Paraguaya since 2006 and has shown punctuality in making all of her repayments.  On this occasion, she is requesting a loan to buy more merchandise for her grocery store.

loans.use: to buy sugar, yerba, charcoal, dairy products, drinks, cold cuts and other merchandise

loans.name: Pann's Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan consists of thirteen members.  Mrs. Pann is the village bank president.  She was selected to be the village bank president by the others members.

Mrs. Pann is a pig breeder who is able to earn a small income to support her family.  With this business, she would like to ask for a loan to buy pig feed for pig breeding.  Aside from pig breeding, she is also a farmer who owns a plot of land which she uses to grow different vegetables. 

Mrs. Pann was born in 1953, is widow with a child who is a student who also helps the mother's businesses.

loans.use: To buy pig feed for pig breeding.

loans.name: 79 Quảng Hưng Group

texts.en:
Nụ N. Thị is a 22 year-old female who lives in the town of Thanh Hoá. She is the group leader of a three-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 79 Quảng Hưng (18-05-79 Quảng Hưng).

Nụ is married and has one infant-aged child. To making a living, she owns and operates a general store. Nu’s main source of income comes from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, and toothpaste in the local community. She has been engaged in this business for over three years and earns approximately 3,000,000 VND a month.

Nụ joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women in 2011 to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nu is requesting a loan of 4,248,000 VND to purchase additional products to sell. This is her first loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Nụ plans to use the additional revenue generated with her loan to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About the Other Borrowers in the Group:

1.  H. Thị Liên is an 18 year-old female who is requesting a 4,248,000 VND loan to support her business making and selling food.

2.  N. Thị Tâm  is a 33 year-old female who is requesting a 4,248,000 VND loan to support her fishing business. 


About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Jorge Emanuel

texts.es:
El joven Jorge V. de 19 años de edad, es soltero, cuenta con una casa de repuestos para automóviles de procedencia japonesa, anexo realiza carga de baterías.
Gracias a que trabaja puede solventar sus gastos y es estudiante universitario, pero además cuenta con la ayuda de su padre, quien es militar jubilado.
Solicita dicho préstamo a la Fundación Paraguaya y a Kiva para la compra de aceite para tambores de automóviles, desea realizar la venta en una cantidad mayor para poder abastecer a los clientes.
Jorge agradece a Kiva por la oportunidad de estar en el sitio web y presentar su caso, porque gracias a eso él podría conseguir la ayuda crediticia que necesita para poder seguir brindando servicios de buena calidad y a buen precio.
texts.en:
Jorge V. is 19 years old, single, and owns an auto parts shop where he sells parts for Japanese vehicles.  He also charges batteries.

Thanks to his work, he is able to cover his expenses.  Jorge is a university student but he also has the help of his father who is a retired soldier.  He is requesting this loan from Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva so that he can buy oil for vehicle drums.  He would like to be able to sell in larger quantities so that he can supply his customers.

Jorge is grateful to Kiva for the opportunity of appearing on their website and presenting his case because it means that he will be able to receive the loan that he needs in order to continue providing good-quality services to his customers, at a good price.

loans.use: to buy oil for vehicle drums

loans.name: Long's Group

texts.en:
There are seventeen people who form this village bank loan.  Mrs. Long is the village bank president.  She was selected as the village bank president by the others members.

Her husband, Mr. Khin is a motorcycle taxi driver who is able to earn a small income to help support his family.  They have four children: two of whom are seamstresses in the garment factories, one is a construction worker, and one is a security guard. 

Mrs. Long wants to earn income to help support her family.  Thus, she would like to ask for a loan for making Chinese noodle soup and congee (porridge) for selling.  With her new businesses, she hopes to increase income to help support her family condition.

loans.use: For making Chinese noodle soup and congee (porridge) for selling.

loans.name: Seak

texts.en:
Seak N. is 29 years old and married. She resides in Takeo province, Cambodia. Seak weaves traditional silk to sell and earns an income of about 2 USD per day. Her husband is a construction worker who earns about 4.3 USD daily. Each month, the family has to spend 110 USD on necessary expenses. 

Seak is requesting a loan of 600 USD to buy silk to weave into traditional products to sell. This will be her second first loan from CREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy silk to weave into traditional products to sell.

loans.name: Chea's Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan consists of twelve members led by Mrs Chea, a married woman born in 1971 who was selected to be the village bank president by the others members.

Chea and her husband are seamstresses in the garment factories, able to earn some money to help support their family. Chea is now requesting a loan to fix up their house. This couple has a child who stays at home.

loans.use: to fix up her house.

loans.name: Hugo Zacarias

texts.es:
El Sr. Hugo tiene 57 años, está casado y tiene cuatro hijos, de los cuales dos ya están casados y dos aún dependen él.
Se dedica al micro-comercio, posee un vehículo con el cual sale a hacer sus ventas por las zonas de la Cordillera (tercer departamento del Paraguay que comprende varias ciudades) y una vez por semana hacia la zona de San Pedro (segundo departamento del Paraguay ubicado en la frontera).
Cuenta con clientela formada desde hace casi 2 años, tiempo que inició su dedicación al macate o venta ambulante.
El crédito lo destinará a la compra de embutidos y golosinas, pues con esto aumentará su stock y posibilitará la satisfacción de gran parte de su demanda, podrá mejorar sus ingresos con los cuales cubre las necesidades básicas de su familia y los gastos de la universidad de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Hugo is 57 years old, married, and has four children.  Two of his children are already married and the other two are still dependent on him.

Hugo has a micro business.  He owns a vehicle which he uses to make his sales in areas of Cordillera (a department - administrative area - which is made up of several cities).  Once a week he travels to San Pedro (a neighboring department).  He has had an established customer base for almost two years which is when he started work as a traveling salesman.

Hugo will use his loan to buy cold meats and soda as this will enable him to increase his stock and meet a large part of his demand.  He will be able to improve his income which he uses to cover the basic needs of his family and his children's university expenses.

loans.use: to buy cold meats and soda

loans.name: Tuvshinbold

texts.en:
Mr. Tuvshinbold is 28 years old and lives with his wife, mother-in-law and dog (a German shepherd) in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. They live in a family house which Tuvshinbold built last year. 

His wife Bayannuur, 26, works in a Cashmere factory as a planning officer. Mr. Tuvshinbold is professional welder but currently he runs a taxi business, carrying people around Ulaanbaatar city and bringing extra income to the family. He earns around $290 a month from his taxi business. 

The house he built is not complete yet and the entrance, windows and insulation needs to be done. The Mongolian winter is one of the harshest in the world. The temperature in winter time, especially at night, drops to -40 degrees of Celsius. Therefore, the houses should be well-insulated from the cold. Currently most households in Ulaanbaatar city use coal fired stoves for heating which pollutes the air to dangerous level. The Mongolian government takes some measures to improve the air quality by helping to replace coal fired stoves to gas ones and improve the insulation of the houses. Well-insulated houses require less charcoal to burn, emitting less poisonous smoke into the air and helps to save on heating costs of households. 

The loan he is asking for will be used to pay for insulation materials for the walls, double-glazed windows and other building materials to finish the house and to make the house warm and well-insulated from the cold.

loans.use: to pay for insulation materials for the walls, double-glazed windows and other building materials to finish the entrance and to make the house warm and well-insulated.

loans.name: Sam

texts.en:
Sam M. is able to earn a living by selling a few items in a public school, in Battambang province. She sells such items as study materials, sweets, and soft drinks. From this sales business, she usually generates an income of around $4 per day. She has a life partner in her husband who makes revenue as a horse cart deliverer in and around his community. They have five single children; one of them assists Sam M. in the same business while the others are studying. 

Recently, part of Sam M.’s inventory has been exhausted; she wants to resupply and is requesting a loan to expand her inventory to continue selling. With the remainder of the  funds, she will buy a new horse for her husband to replace the old one.

loans.use: to buy additional items to continue selling.

loans.name: Pedro Pablo

texts.es:
El señor Pedro G. tiene 58 años de edad está en pareja con la señora María Gomez, quien tiene 63 años de edad, ambos son de la ciudad de Caacupe, distante a unos 55 kilómetros de la ciudad capital (Asunción). La pareja no tiene hijos.
El señor Pedro vive en el barrio Loma Guazú de la ciudad de Caacupe. En su domicilio cuenta con una chipería desde hace 15 años.
Su venta lo realiza en forma ambulante en la capital del país (Asunción) de lunes a viernes. Y los fines de semana tiene su puesto de venta frente a la iglesia de Tupasy Ykua (Pozo de la Virgen), en la capital espiritual del país (Caacupe).
Por más que el señor Pedro y su señora trabajen mucho poseen algunas necesidades que cubrir, por eso solicita el crédito para la compra de insumos (queso y almidón) para hacer chipas al por mayor antes de que incrementen los precios por temporada de semana santa.
texts.en:
Pedro G. is 58 years old and lives with 63 year-old Maria Gomez.  They are both from the city of Caacupé which is located 55 kilometers from the capital city of Asunción.  They do not have children.

Pedro lives in Loma Guazú neighborhood, in the city of Caacupé.  He has had a 'chipería' (a bakery where he makes cheese bread) in his home for 15 years.

Pedro makes his sales as an itinerant street vendor in the city's capital (Asunción), from Monday to Friday.  On weekends, he sets up a sales stall opposite Tupasy Ykua Church (El Pozo de la Virgen - The Virgin's Well), in the spiritual capital of the country (Caacupé).

Although Pedro and his wife work hard, they are lacking some things which they need.  For this reason, Pedro is requesting a loan to buy supplies (cheese and starch) to make 'chipas' (cheese bread) wholesale before the prices rise for Semana Santa (Holy Week).

loans.use: to buy supplies for making 'chipa' wholesale (cheese and starch)

loans.name: Hairolla

texts.en:
Hairolla, 45, is married and lives with his wife and three children in a house in Bayan-Ulgii province, Mongolia. His two older children, ages 10 and 12, attend local secondary school while the youngest one, 7 months old, stays at home. 

Hairolla manages an animal rawhide and herd-trading business between Bayan-Ulgii province and Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. He started his business in 2004. He collects animal rawhides from Bayan-Ulgii herders and sells them to traders of Ulaanbaatar. Now his daily sales exceed 15,000-25,000 MNT with a net profit of 15-20%. His business was quite profitable which allowed him to deposit 10 million MNT. He is an honest and hard-working man who says, "I am planning to deposit more in the future." He is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to purchase more hides and cashmere for his business.

loans.use: To purchase more hides and cashmere

loans.name: Dul's Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan consists of 14 members led by Mrs. Dul, who was selected as the village bank president by the other members. Dul is a farmer who owns a plot of land upon which she grows rice for a living. Because farming does not provide sufficient earnings, she is requesting a loan to make Khmer cakes for sale to improve her ability to support her family.

Dul, a widow born in 1970, is the mother of three children, all students who also help their mother in her business.

loans.use: to make Khmer cakes to sell.

loans.name: Yeth

texts.en:
Yeth S. is a 31-year-old married woman who has been earning a daily income by working at the garment factory. She is able to get a fixed salary from her job of around $1.50 per day. Beside this work, she has also been planting rice which is her annual business. Her husband is a sour palm juice seller in Baray district. 

Yeth S. is looking for a loan as capital to support her farming business. She will use the loan to pay for plowing which she has hired out before and to buy fertilizer and rice seed. Yeth S. has three children who are attending school.

loans.use: to pay for plowing costs and to buy fertilizer and rice seed.

loans.name: Basilia

texts.es:
La Sra. Basilia está casada con el Sr. Flaminio, tienen dos hijos mayores, uno D. ellos ya está casado e independiente a ella, pero su hija aún vive con ella, y está estudiando la carrera D. enfermería.
Basilia tiene una negocio donD. venD. todo tipo D. utensilios para el hogar.
Ella es muy conocida en su barrio por la variedad D. mercaderías que tiene para la venta, desD. antigüedades hasta las últimas novedades.
Se inició con pocos productos pero fue juntando poco a poco sus ahorros y hoy día posee una tienda donD. se dedica en tiempo y alma.
Su marido también trabaja, es taxista y con esos ingresos se ayudan mutuamente para cubrir los gastos del hogar.
Hemos confiado en Basilia en otros créditos anteriores y ha cumplido con total cabalidad sus compromisos. 
Ha demostrado ser una persona muy responsable y con ganas D. superación, tiene un espíritu jovial y emprendedor.
Hoy día solicita el crédito para la compra D. más mercaderías para su negocio, como lámparas, adornos para el hogar, y algunos artículos D. limpieza, ya que su tienda es muy variada.
texts.en:
Basilia is married to Flaminio.  They have two grown-up children.  One of their children is already married and lives independently.  However, her daughter still lives with her and is studying to be a nurse.

Basilia has a business where she sells all types of household products.  She is very well known in her neighborhood for the variety of merchandise that she sells, from antiques to the very latest products.  She started out with just a few products but gradually saved up and now she has a store to which she devotes both her time and her soul.  Basilia's husband also works.  He is a taxi driver.  With their joint income they help each other to cover their household expenses.

We have trusted Basilia with previous loans and she has fully met her obligations.  She has shown herself to be a very responsible person who has a desire to improve herself.  She has a cheerful and enterprising spirit.

Basilia is requesting this loan to buy more merchandise for her business such as lamps, household decorations and some cleaning products since her store offers a wiD. range of goods.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise for her business such as lamps, household decorations and some cleaning products

loans.name: Maria Liz Carina

texts.es:
La señora Maria Liz Carina de 29 años de edad, vive con el padre de su hijo Thiago Santiago de 8 meses de edad, la señora es comerciante de la ciudad de Villarrica y propietaria de una conocida casa de Venta y Reparación de celulares.
Además se dedica a la venta de accesorios electrónicos en general.
Su negocio es conocido en la zona por su buen inventario de mercaderías y ella es catalogada por su buen trato, gracias a su carisma posee clientela variada y abundante.
